Title: Data Scientist (L5) - Studio Metrics & Strategy - EMEA
Description:
Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with 283 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.

The Studio Metrics & Strategy DSE team leverages data to empower our business partners in the Content Operations & Innovation organization to measure, interrogate, and steer Content Operations with precision and clarity. This facilitates operational excellence in content production, enabling creative teams to produce the best movies and shows that we know members will love.

EMEA is a growing center for our broader Content Production & Promotion teams. We are looking for a stunning Senior Data Scientist based in Amsterdam to join our growing EMEA team. In this role, you will partner with Content Operations & Innovation and Product teams to empower how we produce the best content efficiently and effectively. Through thoughtful metric design and causal inference modeling, you will have the opportunity to directly influence both strategic and tactical decision-making around how we produce and innovate on global content production.

As a Senior Data Scientist in this space, you will…


Be the first Applied Inference Data Scientist in the Content Production Data Science & Engineering org
Be a strategic thought partner for Content Operations & Innovation leaders and teams, identifying metric and analytic opportunities to assess and enhance business health
Advance content operations efficiency through the effective identification and application of analytics and causal inference methods
Drive the direction of your work, including leading the design, analysis, and interpretation of experiments
Present your research and findings to both technical and non-technical business and product partners
Establish and maintain strong partnerships with a variety of business and product stakeholders, working directly with them to introduce and influence data-informed ways of working
Work with other outstanding Data Scientists and Analytics Engineers, in-region and globally, to explore our wealth of operational data and uncover insights that enable Netflix to produce even better shows and movies for our members
Become a regional expert on all things Studio Data Science & Engineering, helping educate and connect regional offices to existing research data solutions from across the team


About You…


Advanced degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Economics, or related quantitative field
5+ years of relevant experience with a variety of causal inference methods, including quasi-experimental designs and managing complexities around smaller sample sizes
Strong statistical knowledge and intuition, ideally utilized in experimentation or observational causal analysis settings
An expert in SQL and Python
Proven track record wrangling data, performing exploratory data analysis, designing metrics and tests, building causal inference solutions, and articulating data stories to deliver meaningful business impact
Strong verbal and written communicator who can develop and deepen effective relationships with a wide variety of stakeholders and communicate technical concepts clearly and concisely to less technical audiences
A self-starter with a learning mindset who is exceptionally curious – eagerly diving into new spaces and bringing informed ideas to the table
Comfortable operating in ambiguity and a fast-paced environment; able to take ownership and thrive with minimal oversight and process
Thrilled about innovating in the Content Production domain via novel experimental techniques and comfortable taking (smart) risks in your work
Extensive experience within the EMEA region, adept at working across different cultures on a globally-distributed team, collaborating with fellow team members and partners to ideate on and deliver impactful research
Netflix culture resonates with you
Plus: Experience creating data products and dashboards such as Tableau
Plus: Experience building applied machine learning models with demonstrated business impact


Inclusion is a Netflix value and we strive to host a meaningful interview experience for all candidates. If you want an accommodation/adjustment for a disability or any other reason during the hiring process, please send a request to your recruiting partner.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Kom werken bij CloudNation, waar we de kracht van data en AI benutten om industrieën te innoveren en te transformeren. We zijn een dynamisch team van gedreven professionals, ondernemers en tech-enthousiastelingen die zich inzetten voor het leveren van baanbrekende oplossingen.




Functieomschrijving:

We zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde Machine Learning Engineer om ons snelgroeiende AI-team te versterken. Bij CloudNation helpen we onze klanten om hun weg te vinden in het complexe en snel evoluerende AI-landschap.




Het aanbod:

Bruto maandsalaris tussen de €4.000,- en €5.500,-

Bij hard werken hoort een passende beloning. Dat snappen we bij CloudNation goed. Daarom krijg je bij ons een 'rebel package' met de volgende perks:

The usual: Een goed salaris dat past bij je verantwoordelijkheden, skills en ervaring plus laptop en telefoon van de zaak. Je mag kiezen: MacBook, Windows, iPhone, Android.
Ook goed geregeld: Mobiliteitsbudget, pensioen, thuiswerkvergoeding, studiebudget.
Work hard, play harder: Je krijgt van ons 26 vakantiedagen + 1 extra per 6 maanden niet ziek (2 extra dus totaal 28), omdat we vrije tijd voor dingen waar je écht blij van wordt ook belangrijk vinden.
Bij CloudNation hanteren wij hybride werken: dat betekent een combinatie tussen werken op kantoor, bij de klant en thuiswerken. Workation is in goed overleg ook mogelijk.
Samenwerken en plezier hebben: AWS en Azure dagen op woensdag en maandag. Ook belangrijk: een grote keuken voorzien van alle gemakken om samen te lunchen. Vanaf 16.00
uur borreltijd!
Nog meer plezier: Elke laatste vrijdag van de maand houden we de Grote CloudNation Vrijmibo! Met snacks, drinken en zo veel mogelijk CloudNation rebel's aanwezig.
TGIF: Elke vrijdagochtend worden er een virtuele meetings gehouden m.b.t. Share & Inspire en Deep Dive. En de week wordt afgesloten met wederom borreltijd.
En veel meer: bedrijfsuitjes naar de sneeuw of Berlijn, tafelvoetbal, darten, gamen, om mee te spelen en vrij in te vullen, company funded, teambuilding activiteiten.




Belangrijkste verantwoordelijkheden:

Ontwikkelen en onderhouden van op Python gebaseerde back-enddiensten (FastAPI).
Betrokken zijn bij het bouwen en gebruiken van REST API's.
Samenwerken aan machine learning-projecten, inclusief het implementeren van modellen en het integreren van AI/ML-functionaliteiten.
Deelnemen aan de volledige ontwikkelingscyclus, inclusief ontwerp, codering, testen en productie-implementatie.
Werken in een teamomgeving om nieuwe ideeën te bedenken en bestaande processen te verbeteren.
Communiceren met klanten.




Gewenste vaardigheden:

Ervaring met frontend-ontwikkeling in React en TypeScript is een pluspunt.
Ervaring met data-engineering.
Bekendheid met Docker, microservices-architecturen en cloudomgevingen.
Kennis van Large Language Models (LLM's) en machine learning-frameworks.




Kwalificaties, jij hebt:

2-5 jaar ervaring en een achtergrond in software engineering (backend focus).
Ervaring met RAG/agentic applicaties
Ervaring met (web) engineering
ML/DS staat op tweede plek ten opzichte van de web engineering skill set
Een bachelor in informatica of aanverwante gebieden, of gelijkwaardige praktische ervaring.
Sterke probleemoplossende vaardigheden en het vermogen om samen te werken in een team.
Een ondernemende instelling en de bereidheid om verantwoordelijkheid te nemen voor je werk.
Het vermogen om snel nieuwe technologieën te begrijpen.
Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden.




Onze stack is op dit moment:

Backend: Python (FastAPI) (belangrijk)
Azure, AWS, Docker, GitHub Actions
Frontend: TypeScript (React) (geen must, ervaring wel een plus)

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Are you a Machine Learning enthusiast passionate about turning data into actionable insights and building scalable solutions? Join a forward-thinking company in the vibrant city of Rotterdam, leading the way in innovation with market leading platforms for analytics, machine learning, and real-time processing.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, build, and optimize machine learning models to solve complex business challenges.
Develop and maintain scalable pipelines to support training, evaluation, and deployment of ML models.
Collaborate with data engineers, scientists, and business stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver impactful ML solutions.
Implement robust monitoring and retraining pipelines to ensure model accuracy and performance.
Stay at the forefront of the field, exploring new ML techniques and technologies to enhance the organization’s capabilities.




Requirements:

Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
2+ years in a Machine Learning Engineer or related role.
Hands-on experience building and deploying machine learning models in production.
Proficiency in Python and ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn).
Experience with orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow, Prefect).
Knowledge of MLOps practices for managing the ML lifecycle.




What We Offer:

Competitive salary up to €90,000 gross per year.
Flexible hybrid working model with 2 days in the Rotterdam office.
Comprehensive benefits package, including a generous pension plan, mobility budget, and a dedicated training budget.
A collaborative, inclusive work environment with opportunities for professional growth.
A modern office in the heart of Rotterdam, easily accessible by public transport.




If you’re passionate about building scalable ML solutions and want to be at the forefront of innovation, we’d love to hear from you!




📧 Email: euan.mccaul-gallimore@vividresourcing.com




📞 Call: +31 (0) 203 997 864

Show more

  • Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
  • 2+ years in a Machine Learning Engineer or related role.
  • Hands-on experience building and deploying machine learning models in production.
  • Proficiency in Python and ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn).
  • Experience with orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow, Prefect).
  • Knowledge of MLOps practices for managing the ML lifecycle.


What We Offer:

  • Competitive salary up to €90,000 gross per year.
  • Flexible hybrid working model with 2 days in the Rotterdam office.
  • Comprehensive benefits package, including a generous pension plan, mobility budget, and a dedicated training budget.
  • A collaborative, inclusive work environment with opportunities for professional growth.
  • A modern office in the heart of Rotterdam, easily accessible by public transport.


If you’re passionate about building scalable ML solutions and want to be at the forefront of innovation, we’d love to hear from you!


📧 Email: euan.mccaul-gallimore@vividresourcing.com


📞 Call: +31 (0) 203 997 864

Title: Data Scientist - VPR - Rotterdam
Description:
Company Description

VPR Energy BV is part of the Vitol Group, a global leader in the energy and commodities sector. With key operations in Houston, London, Singapore, Rotterdam, and 40 other offices worldwide, Vitol serves the world’s energy markets. Vitol invests globally in traditional and sustainable energy assets, including 17mm³ of storage, 500+ kbpd of refining capacity, and more than 7,000 service stations.

VPR Energy

Located in the Europoort-Rotterdam area, VPR Energy BV operates the most dynamic refinery owned by the world’s largest independent energy and commodities trading company. Our highly efficient and flexible 120 kbpd topping refinery processes gas condensate and crude oil into naphtha, jet fuel, gasoil, and residual fuel. These valuable products serve as feedstock in the petrochemical industry or as energy to heat homes and fuel marine vessels.

Every day, we leverage our expertise in refining crude and condensate blends, striving to be best in class in terms of energy reductions and sustainability targets. Our operations are managed from our office in Europoort Rotterdam by a small, highly engaged team with extensive knowledge and experience in processing, operations, and logistics. Our people build our reputation as a leading player in the energy markets through their creativity, commitment, professionalism, and entrepreneurial spirit.

As VPR Energy continues to grow steadily, we are seeking the next member to join our innovative team.

Job Description

The Data Scientist will act as an important support for the wider VPR performance team, using expertise to improve and enhance business activities. Core responsibilities include:


Writing and implementing algorithms to extract, structure, and analyze data
Applying existing software and tools, or developing new ones (including new data science methods and techniques) to transform unstructured, raw data into usable business information
Translating insights obtained from data into concrete recommendations for business operations in written reports, dashboards, or presentations
Managing and enhancing data streams and analyses
Automating tasks such as data collection


Qualifications


Minimum Bachelor’s degree in a STEM field (for example econometrics, engineering, or mathematics)
2 – 5 years of relevant working experience
Strong database programming skills (such as Python and SQL) and excellent knowledge of Excel
Experience with CI/CD processes (e.g., Git)
Ability to convey complex analysis in a concise and understandable manner
Enjoys working in a dynamic environment
A good command of the Dutch and English language


Additional Information


Contribute directly to a large variety of projects
Be part of a small and flat organization with lots of creative freedom
Free in-house lunch, freshly prepared and catered daily
Potential for travel to our Geneva and London office
Competitive compensation and benefits package
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Coders Connect is partnering with a cutting-edge start-up that is revolutionizing how businesses leverage data for decision-making. The company focuses on building advanced forecasting solutions that help drive sustainability efforts and optimize resource use. They're looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join their team and be part of creating their first commercial MVP.




What you'll do:

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a critical role in developing data-driven insights and helping shape the company's long-term success. Your responsibilities will include:

Building the First Product: Collaborate in a cross-functional team to design, optimize, and deploy both the forecasting algorithms and data visuals that will power the company's first MVP.
Designing a Future-Proof Infrastructure: Implement explainable ML and AI solutions, develop systems for monitoring model and data drift, and create processes that will allow the rapid production of new models.
Ensuring Platform Performance: Develop product analytics to monitor performance and inform product development decisions.
Staying Ahead with Technology: Keep up with the latest industry trends to ensure the use of cutting-edge technology that maximizes business impact.




Requirements:

Strong Forecasting Background: Extensive experience in building and deploying forecasting models, with hands-on knowledge of various tools and techniques.
Advanced ML Skills: Proficient in deploying machine learning pipelines and creating explainable AI solutions, while staying in tune with business needs.
Data Visualization Expertise: Skilled at translating complex datasets and time series into easy-to-understand insights.
Team-Oriented with a Product Focus: A clear communicator and collaborative team player with a product-led approach to engineering.
Start-up Experience: A background in early-stage environments, demonstrating adaptability and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced setting.
Relocation Flexibility: Must be an EU citizen and available to relocate to the Netherlands.




Preferred Tech Stack:

You will have input on shaping the company’s tech stack. Some preferred tools and technologies include:




Languages: Python for ML, R for data analysis
ML Libraries: scikit-learn, Prophet, TensorFlow, Keras
Data Processing/Storage: SQL, Spark
Cloud Platform: Azure
Version Control: Git




Benefits:

An initial one-year contract with the possibility of extension, based on the success of the collaboration.
A flexible hybrid work environment that promotes work-life balance.
Continuous learning opportunities and room for career growth within a fast-evolving company.
The chance to work with an international team of talented professionals across tech and product.
A meaningful opportunity to contribute to sustainability efforts and make a real-world impact.




Kindly note that VISA Sponsorship is not available for this position.

Show more

Title: Research Scientist
HTML:
Company Intro


Toloka AI is a global tech company that offers end-to-end data labeling solutions based on the effective combination of public crowd, domain experts and ML. Toloka has one of the most advanced annotation platforms in the market together with huge experience gathered by the whole team. Our solutions are powered by the most diverse global crowd from 100+ countries speaking 40+ languages and extensive experience in the practical application of SOTA models.


Toloka AI Research team strives to enhance the capabilities and safety of frontier models with valuable data, advanced training, and evaluation methods. We collaborate with top institutions on research publications and contribute new high-quality data and post-training methods to open-source.


We are looking for an experienced Research Scientist who will drive innovation and push the boundaries of AI model development, ensuring both cutting-edge performance and safety.


Project examples


  • Evaluate the impact of data on model performance through internal fine-tuning experiments;
  • Develop high-quality evaluation metrics to measure performance in coding, math, reasoning, multimodality, and other complex tasks;
  • Experiment with red-teaming approaches to identify model vulnerabilities and improve safety alignment.


Responsibilities


  • Establish partnerships with other research labs (universities and AI companies);
  • Develop research ideas, design data collection pipelines, and conduct experiments;
  • Publish scientific papers and present at top-tier conferences.


Qualifications


  • Comprehensive knowledge of deep learning fundamentals and a strong scientific understanding of the field of generative AI;
  • PhD or industry research experience in computer science, machine learning, data science, or a related field;
  • Proven track record and experience conducting deep learning research, from idea to publication;
  • Strong engineering skills with proficiency in Python and commonly used ML frameworks/libraries;
  • Proficiency in English (C1+).


Preferred but not required


  • Published papers at top-tier venues (such as NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, ACL, EMNLP, etc.);
  • Experience with large language models or other generative AI technologies;
  • Industry experience in machine learning, data science, or a related field.


What we can offer


  • Personal and career development: we support employee’s ambition for professional development and encourage them to implement their ideas in their projects;
  • Flexibility: we offer remote or hybrid employment. You will also design with your manager a workday that works best for you;
  • Paid parental leave + Annual vacation policy;
  • Transportation expenses reimbursement;
  • Meal allowance for every working day in the office;
  • Contributions to personal pension plan.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Word jij enthousiast van machine learning en het omzetten van data in waardevolle informatie voor diverse stakeholders? Wil je bijdragen aan de toekomst van onze machines bij de klant? Lees dan verder!


Jouw rol:

Als Data Scientist bij Rollepaal ben je bezig met de ontwikkeling van bestaande en nieuwe toepassingen van machine learning. De verzamelde machine data in de cloud en proces data van interne processen zet je om in bruikbare informatie voor interne afdelingen en klanten, waarmee je direct bijdraagt aan succes.


Door de patronen te visualiseren en verder te onderzoeken kom je met advies over product- en architectuurverbeteringen en ondersteun je daarnaast bij R&D-projecten


Je bent als Data Scientist verantwoordelijk voor de data-architectuur en bent de inhoudelijke kennisdrager en sparringpartner voor je collega’s. Ook zorg je ervoor dat de data zorgvuldig, accuraat en conform de wetgeving wordt beheerd.


Voor jou:

  • Een uitdagende functie in een dynamische (internationale) omgeving;
  • Een team van gemotiveerde collega's met veel kennis en ervaring;
  • Mogelijkheden voor persoonlijke groei en ontwikkeling;
  • Reiskostenvergoeding woon-werkverkeer;
  • Bij een fulltime dienstverband 27 vakantiedagen en 13 extra vrije dagen dus een totaal van 40 vrije dagen.


Jouw kracht:

  • Je bent sterk in wiskunde en statistiek;
  • Hebt ervaring met Python (pré) of R;
  • Bekend met Python-libraries zoals Pandas, NumPy, SciPy, Scikit-learn, Seaborn;
  • Ervaring met machine learning (classificatie, clustering, regressive) en het werken met grote datasets;
  • Je bent goed met data cleaning en datavisualisatie;
  • Ervaring met Power BI;
  • Ervaring met tools als Spark, Kafka, Microsoft Azure of AWS is een pré.
  • Je beschikt over een wo-denkniveau, bij voorkeur met een achtergrond in data science, wiskunde, informatica of een vergelijkbare richting.


Wie zijn wij:

Rollepaal is de specialist in het ontwerpen, fabriceren en installeren van extrusielijnen voor kunststofbuizen. We leveren machines en complete productielijnen wereldwijd, met focus op duurzaamheid en gebruik van gerecyclede materialen. Onze buisextrusietechnologie minimaliseert grondstof verbruik en draagt wereldwijd bij aan toegang tot schoon water en sanitaire voorzieningen.


Pak jouw moment:

Wil je op basis van bovenstaande beschrijving graag aan de slag als Data Scientist bij Rollepaal in Dedemsvaart? Neem contact met ons op via hrm@rollepaal.com!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Who We Are

WEBB Traders is a growing, proprietary trading company, driven by data and technology. We act as a market maker, using our own capital to trade on global stock and derivatives exchanges. By leveraging a large network of interdealer brokers and the latest advancements in electronic trading technology, we add liquidity to the financial markets specialized in cash equity and derivatives.

Since our very first trade in 2009, WEBB’s headquarters have been based in Amsterdam, nowadays supported by a strong presence in Paris. With our 70 employees of over 25 different nationalities, we are united in our great ambition to grow WEBB into a global leader in arbitrage and liquidity.

Join us to accelerate your career in the unique trading culture of openness, community, enjoyment, and boundary-free entrepreneurship.

Your role

WEBB has the ambition to become a global leading trading firm. Data analysis and automation are two core pillars of our growth and our strong risk management framework is a key foundation for it. WEBB Traders is looking for a data-driven Data Scientist in Amsterdam to take our company's risk management function to the next level. You will develop world-class risk tools that help identify weaknesses and opportunities. You ensure we keep the company safe, simultaneously elevating our controls into strategic edge.

Your main activities


Build risk, finance operations and compliance dashboards
Visualise risk, finance, operations and compliance data to relevant stakeholders
Analyse complex business problems and propose solutions or enhancements
Provide clear, timely updates on planning and delivery. Monitor and manage continuous process improvements, addressing outstanding issues
Respond to ad hoc requests from stakeholders



Who are you?


You are a data scientist who has a great affinity with algorithmic trading
You are eager to drive change in a fast-paced environment
Your mindset is on innovation and continuous improvement
Your personality is characterised as down-to-earth, steadfast, firm, and your integrity is beyond reproach
You have a compelling communication style and enjoy working closely with various stakeholders (traders, engineers, management board, clearing members)
You show ownership to drive key firm-wide risk, finance, operations and compliance projects from initiation to completion



What You Bring To WEBB


You have 1-3 years of experience in a data scientist or risk analyst role
You have a strong interest in equities, derivatives, commodities, algorithmic trading, high frequency trading, market making and risk management
You have strong Python and SQL skills
You possess a Master’s degree in e.g. mathematics, physics, econometrics, quantitative finance, data science and you have strong analytical skills
You are fluent in English, both spoken and written



What We Offer


Challenge yourself. Be part of the dynamic work environment and grow along with us.
Develop yourself. Join internal and external training sessions covering trading software, agile methodologies, and hardware and software management
Treat yourself. Enjoy delicious meals in our office in Amsterdam
Stay fit. Sports facility access with ClassPass
Keep the spirit up. Fun activities with your teammates on a regular basis
Team up. A great office vibe in the heart of Amsterdam
It’s on us. Benefit from travel reimbursement in Amsterdam or a Swapfiets bike
And finally… A competitive reward package including a bonus scheme



Application process


Apply on our WEBBsite in English!
Share a short motivation for joining WEBB and why you think you are a great fit for this role
Have a video chat with us (unless you are around, you may drop by for a coffee)
Nail the technical challenge
Visit our office for the interviews and a drink
Accept our offer!



___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

By applying to this vacancy and attaching your resume, you hereby give consent to the processing of your personal data that you have provided, and you declare your agreement with storing these data for a period of 6 months, according to the GDPR law and regulations.

After that period, your personal data will be automatically deleted from our databases.

All the personal data collected are used by Webbtraders employees, who require access to this data on account of their position, exclusively for recruitment purposes. The employees who are involved in your application process are bound by confidentiality.

If we wish to retain your personal data for a longer period of time, for example for future job opportunities, we will ask again for your consent to retain your data. You can revoke your consent at any time by contacting us and we will immediately delete any personal information.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
My Client In Amsterdam are in search of an AI Engineer to join their team and be part of their exciting growth and expansion plans for 2025. The key roles and responsibilities are listed below.







Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and implement machine learning models and AI algorithms to address business challenges.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand requirements and translate them into AI-driven solutions.
Analyze large datasets to extract actionable insights and train predictive models.
Optimize and fine-tune machine learning models for improved performance and efficiency.
Develop and maintain AI tools, libraries, and frameworks to support the development process.
Perform data preprocessing, feature engineering, and data validation to ensure the accuracy and quality of AI models.
Test and evaluate AI models and systems to ensure they meet performance and accuracy standards.
Work with stakeholders to define and refine project goals and timelines.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field (Master’s or Ph.D. preferred).
Proven experience in developing machine learning algorithms and AI systems.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or C++.
Hands-on experience with machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Keras.
Strong knowledge of AI concepts such as natural language processing (NLP), computer vision, reinforcement learning, or deep learning.
Solid understanding of data structures, algorithms, and software engineering best practices.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, Azure) and deployment tools.




Salary Package:

Up to €95,000
Flexible Hybrid Working
Laptop + Mobile Phone
Rewarding Equity Scheme

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Do you love using the latest technology and tools to build AI solutions that make services for customers and colleagues better, faster, and easier? Then this is the job for you! We are expanding our Data Science Guild and are looking for a colleague to strengthen our organisation.

At Nationale-Nederlanden, Data Scientists work both in central AI teams and decentralized business teams. Through the Data Science Guild, knowledge and skills are exchanged during training sessions and other events, such as the annual hackathon.

What you are going to do

With your solution-oriented and proactive mindset, you will translate business issues into data science solutions using our AI toolkit. We work agilely with business colleagues on projects that often extend beyond individual sprints.

Specifically, you will bring AI solutions into production to ensure that your solutions truly create value for our company's future. Researching and applying new technology plays a crucial role. You will use state-of-the-art techniques such as AI as a service and LLMs, including Cognitive Services and OpenAI. You understand how to help business colleagues translate their needs into AI solutions and, above all, enjoy presenting your solutions to the business and assisting them with AI adoption.

If you love diving into the latest AI trends to find solutions for business problems, then this job is for you.

What we offer you

NN invests in an inclusive, inspiring work environment and in skills and competences for the future. We match this with employee benefits that are in line with what is needed today and in the future. This way, we offer our employees the opportunity to get the best out of themselves. We offer you:


Salary between €3,415 and €5,676 depending on your knowledge and experience
13th month and holiday allowance are paid with your monthly salary
27 vacation days for a 5-day working week and one Diversity Day
A modern pension administered by BeFrank
Plenty of training and learning opportunities
NS Business Card 2nd class, which gives you unlimited travel, also privately. Do you prefer to travel with your own transport? Then you can declare the kilometres travelled
Allowances for setting up your home office and for internet use
We work hybrid at NN. Together with your team, you decide where, how and when you work. The official location of this job is The Hague or Rotterdam


Who you are

You enjoy developing and implementing AI-driven solutions in Python and can clearly communicate your findings to others so that the business will actually use your model. You have an open attitude and enjoy further developing yourself in the field of data science. Additionally, you have:


A bachelor's or master's degree in Data Science, Econometrics, IT, or a study with a strong data science component
Experience in developing ML applications in Python
Practical knowledge of the data science process, such as data collection, cleaning, model evaluation, and model implementation
Preferably, experience with (Azure) CI/CD tools, Git, and SQL
It’s a plus if you have experience developing (REST) APIs
We have a strong preference for candidates who live in the Netherlands
For this job it is required to be able to speak and write Dutch fluently
This job requires at least 3 years of relevant work experience


Who you will work with

At the AI Team Services, you play a crucial role in increasing the efficiency and effectiveness of business processes using AI. You focus on continuous improvement and innovation of processes, translating complex business problems into AI-automated customer processes. You work on impactful use cases that have a direct impact on business processes, customers, teams, and costs. In this role, you work closely with colleagues from different teams and learn more about the socially important Pension and Life products. NN is a market leader in these markets, so you always work on high-volume cases that create a lot of value and simplify customers’ lives through further digitalization and automation. You will work in a multidisciplinary team of motivated colleagues such as a Business Process Manager, other data scientists, and a product owner. This team, part of L&P Services, officially starts on January 1st. There is still a lot of room to discover how we can be as effective as possible as a team, where you have plenty of space to show initiative and entrepreneurship.

Any questions?

If you have any questions about the job, you can reach out via phone or WhatsApp to Ties Herpers, Recruiter, via 06 1733 6328.

We bieden je


NS Business card, ook privé te gebruiken
27 vakantiedagen en 1 Diversiteitsdag
Hybride werken
Show more
HTML:
Do you love using the latest technology and tools to build AI solutions that make services for customers and colleagues better, faster, and easier? Then this is the job for you! We are expanding our Data Science Guild and are looking for a colleague to strengthen our organisation.

At Nationale-Nederlanden, Data Scientists work both in central AI teams and decentralized business teams. Through the Data Science Guild, knowledge and skills are exchanged during training sessions and other events, such as the annual hackathon.

What you are going to do

With your solution-oriented and proactive mindset, you will translate business issues into data science solutions using our AI toolkit. We work agilely with business colleagues on projects that often extend beyond individual sprints.

Specifically, you will bring AI solutions into production to ensure that your solutions truly create value for our company's future. Researching and applying new technology plays a crucial role. You will use state-of-the-art techniques such as AI as a service and LLMs, including Cognitive Services and OpenAI. You understand how to help business colleagues translate their needs into AI solutions and, above all, enjoy presenting your solutions to the business and assisting them with AI adoption.

If you love diving into the latest AI trends to find solutions for business problems, then this job is for you.

What we offer you

NN invests in an inclusive, inspiring work environment and in skills and competences for the future. We match this with employee benefits that are in line with what is needed today and in the future. This way, we offer our employees the opportunity to get the best out of themselves. We offer you:

  • Salary between €3,415 and €5,676 depending on your knowledge and experience
  • 13th month and holiday allowance are paid with your monthly salary
  • 27 vacation days for a 5-day working week and one Diversity Day
  • A modern pension administered by BeFrank
  • Plenty of training and learning opportunities
  • NS Business Card 2nd class, which gives you unlimited travel, also privately. Do you prefer to travel with your own transport? Then you can declare the kilometres travelled
  • Allowances for setting up your home office and for internet use
  • We work hybrid at NN. Together with your team, you decide where, how and when you work. The official location of this job is The Hague or Rotterdam

Who you are

You enjoy developing and implementing AI-driven solutions in Python and can clearly communicate your findings to others so that the business will actually use your model. You have an open attitude and enjoy further developing yourself in the field of data science. Additionally, you have:

  • A bachelor's or master's degree in Data Science, Econometrics, IT, or a study with a strong data science component
  • Experience in developing ML applications in Python
  • Practical knowledge of the data science process, such as data collection, cleaning, model evaluation, and model implementation
  • Preferably, experience with (Azure) CI/CD tools, Git, and SQL
  • It’s a plus if you have experience developing (REST) APIs
  • We have a strong preference for candidates who live in the Netherlands
  • For this job it is required to be able to speak and write Dutch fluently
  • This job requires at least 3 years of relevant work experience

Who you will work with

At the AI Team Services, you play a crucial role in increasing the efficiency and effectiveness of business processes using AI. You focus on continuous improvement and innovation of processes, translating complex business problems into AI-automated customer processes. You work on impactful use cases that have a direct impact on business processes, customers, teams, and costs. In this role, you work closely with colleagues from different teams and learn more about the socially important Pension and Life products. NN is a market leader in these markets, so you always work on high-volume cases that create a lot of value and simplify customers’ lives through further digitalization and automation. You will work in a multidisciplinary team of motivated colleagues such as a Business Process Manager, other data scientists, and a product owner. This team, part of L&P Services, officially starts on January 1st. There is still a lot of room to discover how we can be as effective as possible as a team, where you have plenty of space to show initiative and entrepreneurship.

Any questions?

If you have any questions about the job, you can reach out via phone or WhatsApp to Ties Herpers, Recruiter, via 06 1733 6328.

We bieden je

  • NS Business card, ook privé te gebruiken
  • 27 vakantiedagen en 1 Diversiteitsdag
  • Hybride werken

Title: Scientist Applied AI | The Hague, Soesterberg or Eindhoven
Description:
About This Position

Combine human expertise and machine learning to develop smart, reliable, and sustainable solutions. Work on cutting-edge AI technologies at TNO in The Hague, Eindhoven, or Soesterberg.

What will be your role?

As a Scientist Applied AI, you will work on hybrid AI systems that combine human expertise with machine learning to tackle complex challenges. You contribute to projects with real-world impact, especially in the smart industry. Examples include


Putting Generative AI into action Develop technologies applicable to sectors such as industry, healthcare, and government.
Generating intelligent insights Design AI systems that translate data into actionable insights, such as recycling advice for the smart industry or labor market applications.
Developing hybrid AI Integrate knowledge models, such as ontologies and probabilistic logic, with machine learning to create more reliable and explainable AI systems.
Automated decision-making Build systems capable of independently making complex decisions and adapting to changes, such as predictive maintenance in the industry.


You will collaborate with clients and colleagues on inspiring proof-of-concepts and prototypes, leveraging state-of-the-art techniques like generative AI, machine learning, ontologies, probabilistic models, and data integration tools. You will continuously learn and apply new methodologies to ensure your solutions remain ahead of the curve.

What can you expect?

At TNO, you’ll work in a dynamic environment where you combine technical expertise with creative applications. As part of our Data Science team of 50 experts, you’ll develop solutions that are


Reliable and explainable, ensuring clients can trust that the AI performs as intended.
Sustainable and scalable, enabling your technology to make a real-world impact.
Interdisciplinary, with applications spanning smart industry, healthcare, the labor market, and the defense sector.
You’ll collaborate with clients and colleagues, present your work at conferences, and create solutions that link technological progress to societal impact.


What We Expect From You

You have a passion for AI and the ambition to not only understand new technologies but also apply them in practice. Your profile


A master’s degree or PhD in artificial intelligence, computer science, systems engineering, or a related field.
Technical expertise in architecture and software development, including programming languages like Python and machine learning frameworks.
An interest in combining human knowledge with AI for explainable and reliable applications.
Experience with techniques such as ontologies, probabilistic logic, and generative AI, or a willingness to grow in these areas.
A client-focused mindset strong communication skills and the ability to think proactively about practical solutions to complex client challenges.


What You'll Get In Return

Challenging and varied work with a real impact. And plenty of opportunities as, at TNO, you are in charge of shaping your career. We offer a gross monthly salary between € 3.600,- and € 5.600,- (based on your knowledge and experience), 8% holiday pay, a 13th month bonus of 8.33% and a flex budget (5.58% + € 180). In addition, you will be given every opportunity to develop yourself.

TNO offers optional employee benefits, enabling you to tailor your benefits package to match your personal situation. You may also expect


An extremely professional, innovative working environment where colleagues are leading experts in their field.
The opportunity to attend courses, workshops and conferences, and to receive training and coaching based on your needs.
33 days annual leave on a full-time basis.
An employer that values and encourages diverse talent, with initiatives like the Female Leadership Program, our Rainbow Community and round tables on inclusion topics.
We offer a comprehensive and flexible mobility plan that also includes full compensation for public transportation for commuting and business travel.
Great social events with your team and other TNO colleagues . That’s how you will get to know a lot of people really quickly.
Flexible working hours, the possibility to work parttime (32 of 36 hours) and the possibility of working from home.
Access to our Talent Development Programme .
Extensive relocation package for international candidates.
A good pension scheme.


Read More About Tailoring Your Benefits Package.

TNO as an employer

At TNO, we innovate for a healthier, safer and more sustainable life. And for a strong economy. Since 1932, we have been making knowledge and technology available for the common good. We find each other in wonder and ingenuity. We are driven to push boundaries. There is all the space and support for your talent and ambition. You work with people who will challenge you who inspire you and want to learn from you. Our state-of-the-art facilities are there to realize your vision. What you do at TNO matters impact makes the difference. Because with every innovation you contribute to tomorrow’s world. Read more about TNO as an employer .

At TNO we encourage an inclusive work environment, where you can be yourself. Whatever your story and whatever unique qualities you bring to the table. It is by combining our unique strengths and perspectives that we are able to develop innovations that make a real difference in society. Want to know more? Read what steps we are taking in the area of diversity and inclusion .

The selection process

Please apply before the 12th of January, 2025. The selection process comprises two interview rounds. The preliminary interview takes place on the 20th of January, 2025. The second interview round has been scheduled for the 27th of January, 2025. In a final meeting we will discuss the terms of employment and your tailored benefits package. We aim to finalize the entire process within four weeks.

The selection process may include an online assessment and a reference check.

A certificate of Conduct (VOG) is required before starting a new job at TNO.

Title: Junior Data Scientist
HTML:
Je bent (bijna) klaar met je studie en wat nu? Je vond puzzelen met data, het uitzoeken van problemen en het bedenken van de beste oplossingen altijd interessant, maar hoe ga je de functie vinden die het beste bij je past? VF Talent Academy biedt jou als jonge high potential een springplank voor de start van je carrière. Wij leiden jou op tot data-specialist! Dit doen we door middel van een eenjarig traineeship, waarin de opleiding en ontwikkeling van jou als trainee centraal staat. Ben jij er bij?!

De eerste weken gebeurt dit bij ons intern, daarna ga je aan de slag bij een van onze opdrachtgevers. Direct het diepe in dus, zodat je on the job veel kan leren en de theorie direct in de praktijk kan brengen. Een springplank voor de start van je carrière!

Tijdens het interne trainingsprogramma ontdekken we samen waar jouw krachten liggen. Welke functie en welk type bedrijf bij jou past, onderzoeken we dan ook samen aan de hand van de resultaten die jij boekt en de coachingssessies die we houden. Zo zorgen we altijd dat jij bij een opdrachtgever start die past bij jouw behoeften en ambities. Om je een idee te geven: momenteel werken wij veel samen met bedrijven binnen de financiële wereld zoals banken en verzekeraars, de logistiek, de retail en het vastgoed. Samen met een Learning Consultant en een Personal Coach maak jij een persoonlijk leerplan en word je maandelijks begeleid in het halen van je leerdoelen. Uiteraard kun je hierbij volop gebruik maken van onze interne Academy en deelnemen aan diverse intervisiesessies. Zo halen we gezamenlijk het beste uit jou als startende Data-Scientist

  • Je maakt het verschil bij een van onze opdrachtgevers in de functie van Data-specialist;
  • Je volgt inhoudelijke trainingen op het gebied van data gegeven door een technische trainer met ruime praktijkervaring;
  • Je neemt deel aan de soft skill trainingen om je sociale en communicatieve vaardigheden te ontwikkelen. Dit doen we bijvoorbeeld tijdens een weekend weg op een mooie locatie;
  • Je spreekt regelmatig met je Learning Consultant en Personal Coach in het kader van jouw leerplan;
  • Als jij en je opdrachtgever na de inzetperiode nog steeds enthousiast van elkaar worden, dan is er de mogelijkheid om in dienst te treden bij de opdrachtgever.


Je bent een enthousiaste, leergierige en toekomstgerichte afgestudeerde die zijn of haar carrière vliegend wil starten. Je wilt graag het beste uit jezelf halen en zoekt een werkgever die je daar als geen ander bij kan ondersteunen.

Praktisch vragen wij:

  • Een afgeronde Wo-opleiding (bij voorkeur een beta richting);
  • Enige ervaring met een moderne programmeertaal zoals Matlab, Python of R;
  • Sterke affiniteit met het datavakgebied;
  • Je bent leergierig en altijd bezig met je eigen ontwikkeling, zowel op professioneel als persoonlijk vlak;
  • Je bent niet bang om in het diepe te springen;
  • Flexibel inzetbaar en woonachtig in de Randstad of bereid om daar naartoe te verhuizen;
  • Je beheerst de Nederlandse taal uitstekend.

Title: Data Engineer / Scientist
Description:
Would you like to partake in technical challenges, collaborate on an interesting product, be up to date with the latest technology, and contribute to taking our product to market? Then keep reading!




Yes, tell me more…

fullinfo is a startup B2B data services software company.

We are building an un-paralleled data collection pipeline which is being deployed on AWS and written in Go and Typescript. With a focus on innovation, quality, and accessibility, we are developing a one-stop lead generator platform.

The Customer facing part of the solution is a Typescript and GraphQL based web application. Deployed on AWS as well. Serverless paradigm is being applied: Most of our code is running as AWS’s Lambda’s.




We are currently hiring a Data Scientist/Engineer for fullinfo on an initial 12-month contract-basis. The ideal candidate will be comfortable with Python, AWS, Typescript, Go and have experience working with large volumes of structured and unstructured data from different sources, with focus on data preparation.




Responsibilities:

Build and maintain robust ETL pipelines to extract, transform, and process data from DynamoDB and other sources.
Design and optimize workflows for managing and processing complex JSON data structures.
Enable efficient querying of DynamoDB data, leveraging advanced indexing and partitioning techniques.
Automate data workflows using AWS services (e.g., Lambda) and orchestrate model deployment pipelines.
Collaborate with the machine learning team to ensure the availability of clean, well-structured, and optimized data for model development.




Nice to have:

Experiment with prompt engineering and in-context learning to optimize LLM performance for specific business use cases.
Use LLMs for tasks such as data extraction, classification, and summarization from web-scraped datasets.




Requirements:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
A minimum of 3 years relevant experience.
Strong knowledge of DynamoDB, JSON structures, and querying techniques.
Proficiency in Python (e.g., boto3, Pandas) for data manipulation and machine learning workflows.
Hands-on experience with data processing in cloud platforms, particularly AWS (e.g., Lambda, S3).
Proven ability to build and deploy ETL pipelines.
Proven experience with Large Language Models (e.g., GPT, BERT, LLaMA) and fine-tuning techniques.
Business Proficiency in English is essential.




The successful candidate will…

Organize and transform data into structured formats for machine learning and analysis.
Enjoy creating order from chaos and tackling complex data challenges.
Have a desire to work on different features within our solution, and take a generalist role.
Possess the ability to familiarize yourself with our product quickly to generate new ideas, reflect on our existing features and think ahead.
Take on a proactive, hands-on approach.




What can you expect from us?

To shape the company from the ground up – join our team as a pioneer and help us carve our way forward.
Together we’ll take our product to market – how cool would it be to celebrate together?A flat hierarchical structure with room for innovation in a highly motivated team.
A start-up environment that is passionate about quality, problem solving and building beautiful software.
Office in Rotterdam, located in the Rotterdam Science Tower.
Office in Amsterdam, located in Apollolaan.




Our passion stems from our shared values and mission. With that said, our culture is built on two major aspects:

Quality: At fullinfo we have show-and-tell energy, and we let the quality of our product speak for itself. We love building beautiful software and get hyped by always raising the bar on quality. Our product is beautiful inside and outside. How do we achieve this? By always asking ourselves “Is this right?” or “Does this make sense?”.

Problem Solving: We foster innovation and novel approaches to problem solving, while keeping user needs at front of mind.

Title: Junior Data Scientist - Team Artemis
Description:
Nice to know (you)


Unique opportunity to directly impact passenger experience at one of the world's busiest airports. Your data science models will be visible in action from your workplace window, affecting real-time operations and decision-making at Schiphol.
Team Artemis is known for its state-of-the-art decision support tools that blend cutting-edge data science with practical airport operations. We're pioneering AI-driven solutions that optimize gate planning and quantify operational value in real-time.
With 3,000 proud colleagues, we work toward our mission: "the world's most sustainable and high quality airports.



Connecting your world

As Junior Data Scientist you will be leveraging rich data sources into actionable products and services to advance day-to-day airport operations. Creating and implementing data-driven decision support tools that directly impact Schiphol's efficiency and passenger experience. How you achieve results in this? That’s up to you. We trust in the way you can distinguish between main and secondary issues and make connections. You put your talents to work at:


Developing and implementing advanced algorithms for gate planning and operational optimization.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify and solve complex operational challenges.
Creating and maintain data products that provide actionable insights for airport management.
Contributing to the continuous improvement of Schiphol's data-driven decision-making processes.



You'll be working on projects with immediate real-world impact, such as our gateplanning decision support system and our framework for quantifying operational value. These projects require a blend of data science expertise and domain knowledge, offering a unique opportunity to apply your skills in a dynamic, high-stakes environment. Your work will directly influence the efficiency and passenger experience at one of Europe's busiest airports.

You've got this

Schiphol connects your world. With the best people, we make travel safe and responsible. You contribute to this with with your unique talents, such as approaching problems as a challenge and finding good solutions to them at lightning speed. Also, you are the talent who takes initiative to make improvements. In addition, for this position you have:


1-3 years of experience as a data scientist or in a similar role.
Proficiency in Python programming
Experience with machine learning algorithms (e.g., Random Forests, Logistic Regression)
Familiarity with the SciPy stack (Pandas, NumPy)
Knowledge of Git and CI/CD processes
Experience with Jupyter notebooks and MLflow
Understanding of Linux and Bash scripting



You get this


€ 4401 to € 6128 gross per month (Schaal 11).
A 13th month (year-end bonus).
An NS Business Card that fully reimburses travel by public transportation to and from work.
The possibility to work 4 x 9 hours in a 36-hour work week.



These are just some of our terms of employment that come with this position (based on a 36-hour work week). Schiphol Group has even more to offer you. For the complete overview of all terms and conditions of employment, please visit Conditions - Werken bij Schiphol Group.

About The Team

The IT & Data department is creating the airport of the future. We do this using the smartest digital solutions, tools and applications. With state-of-the-art technology, we keep the airport running. Our enthusiastic team works on data-driven improvements in our processes, traveller flows and information provision. This is how we contribute to the best possible experience for travellers, customers and employees at and around the airport.

Choose your destination

What are your talents? What dreams do you have? What is your story? We are curious about you and invite you to apply. You can apply by sharing your motivation and resume with us via the application button below.


Do you have questions about the application process? Contact Erwin Schuur, Recruitment Business Partner, by sending a message to erwin.schuur@schiphol.nl.
An assessment will be part of the application proces.
For more information about applying at Schiphol Group: Job application process - Werken bij Schiphol Group.
For the safety of our passengers and colleagues, a security screening (Certificate of Conduct) is always part of the recruitment process.



About Schiphol Group

With 3,000 proud colleagues, we go the extra mile to connect the Netherlands with the rest of the world in the best possible way. Innovation, safety and cooperation are at the forefront. Together we give more meaning to travel and contribute to the economy and society. For more than 100 years. In the Netherlands and beyond. By the way, did you know that:


Schiphol Group owns and operates Amsterdam Airport Schiphol, Rotterdam The Hague Airport and Lelystad Airport? We also have a majority stake in Eindhoven Airport.



… there were a total of 61.7 million travellers from and to Schiphol Airport in 2023?


as a Junior Data Scientist will be joining the business area Data, AI & Analytics (DnA)?

These projects require a blend of data science expertise and domain knowledge, offering a unique opportunity to apply your skills in a dynamic, high-stakes environment. Your work will directly influence the efficiency and passenger experience at one of Europe's busiest airports.

You've got this

Schiphol connects your world. With the best people, we make travel safe and responsible. You contribute to this with with your unique talents, such as approaching problems as a challenge and finding good solutions to them at lightning speed. Also, you are the talent who takes initiative to make improvements. In addition, for this position you have:

  • 1-3 years of experience as a data scientist or in a similar role.
  • Proficiency in Python programming
  • Experience with machine learning algorithms (e.g., Random Forests, Logistic Regression)
  • Familiarity with the SciPy stack (Pandas, NumPy)
  • Knowledge of Git and CI/CD processes
  • Experience with Jupyter notebooks and MLflow
  • Understanding of Linux and Bash scripting


You get this

  • € 4401 to € 6128 gross per month (Schaal 11).
  • A 13th month (year-end bonus).
  • An NS Business Card that fully reimburses travel by public transportation to and from work.
  • The possibility to work 4 x 9 hours in a 36-hour work week.


These are just some of our terms of employment that come with this position (based on a 36-hour work week). Schiphol Group has even more to offer you. For the complete overview of all terms and conditions of employment, please visit Conditions - Werken bij Schiphol Group.

About The Team

The IT & Data department is creating the airport of the future. We do this using the smartest digital solutions, tools and applications. With state-of-the-art technology, we keep the airport running. Our enthusiastic team works on data-driven improvements in our processes, traveller flows and information provision. This is how we contribute to the best possible experience for travellers, customers and employees at and around the airport.

Choose your destination

What are your talents? What dreams do you have? What is your story? We are curious about you and invite you to apply. You can apply by sharing your motivation and resume with us via the application button below.

  • Do you have questions about the application process? Contact Erwin Schuur, Recruitment Business Partner, by sending a message to erwin.schuur@schiphol.nl.
  • An assessment will be part of the application proces.
  • For more information about applying at Schiphol Group: Job application process - Werken bij Schiphol Group.
  • For the safety of our passengers and colleagues, a security screening (Certificate of Conduct) is always part of the recruitment process.


About Schiphol Group

With 3,000 proud colleagues, we go the extra mile to connect the Netherlands with the rest of the world in the best possible way. Innovation, safety and cooperation are at the forefront. Together we give more meaning to travel and contribute to the economy and society. For more than 100 years. In the Netherlands and beyond. By the way, did you know that:

  • Schiphol Group owns and operates Amsterdam Airport Schiphol, Rotterdam The Hague Airport and Lelystad Airport? We also have a majority stake in Eindhoven Airport.


… there were a total of 61.7 million travellers from and to Schiphol Airport in 2023?

  • as a Junior Data Scientist will be joining the business area Data, AI & Analytics (DnA)?

Title: Applied AI Engineer
Description:
At Envision, we build AI technology that gives blind and low vision individuals the tools for independence. Through our mobile apps, smart glasses, and Ally - our real-time visual assistant - we make the visual world accessible. Our solutions enable users to navigate daily tasks across platforms and languages, from text recognition to form completion, because independence is earned through genuine autonomy.




Role Overview:




As an Applied AI Engineer at Envision, you'll develop solutions using state-of-the-art deep learning, language models, and agentic systems to serve blind and low vision users. You'll evaluate emerging research, adapt open-source AI developments, and rapidly prototype features that scale - from computer vision capabilities to autonomous assistants.




The role requires strong research awareness, practical implementation skills, and intuition for productizing AI breakthroughs. Your work will directly impact millions of users who rely on our technology for daily independence.




What you bring to the role:

Essential:

3+ years experience shipping Python-based products in production environments
Strong fundamentals in neural networks and transformer architectures
Demonstrated experience building with and deploying (V)LMs

Nice to Have:

Backend development experience with popular frameworks like FastAPI
Interest in building agentic systems and knowledge of frameworks like LangGraph
Proficiency with AI-assisted development tools and workflows (think Cursor, etc.)
Interest in data pipelines & data science tools.




What Envision offers:

Competitive salary and stock options
Visa sponsorship (Dutch highly skilled migrant) for the right candidates
Flexible hybrid work policy with 3 days minimum at our Rotterdam office
High degree of autonomy in your work
Bonus best-in-class karma from the lives your work will impact

Title: AI/ML engineer
Description:
Functie­omschrijving

Wil jij je kennis van AI/ML engineering, nieuwsgierigheid én je creativiteit volop gebruiken? Wil je een belangrijke bijdrage leveren aan robuuste platformen, systemen en oplossingen voor het aanbieden van state of the art AI/ML en het verrijken van diverse data? Solliciteer bij Data Science & Enrichments van de AIVD!

Wat ga je doen?

Hoe operationaliseren we, vaak de laatste, (AI) technieken in een dynamische operationele productie-omgeving? Hoe verrijken we de data op grote schaal of realtime voor data-verwerking zoals processing, applicaties en andere toepassingen? Hoe kunnen we zoveel mogelijk verzoeken tot AI en verrijkingen verwerken met de resources die we hebben? Hoe kunnen we gedeployede platformen, systemen en oplossingen 24/7 up en running houden? En hoe voldoen AI en verrijking oplossingen aan wet en regelgeving, security en compliance vereisten? Voor zulke vragen ontwikkelt het team Data Science & Enrichments – binnen de kaders van de wet – oplossingen ten behoeve van alle bedrijfsfacetten zoals inlichtingenteams en operationele afdelingen. Daarbij doen we steeds meer een beroep op de mogelijkheden van artificial intelligence en machine learning (AI/ML).

Als AI/ML engineer ga je aan de slag met de schaling, optimalisatie, deployen en monitoring van platformen, systemen, modellen en algoritmes voor het aanbieden en inzetten van AI & verrijking oplossingen. Daarbij stelt het de de business in staat om doelgerichter meer informatie uit de data te halen. Je zorgt dat (AI/ML) oplossingen op een efficiënte manier in productie worden genomen op onze hoogstaande infrastructuur. Ook heb je contact met diverse (technische) experts en met onze nationale en internationale partners in de inlichtingen- en veiligheidsdomein.

Wat krijg je daarvoor terug?

Een plek die je nergens anders vindt, waar je intensief sleutelt aan (en met) algoritmes, modellen, data, frameworks en werkt met unieke techniek. Je bent omringd door specialisten uit de meest uiteenlopende disciplines. De mogelijkheden (en risico’s) die wij zien van AI en ML in combinatie met de complexiteit van de omgeving, geeft ruimte voor jouw nieuwsgierigheid en creativiteit. Met andere woorden: je hebt interessant werk dat van groot belang is voor de veiligheid van Nederland.

Functie-eisen

Met je probleemoplossend vermogen vind je pragmatische antwoorden op niet-alledaagse

vragen. Je houdt ervan om nieuwe technieken te doorgronden. Met je expertise, brede blik en luisterend vermogen ben je in staat om (technische) wensen te vertalen naar de beste uitwerking. Je werkt graag samen met collega’s die minstens zo enthousiast zijn als jij en je vindt het de normaalste zaak van de wereld om ideeën te delen én te toetsen. Verder heb je:


een wo werk- en denkniveau en een relevante opleiding, zoals computer science, data science of artificial intelligence;
ervaring met programmeertalen zoals Java en Python en/of Rust;
kennis van AI/ML frameworks en trainingscomponenten zoals ONNX, TensorRT, PyTorch en/of TensorFlow;
ervaring met grote datasets, prototyping, AI/ML inference en het ontwikkelen van geoptimaliseerde softwaresystemen (MLOps, LLMOps);
ervaring of grote interesse om te werken met bijvoorbeeld Spark, Hive, CUDA, Unix-systemen, kubernetes, helm, git, CI/CD/CT, vector databases, Spring of Triton.


Voldoe je nog niet helemaal aan de gestelde functie-eisen, maar ambieer je wel deze technische AI/ML Engineering rol bij de AIVD? Ook dan willen we je vragen om je interesse kenbaar te maken met een sollicitatie!

De AIVD omarmt diversiteit en inclusie en wil graag dat medewerkers zich thuis voelen. Verschillende perspectieven, achtergronden en inzichten zijn een verrijking voor onze organisatie. Bij ons is iedereen die aan de voorwaarden voor een Verklaring van Geen Bezwaar (VGB) voldoet welkom, ongeacht culturele achtergrond, arbeidsvermogen, leeftijd, gender of seksuele voorkeur. Samen werken we aan de veiligheid van Nederland.

Arbeids­voorwaarden


Salaris­niveau


schaal 11



Maand­salaris: Min €4024 - Max €6110
Show more

Title: Data Scientist Kruidvat
Description:
Dit ga je doen

Weet jij als geen ander trends en patronen te ontdekken in onze (klant)data? Ben jij een ster in time-series forecasting of ML-modellen om de supply chain te optimaliseren? Dan zoeken we jou om ons Data Science team te versterken! Als Data Scientist ben je onderdeel van het Data Analytics team voor Kruidvat (Nederland en België) en Trekpleister. Samen met andere Data Scientists, Data Consultants, Data Analisten en Data Engineers werk je aan uiteenlopende projecten op het gebied van sales forecasting, logistieke planning, assortimentoptimalisatie, productaanbevelingen en klant- en aankoopgedrag. Door het ontwikkelen van slimme data-oplossingen help je de business met concrete inzichten en adviezen op basis van jouw algoritmes en analyses. Als grootste Health & Beauty retailer in de Benelux beschikken we over een schat aan data van meer dan 4 miljoen klanten die we elke week bedienen in ruim 1500 winkels en online.

Wat ga je doen in de functie van Data Scientist?


Ontwikkelen van data science oplossingen: Je bouwt oplossingen in Databricks en Azure die de business direct handvatten geven om bij te sturen.
Modelleren met grote datasets: Je ontwikkelt predictive- en prescriptive-modellen met gecombineerde data en werkt samen met teams van CRM, Inkoop, Marketing, eCommerce, Logistiek en Operatie.
Bijdragen aan technologische ontwikkeling: Je denkt mee over de ontwikkeling van onze technologie en tooling, zoals utility packages en het verbeteren van de MLOps-methodiek.
Blijven leren en innoveren: Je volgt innovaties binnen data science en bepaalt hoe deze bijdragen aan onze ambities.
Expertise en mentoring: Je wordt gezien als expert binnen AS Watson Benelux voor modellen en statistiek en fungeert als aanspreekpunt voor collega's.


Dit krijg je ervoor terug


Een goed salaris! Je start tussen € 4.500,- en € 7.000,- bruto per maand, afhankelijk van je ervaring, bij een fulltime werkweek van 40 uur.
24 vakantiedagen en een aantrekkelijke ATV-regeling met 19,5 dagen op fulltime basis. Liever meer vrije tijd of extra geld? Koop of verkoop vakantiedagen of laat je ATV (deels) uitbetalen.
Flexibel werken! Of je nu liever thuis werkt of op kantoor, hybride werken is bij ons heel gewoon en gaat altijd in goed overleg.
Buitengewoon veel mogelijkheden om door te groeien en jezelf verder te ontwikkelen. Via onze eigen AS Watson Academy heb je toegang tot een uitgebreid aanbod aan trainingen en cursussen.
Héél veel voordeel! Je krijgt gratis toegang tot Benefits at Work, een site met volop leuke aanbiedingen en kortingen bij tal van winkels, webshops, pretparken en meer.


Dit ben jij


Je hebt een afgeronde WO-opleiding, bijvoorbeeld MSc in Econometrie, AI, Statistiek of Wiskunde.
Je hebt minimaal 3 jaar ervaring als Data Scientist en je expertise ligt bij SQL en Python.
Je codeert netjes, gestructureerd en werkt routinematig met Git en Jira.
Je kunt jouw technische werk en uitkomsten overtuigend uitleggen aan interne klanten.
Je beschikt over uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels.


Wie jij bent, maakt ons buitengewoon! Waar wacht je nog op? Solliciteer snel en laat van je horen!

Bureaus leg de telefoon maar weer neer: wij werven zelf voor deze vacature.

Title: Python Engineer (APM)
Description:
The role is about:

The Alternative Payment Methods team is dedicated to designing, developing, and implementing innovative payment solutions that provide diverse and flexible options for users. Our goal is to deliver successful products and establish a reputation as a trusted partner for our clients in the evolving payments landscape.

You will:  


Work closely with the team Lead to identify the key architecture drivers and Non-Functional Requirements for a core customer facing product.
Match the best suitable frameworks and tools for the designed architecture.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers, business analysts, and other developers, to understand and implement business requirements.
Constantly add value to the team by writing readable, testable and efficient code.
Maintain and develop engineering culture.
Participate in code reviews and mentor junior developers.



What we need:


At least 5 years of experience developing high-load scalable applications
Experience in the Fintech or Ecommerce industry (preferred but not mandatory).
Strong knowledge of Django, FastAPI and designing and implementing REST API.
Experience with technologies such as Git, Debian, Docker, MariaDB, MongoDB and preferably Apache Druid.
Experience with technologies such as AWS & DynamoDB.
Understanding of distributed systems and integrations.
Experience in delivering good testing practices.
Implement solutions that minimize or eliminate performance problems, complexity, or solution fragility.
You can write robust and fault-tolerant software that runs smoothly and reliably.
Excellent communication skills and attention to details.


🚀 Hiring Process

1️⃣ Initial Interview

A 30-40 minute conversation with our Talent Acquisition team to discuss your experience, career goals, and expectations.

2️⃣ Technical Assignment

A take-home test designed to showcase your skills. You'll have up to 5 days to complete it in a single attempt (estimated time: 90-180 minutes).

3️⃣ Technical Review & Live Coding

Our technical experts will review your assignment and invite you for a live coding challenge to assess your problem-solving and coding abilities (60-90 minutes).

4️⃣ Final Behavioral Interview

A 45-60 minute discussion focused on team fit and collaboration with our Product Lead and CTO. This is your chance to dive deeper into our culture and align on expectations.
