Title: Machine Learning Engineer, Computer Vision
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Machine Learning Engineer in our Computer Vision section, you will be a key part in delivery of the solutions into production. You will participate in the full lifecycle of the ML systems we build, while spearheading the model deployment, performance monitoring and maintenance, to ensure the reproducibility of our experiments and traceability of our pipelines in production. As part of the R&D team, you will be expected to keep up to date with the state-of-the-art in the ML/CV area as well as new techniques and processes.

Your background

We believe you…


Have 3+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, MLOps Engineer, or similar.
Have a proven track record of bringing machine learning models to production.
Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...


Python
PyTorch
C++
OpenCV
AWS
MLFlow
Kubernetes


We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...


Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
You’ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
Strong focus on diversity and inclusion – your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.


Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Kickstart din karriere som Data Scientist hos Specialisterne  

Er du klar til at begynde din IT-karriere? Så skal du slå dig sammen med Specialisterne - vi uddanner og ansætter passionerede konsulenter, der elsker at nørde.  

 

Hvem er vi: 

Specialisterne er et IT-konsulenthus, baseret på mangfoldighed, talent og nørderi. De fleste af vores konsulenter er neurodivergente (autisme, ADHD, ADD, OCD, etc.) og er specialiseret indenfor IT og databehandling. Vi elsker at tackle de mest komplekse og udfordrende problemstillinger. Vi er nørderne, som trives med krævende opgaver, hvor dyb faglig viden og kreativ tænkning er afgørende. Hos Specialisterne får du ikke kun en karriere, du bliver en del af et fællesskab, hvor du får muligheden for at udvikle dig som person og til Specialist på dit fagområde. 

Specialisterne har åbnet en ny afdeling med kontor i Aarhus og derfor søger vi IT-konsulenter i hele Danmark. 

 

Ansættelsesprogram hos Specialisterne (Specialisterne Academy): 

Din rejse starter på Specialisterne Academy: Vores særligt tilpassede 12-ugers program. Programmet er fuldt finansieret af din bopælskommune. Du vil modtage din nuværende offentlige forsørgelse under deltagelse. I løbet af 12 uger bliver du uddannet, screenet og klar til at træde ind i IT-branchen som en professionel konsulent.  

På Academy lærer vi dig at kende, forstår dine styrker og uddanner dig i de IT-færdigheder, som vores kunder efterspørger. 

 

Vi underviser i 3 spor, hvor du vælger det, der matcher dine kompetencer og interesser: Dataanalyse, Cyber Security eller Softwareudvikling. 

 

75% af dem, som gennemfører vores Academy, kommer videre i arbejde. Du bliver ansat som konsulent hos os, og arbejder for vores kunder. Vores kunder er m.fl.: Novo Nordisk, Danske Bank, TDC, Semler, SKAT, NNE, Terma. Du vil indenfor 1-2 år blive fastansat hos den kunde, som du primært har været tilknyttet i din tid som konsulent hos os. På den måde sikrer vi, at du lander godt hos din kommende arbejdsgiver, og sikrer, at din arbejdsgiver er trænet i en divers ledelseskultur. 95% af vores tidligere konsulenter er i samme afdeling, hos samme kunde 5 år efter ansættelsen hos os. 

Dataanalyse:

På Akademiets dataanalyse-spor lærer du at kode og arbejde med forretningsdata. Du bliver undervist i kodesproget Python, SQL-databaser og platformen Power BI. Sporet er for dig, der vil hjælpe virksomheder med at forstå og anvende deres data. Du får praktisk erfaring gennem reelle virksomhedscases og datasæt fra vores samarbejdsvirksomheder.

Hvad kan vi tilbyde dig: 

Gode muligheder for job hos nogle af landets største virksomheder, som sammen med os, har fokus på dig og din trivsel. 
Omfattende uddannelse og mulighed for at specialisere dig inden for dit område. 
En inkluderende og mangfoldig arbejdsplads, hvor dine talenter, din indre nørd og dine kompetencer er udgangspunktet for din succes. 
En dynamisk arbejdsplads, hvor vi flere gange om året holder sociale arrangementer med dine kolleger. 
En ledelsesstruktur og -kultur, der giver dig plads til at udfolde dit potentiale. 

 

Vi søger dig, som: 

Er klar til at arbejde 25-37 timer om ugen. 
Kan arbejde 4-5 dage om ugen (med fjernarbejde 1-2 dage pr. uge). 
Er motiveret for at lære og bruge din specialiserede viden til at løse udfordringer for vores kunder. 
Har taget (måske ikke færdiggjort) en uddannelse inden for Tech-området (datalogi, IT-produktudvikling, robotteknologi eller datamatiker) eller det naturvidenskabelige område (biologi, fysisk, kemi, neuroscience), eller STEM-området (ingeniør, matematik, forsikringsmatematik, geologi), eller har taget en helt anden uddannelse, hvor du er blevet opmærksom på dit talent til at behandle data, se detaljer, finde mønstre, kode eller se afvigelser i datasæt. 

 

Ansøg nu, og kickstart din karriere hos Specialisterne!  

Hos Specialisterne er vi optaget af at give dig muligheden for at vise os dine kompetencer. Derfor er vores ansøgningsproces anderledes. Du følger disse 5 trin:  




Du ansøger via vores rekrutteringsplatform, Recruitee, hvor du kort skal svare på 12 spørgsmål samt uploade dit CV. 
Herefter modtager du en bekræftelse pr. mail,
Inden for 1-3 hverdage modtager du en mail (såfremt du er i målgruppe til akademiet), hvorfra du skal booke en kort 15-minutters indledende telefonsamtale med vores recruiter.
Herfra sender vi minimum én faglig screeningsopgaver (maksimalt to), så vi sammen kan komme i dialog om, hvor du står fagligt og hvad du drømmer om.  
Afslutningsvis bliver du inviteret ind til en afsluttende onlinesamtale, hvor vi snakker om dine testresultater og vurderer om Specialisterne er den virksomhed, som skal kickstarte din karriere.  

 

Det er vigtigt for os, at vi sammen vurderer, om vi er det rette match til at kickstarte din karriere. Derfor forsøger vi at gøre tingene anderledes og skaber rum og rammer, der muliggør at vi får indblik i dine talenter og kompetencer.  

Søg snarest, da vi lukker for ansøgninger, når vores program er fyldt. Søg senest primo Januar.

Opstart vil være d. 24.02.25.

 

Se vores Brand video (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2KV_JsK9QtE) og få et indblik i, hvor nørderede, kompetente, seje og mangfoldige vores kolleger er. 

 

Om Specialisterne: 

Diversitet og inklusion er selve kernen af vores arbejde, og en helt central del af Specialisternes globale værdisæt. Vi arbejder hver dag på at skabe en rummelig verden og ikke mindst et rummeligt arbejdsmarked. Vi anerkender, at alle er forskellige og at det at tiltrække, udvikle og fastholde vores medarbejdere vil skabe et bæredygtigt arbejdsmiljø, som er afgørende for vores succes. Vi opfordrer derfor alle til at søge vores ledige stillinger, uanset køn, etnicitet, alder, seksuelle orientering eller neurotype.

Title: Process Engineers & Scientists Pipeline - Kalundborg
Description:
Attention all Process Engineers and Scientists! We are seeking experienced candidates as well as newly graduated professionals to join our team. Are you a Process Engineer or Scientist looking for a new challenge? Do you want to work for a fast-growing pharmaceutical company dedicated to improving the lives of millions of patients worldwide? If so, we want to hear from you!

Whether you are an experienced professional or a newly graduated candidate, if you have skills and experience in data analysis, process systems, descriptive and prescriptive analytics, we encourage you to apply to be considered for multiple Process Engineer or Scientist positions. Join one of our production teams in Kalundborg and be a part of our mission to improve the lives of millions of patients worldwide.

The Position
We are looking for Process Engineers & Scientists who have an interest in understanding pharmaceutical processes, developing monitoring tools and analysing data for recommendations for improvements and development. Furthermore, you have an interest in business impact and understanding how interconnected decisions play a crucial role when manufacturing pharmaceuticals.

Specifically, you will:



Analyse large amounts of data for extracting correlation and causation for process understanding.
Examine and understand data from quality control (QC) analyses.
Develop, maintain, and recommend statistical process control charts for process monitoring.
Use a science, data-based approach for quantifying process deviations.
Utilize a team-based approach for recommending process improvements-optimizations.
Handle deviations when processes do not operate as intended.
Write and execute change requests to implement improvements including validation when required.
Develop maintenance strategies to optimize running time.
Coordinate with other process owners in the department to ensure optimal production capacity at all times.
Take part in cross-functional meetings to align and further develop processes across the production site.




These positions give you a great opportunity to play a part in shaping the future of manufacturing across the organization, in close collaboration with teach-transfer in Novo Nordisk.

We will match your profile with relevant roles depending on your level of experience and professional background. We work with positions that range from entry-level to senior process engineers and scientists.

Qualifications For Process Engineer & Scientist Roles



Bachelor’s or master’s degree in chemistry, natural science, mechanical engineering, production engineering or a related field.
Solid experience in manufacturing, with GMP experience being an advantage.
Ability to independently understand scientific principles required for manufacturing pharmaceutical substances related to the interaction of chemistry and equipment.
Ability to monitor data and extract information.
An appetite for connecting the understanding of process science to product quality.
Professional proficiency in written and spoken English. Knowledge of Danish or other languages is considered a plus.




For both Process Scientist & Engineer roles it is key that you understand how to convey complex information to varying audiences and thereby, explain the purpose to get everyone onboard.

Apply and be matched to multiple job opportunities
When you apply to our pipeline, you will be considered for all Process Engineer & Scientist positions across Product Supply & Quality (PSQ) in site Kalundborg. If you prefer a specific production or business area, please indicate it in your CV, and we will do our best to find the right fit for you.

We’ll match your profile continuously with all suitable positions to ensure you don’t miss out on a life-changing career. This way you will automatically be considered as a potential match for all openings in the area across our factories.

We review applications continuously and if we identify a match, you will be invited for an interview. When an opportunity arises, we will reach out, tell you about the position and invite you for an interview with the Hiring Manager. You will only be contacted if we find a relevant position that matches your profile, and we have a Hiring Manager who is interested in your profile.

We will keep your application for up to six months ensuring the best opportunities to provide a strong match for open positions, unless you inform us that you wish to withdraw.

Ready to elevate your career? Our talent pipelines offer diverse opportunities tailored to various skill sets and goals. If you still feel unsure, we cordially invite you to investigate which pathway aligns with your strengths and aspirations. Embrace the future and unlock your potential by exploring our talent pipelines: Novo Nordisk Talent Pipelines.

Checklist when applying


Please answer the questions asked when you apply. We use your answers to identify a possible match between you and our open positions.
Please unlock your profile, which you create when applying. This will allow us to match your profile with our open positions. The correct setting states ‘Profile visibility: Novo Nordisk Recruiter Worldwide’.




About Site Kalundborg

At Novo Nordisk manufacturing hub in Kalundborg, we are growing. From 2022-2029 we will invest 60 billion DKK to expand existing facilities for the current and future portfolio within serious chronic diseases. This will establish additional capacity across the entire global value chain from manufacturing of active pharmaceutical ingredients (API) to packaging, with the vast majority being invested in API capacity. With the investment, more than 1200 new jobs will be created. This is your opportunity to be part of our journey and help establish the future factories of Novo Nordisk.

Today, our 4,500 employees at Novo Nordisk Kalundborg produce half of the world’s insulin and a number of biopharmaceutical products, and we are never standing still. Together, we make a difference every day for more than 40 million people living with diabetes and other chronic diseases.

Our site is located a few minutes from the city, and just one stop with the train from the site. The train can also take you directly from the site to Copenhagen in around one hour.

Many newcomers find it easy to build a network of like-minded people coming from Denmark or internationals. Some can find a network through hobbies and sports, social network groups, colleagues or employees from other local businesses. Novo Nordisk Kalundborg

Contact
If you have any questions, feel free to contact us on the following email: processengineeringdk@novonordisk.com

Deadline
Apply before 31 March 2025.

Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, and you are encouraged to apply as soon as possible. You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV.

To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your CV.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.
Show more

These positions give you a great opportunity to play a part in shaping the future of manufacturing across the organization, in close collaboration with teach-transfer in Novo Nordisk.

We will match your profile with relevant roles depending on your level of experience and professional background. We work with positions that range from entry-level to senior process engineers and scientists.

Qualifications For Process Engineer & Scientist Roles


  • Bachelor’s or master’s degree in chemistry, natural science, mechanical engineering, production engineering or a related field.
  • Solid experience in manufacturing, with GMP experience being an advantage.
  • Ability to independently understand scientific principles required for manufacturing pharmaceutical substances related to the interaction of chemistry and equipment.
  • Ability to monitor data and extract information.
  • An appetite for connecting the understanding of process science to product quality.
  • Professional proficiency in written and spoken English. Knowledge of Danish or other languages is considered a plus.



For both Process Scientist & Engineer roles it is key that you understand how to convey complex information to varying audiences and thereby, explain the purpose to get everyone onboard.

Apply and be matched to multiple job opportunities
When you apply to our pipeline, you will be considered for all Process Engineer & Scientist positions across Product Supply & Quality (PSQ) in site Kalundborg. If you prefer a specific production or business area, please indicate it in your CV, and we will do our best to find the right fit for you.

We’ll match your profile continuously with all suitable positions to ensure you don’t miss out on a life-changing career. This way you will automatically be considered as a potential match for all openings in the area across our factories.

We review applications continuously and if we identify a match, you will be invited for an interview. When an opportunity arises, we will reach out, tell you about the position and invite you for an interview with the Hiring Manager. You will only be contacted if we find a relevant position that matches your profile, and we have a Hiring Manager who is interested in your profile.

We will keep your application for up to six months ensuring the best opportunities to provide a strong match for open positions, unless you inform us that you wish to withdraw.

Ready to elevate your career? Our talent pipelines offer diverse opportunities tailored to various skill sets and goals. If you still feel unsure, we cordially invite you to investigate which pathway aligns with your strengths and aspirations. Embrace the future and unlock your potential by exploring our talent pipelines: Novo Nordisk Talent Pipelines.

Checklist when applying

  • Please answer the questions asked when you apply. We use your answers to identify a possible match between you and our open positions.
  • Please unlock your profile, which you create when applying. This will allow us to match your profile with our open positions. The correct setting states ‘Profile visibility: Novo Nordisk Recruiter Worldwide’.



About Site Kalundborg

At Novo Nordisk manufacturing hub in Kalundborg, we are growing. From 2022-2029 we will invest 60 billion DKK to expand existing facilities for the current and future portfolio within serious chronic diseases. This will establish additional capacity across the entire global value chain from manufacturing of active pharmaceutical ingredients (API) to packaging, with the vast majority being invested in API capacity. With the investment, more than 1200 new jobs will be created. This is your opportunity to be part of our journey and help establish the future factories of Novo Nordisk.

Today, our 4,500 employees at Novo Nordisk Kalundborg produce half of the world’s insulin and a number of biopharmaceutical products, and we are never standing still. Together, we make a difference every day for more than 40 million people living with diabetes and other chronic diseases.

Our site is located a few minutes from the city, and just one stop with the train from the site. The train can also take you directly from the site to Copenhagen in around one hour.

Many newcomers find it easy to build a network of like-minded people coming from Denmark or internationals. Some can find a network through hobbies and sports, social network groups, colleagues or employees from other local businesses. Novo Nordisk Kalundborg

Contact
If you have any questions, feel free to contact us on the following email: processengineeringdk@novonordisk.com

Deadline
Apply before 31 March 2025.

Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, and you are encouraged to apply as soon as possible. You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV.

To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your CV.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.

Title: Research Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you ready for a new beginning?

We need your talent, knowledge and dedication to better our world with biology.

Our purpose points the way

In Novonesis, we know that solutions rooted in biology can help solve humanity’s biggest challenges. Since we began more than a century ago, this has been our guide. It’s how we've gotten so far. And it’s how we'll impact the future. Now, more than ever, the world needs change. And with biosolutions, the possibilities for transformation are endless.

We’re here to better our world with biology.

Research Scientist, Diversity and Prototyping, Novonesis

Lyngby – Denmark

Join us as our new Research Scientist

We are looking for a research scientist with a solid track record in advancing protein/enzyme function and/or stability through protein engineering. The position will be in R&D, Molecular Discovery, Department of Diversity and Prototyping.

In Molecular Discovery, we integrate several competences from wildtype enzyme and protein discovery, molecular biology, assay development, bioinformatics and protein design to identify and engineer enzymes that will succeed and become products in industrial biosolutions.

Welcome to Diversity and Prototyping

The department of Diversity and Prototyping consists of 25 scientists and technicians, collaborating with our application colleagues developing new molecules to test in the application. This we achieve through either new molecules, inspired by nature or through tailoring a known enzyme to the application through protein engineering. The department is closely associated with the greater Molecular Discovery function, which is represented by a diverse set of competences all contributing to early-stage innovation through bioinformatics and design to assay and screening.

As Part Of This Role, We Offer


Exceptional opportunities for professional growth
A friendly, transparent, and supportive work environment
A team-oriented structure that values empowerment and collaboration


In This Role You’ll Make An Impact By

Representing the diversity & prototyping department in an interdisciplinary team to address specific needs across multiple industries. More specifically, you will be supporting and advising our application research colleagues on what type of enzymes or proteins to test and outline strategies to improve lead candidates through protein engineering where needed. Practically, you will be responsible for the cloning and expression of new wild-types or variants. This role therefore requires close collaboration, contribute to an open discussion culture and the ability to adapt to changing needs

in the project and beyond.

To Succeed You Must Have


A PhD degree in biotechnology, biochemistry, chemistry or related field.
Solid enzyme-substrate understanding with the ability to, together with our bioinformatic & design colleagues engineer a molecule for the desired property such as substrate specificity, boosting activity or stabilizing towards an external factor.
Strong molecular biology foundation (e.g. DNA modification) and preferable experience with Bacillus and Aspergillus or similar expression systems.
Flair for bioinformatics, data analysis, statistics and programming (e.g. Python, Jupiter notebooks etc.).
Strong communication skills, an open-minded positive attitude, and a desire to achieve results together with others


Additionally, you must be fluent in English as you will work closely with colleagues of many nationalities.

It’s An Advantage If You Have


Good understanding of assay development and automation
Experience with project leadership/management and wish to develop it further


Location: Workplace Novonesis Innovation Campus in Lyngby, Denmark. Biologiens Vej 2, 2800 Kongens Lyngby, Greater Copenhagen – Denmark.

Application deadline: Monday 12. Jan. 2025

Contact information: For more information, please contact Senior Department Manager Lars Giger (LGI@novonesis.com).

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

At Novonesis we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. We recommend you not to attach a cover letter to your application. Instead, please include a few sentences in your resume/CV about why you are applying. To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your resume/CV.

Novonesis is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability, or veteran status.

Want to learn more?

Learn more about Novonesis, our purpose, and your career opportunities at novonesis.com

Not the right fit for you?

Even if this job isn't the right fit for you, perhaps you know someone who might find it interesting. If so, please feel free to share the job link and encourage them to apply. Thank you for your referral! Please check out our other open positions. The right fit for you could just be a few clicks away.

Title: Graduate i data science
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
”Hos PFA søger vi en ny graduate med interesse for data og AI. Som medlem af vores AI Community får du mulighed for at anvende din tekniske viden, tage ansvar for spændende projekter og samarbejde med et team af engagerede kollegaer. Som graduate i PFA får du 24 måneders personlig og faglig udvikling – designet til at skyde din karriere i fuld gang,” siger Helle Gormsen, leder af AI Udvikling i PFA.

Du skal forbedre PFA’s digitale løsninger med AI

Bliv en af de to nye graduates i PFA’s AI Community, der består af 30 dedikerede kollegaer. Sammen vil vi anvende data og AI til at skabe branchens bedste kundeoplevelser for PFA’s 1,3 millioner kunder. Siden 2017 har vi arbejdet målrettet med AI-udvikling i PFA, og vi har i dag et modent setup med et AI Community fordelt på to teams med data scientists og data science engineers. Vi dækker hele værdikæden fra idé til produktion og effektmåling, med fokus på løsninger, der gør en reel forskel for både PFA’s kunder og vores kollegers hverdag. Eksempler på vores arbejde inkluderer datadrevne anbefalingsmodeller, skalerbar digital rådgivning og machine learning til målrettet sygdomsforebyggelse.

Hos PFA får du mulighed for at lære en masse og se dit arbejde blive implementeret i vores systemer. Din hverdag bliver en blanding af fordybelse i programmering, data og modeller samt udadvendte aktiviteter som deltagelse i tværfaglige arbejdsgrupper og møder med interne kunder. Du bliver en del af et stærkt socialt og fagligt fællesskab i vores AI Community, hvor vi støtter hinanden og prioriterer aktiviteter som demoer, innovationssprint og Townhall-møder.

Du skal bl.a. arbejde med at:


udvikle AI/ML-løsninger til at understøtte og forbedre PFA’s processer og digitale løsninger
lære at sætte AI-løsninger i produktion og bidrage til drift og lifecycle management
anvende ny teknologi og nye metoder i dine løsninger, fx Cloud-værktøjer og eksterne sprogmodeller fra Azure OpenAI Services
tage ansvar for dine egne projekter (i samarbejde med dit team), formidle resultater og indgå i tværfaglige teams.


To år med fuld fart på din udvikling

Som graduate i PFA bygger du venskaber og netværk med de andre graduates. I er sammen på bootcamps, hvor I får en professionel værktøjskasse med træning i bl.a. problem solving, innovation og facilitering. Programmet er designet til, at du udvikler dig både fagligt og personligt. Du er med i netværk og får en mentor, der sparrer med dig og støtter dig. Du er fastansat og tilknyttet én forretningsenhed gennem hele forløbet på 24 måneder. PFA ligger lige ved Nordhavn Metro og tæt på havnebadet. Her får du de bedste rammer for et fedt arbejdsliv. Vi kan arbejde hjemme op til to dage om ugen, men er generelt ret sociale, så du kan lære flere kolleger at kende fx i fredagscafeen, i vores medarbejderklubber eller på bokse-, løbe- og yogahold.

Kan du se dig selv som PFA’er?

For at blive graduate i PFA skal du have en kandidatgrad, og det må max være to år siden, du dimitterede, når programmet starter til september. Du trives med at arbejde med komplekse problemstillinger og forvandle dem til innovative løsninger. Og så har du evner, vilje og interesse for at blive klogere - og spille dine kollegaer gode. Måske kender du også lidt til PFA og synes, at vores kundefællesskab og samfundsansvarlige agenda er helt rigtig.

Du:


er kandidat eller snart færdiguddannet inden for data science, naturvidenskab, civilingeniør, computer science eller lignende områder
har erfaring med Python og stor interesse for data, AI, machine learning og programmering
er dygtig til at skrive kode, analytisk tænkende og god til at løse problemer og generere idéer
værdsætter samarbejde med kollegaer for at udvikle de bedste løsninger sammen.


Ansøg nu – og begynd nedtællingen til september 2025

Send din ansøgning og CV hurtigst muligt og senest den 21. januar 2025. Alle vores graduates begynder som udgangspunkt den 1. september 2025. Du kan læse mere om PFA’s graduate program her Graduate.

Tag endelig fat i os

Har du spørgsmål til den konkrete stilling, kan du kontakte Caroline Amalie Fuglsang-Damgaard, der er Data Scientist i AI Udvikling i PFA, på tlf.: 23 81 06 36. Har du spørgsmål til Graduate programmet, kan du skrive til Karina Roulund Bergmann på krb@pfa.dk.

Vi samarbejder for at vores kunder kan leve et godt liv – både nu og i fremtiden

I PFA bliver du en del af noget stort – både som kunde og som kollega. Vi er omkring 1500 kolleger, der hver dag samarbejder for at gøre en positiv forskel for vores mere end 1,3 mio. kunder og samfund. Vi arbejder for at sikre økonomisk tryghed og sundhed gennem arbejdsliv og gode seniorliv for PFA er med vores kunder hele livet.
Show more

Du er fastansat og tilknyttet én forretningsenhed gennem hele forløbet på 24 måneder. PFA ligger lige ved Nordhavn Metro og tæt på havnebadet. Her får du de bedste rammer for et fedt arbejdsliv. Vi kan arbejde hjemme op til to dage om ugen, men er generelt ret sociale, så du kan lære flere kolleger at kende fx i fredagscafeen, i vores medarbejderklubber eller på bokse-, løbe- og yogahold.

Kan du se dig selv som PFA’er?

For at blive graduate i PFA skal du have en kandidatgrad, og det må max være to år siden, du dimitterede, når programmet starter til september. Du trives med at arbejde med komplekse problemstillinger og forvandle dem til innovative løsninger. Og så har du evner, vilje og interesse for at blive klogere - og spille dine kollegaer gode. Måske kender du også lidt til PFA og synes, at vores kundefællesskab og samfundsansvarlige agenda er helt rigtig.

Du:

  • er kandidat eller snart færdiguddannet inden for data science, naturvidenskab, civilingeniør, computer science eller lignende områder
  • har erfaring med Python og stor interesse for data, AI, machine learning og programmering
  • er dygtig til at skrive kode, analytisk tænkende og god til at løse problemer og generere idéer
  • værdsætter samarbejde med kollegaer for at udvikle de bedste løsninger sammen.

Ansøg nu – og begynd nedtællingen til september 2025

Send din ansøgning og CV hurtigst muligt og senest den 21. januar 2025. Alle vores graduates begynder som udgangspunkt den 1. september 2025. Du kan læse mere om PFA’s graduate program her Graduate.

Tag endelig fat i os

Har du spørgsmål til den konkrete stilling, kan du kontakte Caroline Amalie Fuglsang-Damgaard, der er Data Scientist i AI Udvikling i PFA, på tlf.: 23 81 06 36. Har du spørgsmål til Graduate programmet, kan du skrive til Karina Roulund Bergmann på krb@pfa.dk.

Vi samarbejder for at vores kunder kan leve et godt liv – både nu og i fremtiden

I PFA bliver du en del af noget stort – både som kunde og som kollega. Vi er omkring 1500 kolleger, der hver dag samarbejder for at gøre en positiv forskel for vores mere end 1,3 mio. kunder og samfund. Vi arbejder for at sikre økonomisk tryghed og sundhed gennem arbejdsliv og gode seniorliv for PFA er med vores kunder hele livet.

Title: Data Scientist, Computer Vision
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Data Scientist in our Computer Vision section, you will develop and deploy deep learning models to improve the understanding, alignment and correspondence between 3D models of the construction site and video data gathered using our vSLAM system. As part of an R&D team, you will work on discovery of new solutions through research and rapid prototyping, and translating the findings into delivery of high quality solutions to complex computer vision problems.

Your background

We believe you…


Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
Have a hands-on experience with software development using C++, Python or C#. It is important that you have reached solid coding standards and strive for continuous improvement.
Have a machine learning experience or trained in the area. Hands-on experience with PyTorch and MLFlow is a plus.
Have computer vision experience or trained in the area. Hands-on experience with OpenCV is a plus.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...


C++
OpenGL
Python
PyTorch
MLFlow
Kubernetes


We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...


Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
You’ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
Strong focus on diversity and inclusion – your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.


Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing

Title: Applied Research Scientist - Digital Enterprise Transformation
Place: Hedehusene, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Req Number: 89881

Time Type: Full Time

Do you want to push the boundaries of machine learning and scale it to users across the world? Do you wish for a product centric work environment, where machine learning and analytics drive action – not just insight?

With a strong focus on the applied machine learning research discipline, you will take part in innovation and design of new products, as well as tweak and mature existing ones. You will join a team of highly talented data scientists and collaborate with several product teams consisting of product owners, backend- and frontend developers and DevSecOps specialists. You will be pushing the applied research agenda, aiming to create and continuously innovate the ML systems of tomorrow.

Join a department focused on our most valuable digital products

You will join the Research and AI Lab team in the Digital Enterprise Transformation department. Our new Research and AI Lab unit is characterized by having an intrapreneurial mindset, and is collaborating holistically with established MLOps, DevSecOps and

Data Science teams that have had ML systems in production on a global scale for several years. We strive to base our work on knowledge and insight rather than hierarchical structures, and we make sure that our decisions are based on conversations between people with different competencies rather than one individual.

Examples of what we have worked on in 2024:



Trained, tuned, and served large generative language models for document processing and for conversation using both text and multimodal data.
Designed a new large machine learning system set for release in early 2025.
Implemented and deployed an ‘attention-free’ transformer model, including functionality for large-scale model training and inference.



Current plans set for 2025:



Establish an industrial research presence, including publishing our work in relevant ML journals/conferences and collaboration with academic research institutions.
Become creators rather than consumers in GenAI and multimodal machine learning.
And more!



You thrive when solving highly complex challenges

The use cases we handle tend to have a high degree of complexity, requiring non-deterministic problem solving (i.e., the use of ML/AI), near real-time data processing, a need for high availability, vertical and horizontal scalability, and a very high volume of transactions. Solving complex problems with the use of machine learning, you need an open and analytical mind, finding pragmatic solutions that balance between the theoretical standpoint and what is possible .

Be the driver of our AI/ML and GenAI journey

As our Applied Research Scientist, your work will be multifaceted. We will work on our research agenda and push for new machine learning applications and methods, while ensuring this work is well-adopted by the existing teams for use in downstream products that will directly impact DSV’s divisions. You will have a mix of independent work and participate in existing project-focused teams.

Responsibilities:



Advance GenAI and multimodal research and development: Spearhead applied research in GenAI and multimodal machine learning, encompassing image, layout, and text/language modeling.
Drive applied research that can be applied to DSV’s product development. Drive cross-project innovation to tackle complex challenges and real-world problems to gain new insights and apply findings to enhance model performance and outcomes.
Foundational model development: Independently architect, train, and evaluate foundational models to advance GenAI LLMs and multimodal systems in DSV’s field of work.



Skills and experience we value and would love you to have already:



Educational Background: Preferably a PhD or master's degree in CS, CE, ML or a related field, with proven research experience.
Strong Theoretical Foundation: A comprehensive skill set in mathematics, statistics, and algorithms is essential for implementing research ideas, building upon existing research to create new, and adapting established work to our domain.
Software Development: A good understanding of core programming and development concepts: data structures, algorithms, and object-oriented programming. You will both be performing rapid prototyping and contribute to large collaborative machine learning codebases. We primarily use Python due to the high availability of machine learning frameworks.
Publications and Open-Source Contributions: Proven track record of first-author peer-reviewed publications that demonstrate your ability to lead research projects and navigate the publication process, along with contributions to open-source projects.
Model Development and Architecture: Proficiency in building from scratch, modifying and optimizing existing models and in advanced model architectures, particularly for GenAI and multimodal applications .
Accelerated and Distributed Compute: Proficiency in accelerated parallel computing, including scalable data processing and leveraging of GPU technology for enhanced performance and model training scalability. We use frameworks such as: PyTorch, Kedro, Apache Beam, and more.
Continuous Learning: Commitment to staying current with the latest advancements in machine learning and applying new academic insights to solve complex business challenges.
Practical Experience: Hands-on experience with large-scale, real-world machine learning projects.
Self-Starter & Ownership: We're looking for someone who is proactive, takes initiative, and can drive projects independently. You should be comfortable taking ownership of objectives and pushing things forward.



We understand that no candidate may meet every single requirement listed here. If you meet some of the qualifications, but not all, we still encourage you to apply! We're looking for passionate individuals who are eager to grow and contribute to our team.

What we offer to you:



Direct Communication: We engage directly with VP and C-level stakeholders, ensuring your insights and contributions are heard at the highest levels.
Influence on MLOps: Play a key role in shaping our mature, in-house MLOps platform, working with a dynamic and growing team.
Global Scale Experience: Leverage our extensive experience with ML systems in production on a global scale, benefiting from our experience in development and operations processes for large-scale machine learning systems.
A proven team: A group which is already self-financed based on realized returns of machine learning business cases.
Research and AI Lab: Be part of our new Research and AI Lab initiative, where you can influence methodologies, the direction, and the research agenda.



If you want to apply

We will be happy to answer any questions you may have regarding the position and about your options in DSV. You are welcome to call Ramus Kær Jørgensen on +45 25452587.

We look forward to receiving your application as soon as possible. We will process the applications as we receive them.

DSV – Global Transport and Logistics

DSV is a dynamic workplace that fosters inclusivity and diversity. We conduct our business with integrity, respecting different cultures and the dignity and rights of individuals. When you join DSV, you are working for one of the very best performing companies in the transport and logistics industry. You’ll join a talented team of approximately 75,000 employees in over 80 countries, working passionately to deliver great customer experiences and high-quality services. DSV aspires to lead the way towards a more sustainable future for our industry and are committed to trading on nature’s terms.

We promote collaboration and transparency and strive to attract, motivate and retain talented people in a culture of respect. If you are driven, talented and wish to be part of a progressive and versatile organisation, we’ll support you and your need to achieve your potential and forward your career.

Visit dsv.com and follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter.

Title: Research Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you ready for a new beginning?

We need your talent, knowledge and dedication to better our world with biology.

Our purpose points the way

In Novonesis, we know that solutions rooted in biology can help solve humanity’s biggest challenges. Since we began more than a century ago, this has been our guide. It’s how we've gotten so far. And it’s how we'll impact the future. Now, more than ever, the world needs change. And with biosolutions, the possibilities for transformation are endless.

We’re here to better our world with biology.

Research Scientist for Product and Process Development agile team family, Solid Products Development & Innovation, Novonesis

Join us as our new Research Scientist

Are you eager to try out your talent and ambitions developing innovative products and processes in Novonesis’ largest formulation pilot plant?

In Product and Process development we have the responsibility to make the products and processes for our worldwide production sites. You will be in a cross-functional agile team (with members of fermentation, recovery, and formulation) with a primary focus to create new biosolutions that excite our customers. Your role will be to develop and scale-up new solid enzyme/protein products and processes to production scale, assisted by product/process models and other digital tools that you will build. To succeed you will combine insights of digitalization, enzymes/proteins, and powder processes (e.g. granulation, spray drying, fluid bed processing), and together with your agile team you will select the optimal solutions both for customer value and product quality. You will be in direct contact with our colleagues in marketing, production, pilot plants, application, and other R&D departments in Novonesis as well as external customers. You will drive results on your own and together with other highly skilled scientists and pilot/lab technicians.

Welcome to Solid Products Development & Innovation (SPDI)

We are part of Formulation Development, where we are responsible for development of enzyme and other protein products and production processes, upscaling of new products and technologies, as well as supporting and improving our existing product range. In SPDI, we are a team of 15 highly engaged, multicultural scientists, with a passion for enzyme formulation, solids processing, and product innovation. We cooperate with many of Novonesis’ functions locally and internationally.

In This Role You’ll Make An Impact By


Developing and optimizing solid formulations and processes with focus on quality, stability, and optimal format for the final commercial products
Improving the way we work by driving digital transformation in the department, developing product/process models and other tools, such as Python-based apps
Working independently as well as taking the responsibility as project leader and as a team player, contributing to a high performing cross-functional Agile Team
Supporting customers, doing production troubleshooting, and scaling up to our global production plants


To Succeed You Must


Have a MSc degree in chemical or biochemical engineering, preferentially combined with a PhD
Have experience with first-principles or mechanistic modelling and data-driven decision making and be familiar with a programming language such as Python/Matlab/R
Be independent with strong personal drive, while enjoying collaboration and communication with different stakeholders
Have experience within solids processing, e.g. spray drying, fluid bed processing, granulation or similar process technologies is an advantage
Enjoy project management and taking a role as project leader
Have experience with planning and executing experiments and enjoy day to day collaboration with highly skilled pilot and laboratory technicians


Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

Location: Bagsvaerd, Copenhagen, Denmark

Application deadline: 19-01-2025

Contact details: Kåre Jørgensen Engsted, Head of Solid Products Development and Innovation, KJQE@novonesis.com

At Novonesis we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.


Please attach a cover letter to your application explaining your motivation for applying for this job.


To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your resume/CV.

Also, please attach your transcripts from undergraduate and postgraduate (if applicable) studies.

Novonesis is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability, or veteran status.

Want to learn more?

Learn more about Novonesis, our purpose, and your career opportunities at novonesis.com

Not the right fit for you?

Even if this job isn't the right fit for you, perhaps you know someone who might find it interesting. If so, please feel free to share the job link and encourage them to apply. Thank you for your referral! Please check out our other open positions. The right fit for you could just be a few clicks away.

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

At Novonesis we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. We recommend you not to attach a cover letter to your application. Instead, please include a few sentences in your resume/CV about why you are applying. To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your resume/CV.

Novonesis is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability, or veteran status.

Want to learn more?

Learn more about Novonesis, our purpose, and your career opportunities at novonesis.com

Even if this job isn't the right fit for you, perhaps you know someone who might find it interesting. If so, please feel free to share the job link and encourage them to apply. Thank you for your referral! Please check out our other open positions. The right fit for you could just be a few clicks away.

  • Working independently as well as taking the responsibility as project leader and as a team player, contributing to a high performing cross-functional Agile Team
  • Supporting customers, doing production troubleshooting, and scaling up to our global production plants

To Succeed You Must

  • Have a MSc degree in chemical or biochemical engineering, preferentially combined with a PhD
  • Have experience with first-principles or mechanistic modelling and data-driven decision making and be familiar with a programming language such as Python/Matlab/R
  • Be independent with strong personal drive, while enjoying collaboration and communication with different stakeholders
  • Have experience within solids processing, e.g. spray drying, fluid bed processing, granulation or similar process technologies is an advantage
  • Enjoy project management and taking a role as project leader
  • Have experience with planning and executing experiments and enjoy day to day collaboration with highly skilled pilot and laboratory technicians

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

Location: Bagsvaerd, Copenhagen, Denmark

Application deadline: 19-01-2025

Contact details: Kåre Jørgensen Engsted, Head of Solid Products Development and Innovation, KJQE@novonesis.com

Title: Senior Data Scientist for Performance Management and Analytics
Description:
As a Data Scientist, you will enhance predictive analytics, build automation and drive impactful improvements across the organisation.

Data Scientist specialising in process performance
As a Data Scientist specialising in process performance, you will enhance and automate predictive performance models. You will unlock new potential through AI and machine learning to predict outcomes while ensuring the consistent use of standardised data, methods and measures across the organisation. Additionally, you will support and validate critical KPIs.

Systematic is rated at CMMI Maturity Level 5, a distinction held by only a few companies worldwide. Your work will help maintain this high maturity level through clear and impactful process performance reporting combined with effective measurement of our improvement initiatives.

This is a newly established role, created as part of our ambition to elevate our performance management capability to the next level!

In this role, you will collaborate with teams across the organisation to turn data into actionable insights, ensuring that our processes are optimised and consistent and aligned with business goals. Your key responsibilities include:


Developing and validating process-performance models:
Gathering and validating data to build reliable models that reflect business needs.
Automating and improving reporting:
Enhancing quarterly process-performance baseline reporting and contributing to the Wall of Fame initiative.
Supporting master data quality.
Analysing data to provide the insights needed for precise and quantitative decisions.
Automating and improving prediction through the use of statistical techniques, machine learning and/or AI.
Participating in CMMI Appraisals.



The team
You will be part of a small, dedicated team of highly skilled specialists. Organised within the Finance department, the team collaborates closely with our internal Business Intelligence team and our Business Process Management team. Most importantly, it works across the organisation to support our programme managers in achieving process performance objectives. The team’s mission is to ensure, maintain and enhance a high level of maturity throughout Systematic.

Driven by automation and predictive analysis
We are looking for an experienced and driven candidate with a relevant bachelor’s or master’s degree who is passionate about automation and predictive analysis.

You thrive on working with data, statistics and numbers, and your structured approach ensures high-quality results.
At the same time, you have the curiosity and creativity to think outside the box and find innovative solutions.
We expect you to have several years of experience with R, VBA, robotics or similar, and the ability to leverage these technologies to drive automations.
You are proactive, motivated to push things forward and you enjoy working at the intersection of data, technology and business optimisation.



Please note that you must be able to present a clean criminal record and have lived in a NATO/EU country for the past seven years as we work with security-classified projects. Read more here.

Never stop developing
Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish and uniquely people centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. Systematic is not just a place to work but a place to belong.

You can look forward to joining our Employees Club, which organises almost 100 social/professional events a year – plenty to choose from. Our colleagues also highlight our canteen, which serves a variety of delicious and healthy dishes each day. Finally, we are always up for a friendly game of padel at our padel court in Aarhus!

Start your development here
We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis as we wish to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so click Apply Now and send us your CV today. If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Bettina Damm, Senior Specialist.

Get in touch

Sofie Heiner Emborg

Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant

Title: Software Engineer to ALTEN Denmark
Description:
Are you a talented Software Engineer seeking your next opportunity? Join our Engineering team in Denmark, where exciting challenges await!




Your role as Software Engineer:

As a Software Engineer at ALTEN, you will play a key role in strengthening the section for integration of software and hardware. You will be a part of a talented team where you develop state of the art technology together with electronics engineers, firmware and software developers.




Who are you?

To be a good match for the role we we believe that you have a great experience in C++, it could be both close to the hardware or object oriented. Experience in C is also of interest. You are a driven and engaged colleague with a problem-solving mind and a team player. We also see that you have a B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Mechanical Engineering, Electronic Engineering, or other equivalent education and at least 5+ years of experience within a relevant area.




We also think our new colleague have experience from:

Python or Java
SQL
Machine learning (TensorFloe, Scikit-learn)
Cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google cloud)




It is meritorious if you also have:

experience of UX design
experience working with control algorithms
experience of version control systems




Location: Aarhus, Denmark.




Please note: Due to holidays, there will be no selection until 09.01.25. Merry Christmas and Happy New Year!




As part of our team, you can expect the following:

Full-time employment at ALTEN Denmark

Opportunities for international mobility

Access to internal education, certifications, and professional development programs offered by ALTEN Academy

Diverse range of assignments with different clients and industries

Career coaching and guidance with the support of our dedicated Business Managers




About ALTEN:

ALTEN is a leading provider of outsourced Engineering and Technology Services, operating in over 35 countries with a workforce of more than 57,000 employees. In Denmark, ALTEN has been on a successful growth trajectory since 2019, delivering innovative solutions within Engineering and Life Science. Our team of skilled engineers undertakes complex and technically demanding projects across various industries, collaborating with renowned companies throughout the value chain and are presented in various locations in Denmark!

Title: AI Solutions Engineer (Netherlands based)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Us

Axelera AI is not your regular deep-tech startup. We are creating the next-generation AI platform to support anyone who wants to help advancing humanity and improve the world around us.

In just three years, we have raised a total of $120 million and have built a world-class team of 180+ employees (including 55+ PhDs with more than 40,000 citations), both remotely from 11 different countries and with offices in Belgium, Switzerland, Italy, the UK, headquartered at the High Tech Campus in Eindhoven, Netherlands.

We have also launched our Metis™ AI Platform, which achieves a 3-5x increase in efficiency and performance, and have visibility into a strong business pipeline exceeding $100 million.

Our unwavering commitment to innovation has firmly established us as a global industry pioneer.

Are you up for the challenge?

Position Overview:

We are seeking a talented and experienced AI Solutions Engineer to be based in Eindhoven or Amsterdam, with expertise in machine learning and computer vision to join our dynamic team. As a Solutions Engineer at Axelera AI, you will play a critical role in designing and implementing AI-driven solutions tailored to our clients' specific needs. You will work closely with clients, sales teams, and technical stakeholders to understand requirements, develop solution designs, and oversee the implementation of scalable and robust machine learning systems.

Responsibilities:


Work closely with clients to understand objectives, then design AI-driven machine learning and computer vision solutions to address their needs.
Develop and optimize computer vision architectures with a focus on GStreamer-based pipelines for enhanced video and data processing efficiency.
Collaborate with the sales team to craft proposals and effectively present solution designs and technical benefits to clients.
Oversee the implementation process, guiding cross-functional teams to ensure alignment with solution designs and project goals.
Work alongside data scientists and engineers to prototype, develop, and deploy machine learning models, with a focus on efficient GStreamer integration.
Conduct performance optimizations, troubleshoot solutions, and assess scalability for reliable solution delivery.
Stay current with industry advancements to drive innovation within the team.
Mentor junior team members, fostering knowledge-sharing and a collaborative work culture.


Requirements:


5+ years of experience in designing and implementing computer vision solutions, with specific expertise in GStreamer for pipeline optimization.
Strong knowledge of machine learning concepts, experience in developing, training, and deploying models.
Proficient in Python, C/C++, and machine learning libraries (e.g., PyTorch, OpenCV, TensorFlow) and highly experienced with GStreamer, CUDA, and TensorRT.
Skilled in integrating various hardware platforms, including cameras, LiDAR, and other sensors, with GStreamer.
Familiar with Linux (Ubuntu) and other operating systems.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to translate business needs into technical solutions.
Effective communication skills for engaging with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Familiarity with agile practices, DevOps, and CI/CD pipelines is advantageous.
Relevant certifications in machine learning, cloud computing, or architecture are a plus, along with a commitment to ongoing learning and innovation.


Location

We support relocation to Amsterdam or Eindhoven for talent based abroad and interested in this role. Please note that this position requires presence in the Eindhoven office approximately 3-5 times per month / as required by business & cannot be done remotely.

What We Offer

This is your chance to shape and be part of a dynamic, fast-growing, international organization. We offer an attractive compensation package, including a pension plan, extensive employee insurances and the option to get company shares.

An open culture that supports creativity and continual innovation is awaiting you. Collaborative ownership and freedom with responsibility is characteristic for the way we act and work as a team.

At Axelera AI, we wholeheartedly embrace equal opportunity and hold diversity in the highest regard. Our steadfast commitment is to cultivate a warm and inclusive environment that empowers and celebrates every member of our team. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds to join us in shaping the future of AI.

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Moderation
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
APPLY HERE: Senior Data Scientist, Moderation




Job Description

Can you drive measurable value through the applied use of data science? Are you passionate about helping us create an online environment that is safe for kids?




Core Responsibilities:

The utilization of Data Science and AI is rapidly growing within the LEGO Group. We use the methodologies to discover deeper insights, make predictions, or generate recommendations to continue delivering world class learning-through play experiences to children.

You will be joining the Data Science & AI organisation, which is the home of 50 data scientists and engineering colleagues, distributed across our Denmark and UK offices.

You will be part of the moderation product team, working alongside Software and Data/MLOps Engineers, which has the purpose moderating the LEGO Group’s online channels to ensure that we have a safe digital experience for kids and adults. Additionally, you will get to work on Data Science opportunities in adjacent product teams in the Consumer Technology area as the need arises.




Your tasks will include:

Advise on the direction for the AI/ML systems for moderating online channels.
Ensure continuous high performance of the deployed moderation services and algorithms, defining and measuring key performances indicators, and conducting experiments.
Develop and implement customized moderation models.
Collaborating with stakeholders to ensure that data science work is delivering real value.
Provide actionable insights to stakeholders based on data analysis.
Staying up to date with AI & machine learning developments across the industry.
Work on adjacent Data Science opportunities and consulting on adjacent product team when required.
Contribute to our ways of working and help establish best practices.




Do you have what it takes?

We are looking for a candidate with emphasis on one or more of the following: data science, computer science, engineering, mathematics, or an equivalent quantitative subject area.

You have previous experience creating working ML and AI solutions in a large organization and are used to working in an agile cross functional setup and with a broad range of stakeholders.

Strong analytical skills with the ability to communicate complex data relationships effectively
Proficiency with Python (or similar languages) and its libraries for machine learning such as PySpark, scikit-learn, pandas and pytorch.
Practical experience in data science, spanning both analytics to derive the right solutions and implementation of Machine Learning models.
Collaborative spirit and a playful can-do attitude.
Persistent with a well-rounded view on creating solutions.
Experience with tools and platforms such as Databricks and MLflow for ML training and experimenting is highly desirable.
Experience in consumer engagement or content moderation domain will be considered a bonus.




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.







We are proud supporters of Women in Data®. Connect, engage and belong to the largest free female data community in the UK – visit: www.womenindata.co.uk to join our community.




“Stay connected! Follow us on LinkedIn for updates on career opportunities and more.”

Title: Experienced Process Engineers & Scientists Pipeline - Greater Copenhagen Area & Hillerød
Description:
Calling all experienced Process Engineers and Scientists! Are you an experienced Process Engineer or Scientist looking for a new challenge? Do you want to work for a fast-growing pharmaceutical company that is dedicated to improving the lives of millions of patients worldwide? If so, we want to hear from you!

If you are interested in bringing your skills and experience to a team that aims to improve lives of millions of patients worldwide, and you already have experience working with data analysis, process systems, descriptive and prescriptive analytics, then you might be the next Experienced Process Engineer or Scientist to join one of our many production sites in the Greater Copenhagen Area or Hillerød, Denmark! Read on and apply today!

The Position
We are looking for Experienced Process Engineers & Scientists who have an interest in understanding pharmaceutical processes, developing monitoring tools and analyzing data for recommendations and improvements. Furthermore, you have an interest in business impact and understanding how interconnected decisions play a crucial role when manufacturing pharmaceuticals.

Specifically, you have several years of professional experience in:



Analyzing large amounts of data for extracting correlation and causation for process understanding.
Working and understanding data from Quality Control (QC) and Quality Assurance (QA).
Developing, maintaining, and recommending statistical process control charts for process monitoring.
Utilizing a science, data-based approach for quantifying process deviations.
Operating in a team-based approach for recommending process improvements and optimizations.
Handling deviations when processes do not operate as intended.
Writing and executing change requests to implement improvements including validation when required.
Developing maintenance strategies to optimize running time.
Coordinating with other process owners in the department to ensure optimal production capacity at all times.
Taking part in cross-functional meetings to align and further develop processes across the production site.




In this role, you will have the opportunity to develop and enhance your professional and personal skills while shaping the future of manufacturing across our organization, in close collaboration with other colleagues in Novo Nordisk.

Qualifications

Experienced Process Engineers & Scientists candidates should have the following qualifications:



Bachelor’s or master’s degree in chemistry, natural science, mechanical engineering, production engineering or a related field.
Solid experience in manufacturing, with GMP experience being an advantage.
Understanding of scientific principles required for manufacturing pharmaceutical substances related to the interaction of chemistry and equipment.
Ability to monitor data and extract information independently.
Curiosity for connecting the understanding of process science to product quality.
Appetite for solving complex problems applying a systematic approach to manage complexity and reach feasible applicable solutions.
Professional proficiency in verbal and written English. Knowledge of Danish or other languages is considered a plus.




For Experienced Process Engineers & Scientists, it is key that you understand how to convey complex information to varying audiences, so we get everyone on board. In this role you will collaborate with different departments and have a broad landscape of stakeholders.

Apply and be matched with multiple job opportunities
When you apply to our pipeline, you will be considered for all Experienced and Senior Process Engineer & Scientist positions across Product Supply & Quality (PSQ) in the locations where you have shown interest in. If you prefer a specific production or business area, please indicate it in your CV, and we will do our best to find the right fit for you.

We continuously match your profile with all suitable positions to ensure that you don't miss out on any life-changing career opportunities. This means that you will automatically be considered for all openings in the area across our factories. Don't wait any longer to take the next step in your career - apply now and let us help you find the perfect match!

We review applications continuously and if we identify a match, you will be invited for an interview. When an opportunity arises, we will reach out, tell you about the position and invite you for an interview with the Hiring Manager. You will only be contacted if we find a relevant position that matches your profile, and we have a Hiring Manager who is interested in your profile.

We will keep your application for up to six months ensuring the best opportunities to provide a strong match for open positions, unless you inform us that you wish to withdraw.

Ready to elevate your career? Our talent pipelines offer diverse opportunities tailored to various skill sets and goals. If you still feel unsure, we cordially invite you to investigate which pathway aligns with your strengths and aspirations. Embrace the future and unlock your potential by ex-ploring our talent pipelines: Novo Nordisk Talent Pipelines.

Checklist when applying


Please answer the questions asked when you apply. We use your answers to identify possible match between you and our open positions.
Unlock your profile, which you create when applying. This will allow us to match your profile with our open positions. The correct setting states ‘Profile visibility: Novo Nordisk Recruiter Worldwide’.




About The Greater Copenhagen Area

We have many different sites in the Greater Copenhagen Area: in Bagsværd, Gentofte, Kirke Værløse, Køge, Lyngby and Måløv, so remember to clearly state which locations you are interested in applying to.

About Site Hillerød

Site Hillerød is an innovative and fast-growing production site. With over 4,000 talented employees, we work together to drive change for people living with serious chronic diseases. The site is in beautiful natural surroundings, and we offer a diverse array of career paths at all educational levels. Join our vibrant community at Site Hillerød and ramp up your career while we ramp up our production! Get to know us better - visit our Site Hillerød career page.

Novo Nordisk Hillerød

Contact
If you have any questions, feel free to contact us on the following email: processengineeringdk@novonordisk.com.

Deadline
Apply before 31 March 2025.

Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, and you are encouraged to apply as soon as possible. You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV.

To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your CV.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.
