HTML:
Calling all experienced Process Engineers and Scientists! Are you an experienced Process Engineer or Scientist looking for a new challenge? Do you want to work for a fast-growing pharmaceutical company that is dedicated to improving the lives of millions of patients worldwide? If so, we want to hear from you!

If you are interested in bringing your skills and experience to a team that aims to improve lives of millions of patients worldwide, and you already have experience working with data analysis, process systems, descriptive and prescriptive analytics, then you might be the next Experienced Process Engineer or Scientist to join one of our many production sites in the Greater Copenhagen Area or Hillerød, Denmark! Read on and apply today!

The Position
We are looking for Experienced Process Engineers & Scientists who have an interest in understanding pharmaceutical processes, developing monitoring tools and analyzing data for recommendations and improvements. Furthermore, you have an interest in business impact and understanding how interconnected decisions play a crucial role when manufacturing pharmaceuticals.

Specifically, you have several years of professional experience in:


  • Analyzing large amounts of data for extracting correlation and causation for process understanding.
  • Working and understanding data from Quality Control (QC) and Quality Assurance (QA).
  • Developing, maintaining, and recommending statistical process control charts for process monitoring.
  • Utilizing a science, data-based approach for quantifying process deviations.
  • Operating in a team-based approach for recommending process improvements and optimizations.
  • Handling deviations when processes do not operate as intended.
  • Writing and executing change requests to implement improvements including validation when required.
  • Developing maintenance strategies to optimize running time.
  • Coordinating with other process owners in the department to ensure optimal production capacity at all times.
  • Taking part in cross-functional meetings to align and further develop processes across the production site.



In this role, you will have the opportunity to develop and enhance your professional and personal skills while shaping the future of manufacturing across our organization, in close collaboration with other colleagues in Novo Nordisk.

Qualifications

Experienced Process Engineers & Scientists candidates should have the following qualifications:


  • Bachelor’s or master’s degree in chemistry, natural science, mechanical engineering, production engineering or a related field.
  • Solid experience in manufacturing, with GMP experience being an advantage.
  • Understanding of scientific principles required for manufacturing pharmaceutical substances related to the interaction of chemistry and equipment.
  • Ability to monitor data and extract information independently.
  • Curiosity for connecting the understanding of process science to product quality.
  • Appetite for solving complex problems applying a systematic approach to manage complexity and reach feasible applicable solutions.
  • Professional proficiency in verbal and written English. Knowledge of Danish or other languages is considered a plus.



For Experienced Process Engineers & Scientists, it is key that you understand how to convey complex information to varying audiences, so we get everyone on board. In this role you will collaborate with different departments and have a broad landscape of stakeholders.

Apply and be matched with multiple job opportunities
When you apply to our pipeline, you will be considered for all Experienced and Senior Process Engineer & Scientist positions across Product Supply & Quality (PSQ) in the locations where you have shown interest in. If you prefer a specific production or business area, please indicate it in your CV, and we will do our best to find the right fit for you.

We continuously match your profile with all suitable positions to ensure that you don't miss out on any life-changing career opportunities. This means that you will automatically be considered for all openings in the area across our factories. Don't wait any longer to take the next step in your career - apply now and let us help you find the perfect match!

We review applications continuously and if we identify a match, you will be invited for an interview. When an opportunity arises, we will reach out, tell you about the position and invite you for an interview with the Hiring Manager. You will only be contacted if we find a relevant position that matches your profile, and we have a Hiring Manager who is interested in your profile.

We will keep your application for up to six months ensuring the best opportunities to provide a strong match for open positions, unless you inform us that you wish to withdraw.

Ready to elevate your career? Our talent pipelines offer diverse opportunities tailored to various skill sets and goals. If you still feel unsure, we cordially invite you to investigate which pathway aligns with your strengths and aspirations. Embrace the future and unlock your potential by ex-ploring our talent pipelines: Novo Nordisk Talent Pipelines.

Checklist when applying

  • Please answer the questions asked when you apply. We use your answers to identify possible match between you and our open positions.
  • Unlock your profile, which you create when applying. This will allow us to match your profile with our open positions. The correct setting states ‘Profile visibility: Novo Nordisk Recruiter Worldwide’.



About The Greater Copenhagen Area

We have many different sites in the Greater Copenhagen Area: in Bagsværd, Gentofte, Kirke Værløse, Køge, Lyngby and Måløv, so remember to clearly state which locations you are interested in applying to.

About Site Hillerød

Site Hillerød is an innovative and fast-growing production site. With over 4,000 talented employees, we work together to drive change for people living with serious chronic diseases. The site is in beautiful natural surroundings, and we offer a diverse array of career paths at all educational levels. Join our vibrant community at Site Hillerød and ramp up your career while we ramp up our production! Get to know us better - visit our Site Hillerød career page.

Novo Nordisk Hillerød

Contact
If you have any questions, feel free to contact us on the following email: processengineeringdk@novonordisk.com.

Deadline
Apply before 31 March 2025.

Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, and you are encouraged to apply as soon as possible. You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV.

To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your CV.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.

Title: Software Engineer (with a passion for data)
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you a software engineer with a passion for data? or, a data engineer with an interest in creating software solutions?

Either way, this role is what you've been waiting for if you're passionate about data and software!

The partner area develops innovative IT solutions to help our partners optimize their selling processes, achieve seamless content integrations, and effectively capture sales data.

Responsibilities





Work closely with product managers, designers, data specialists, and fellow engineers to
Gather and interpret requirements
Transform requirements into effective technical solutions
Adopt DevOps principles
Design, code, deploy, and maintain backend services and data pipelines
Prioritize the success of the group with a strong team-first mentality
Actively support colleagues in achieving shared goals




Requirements





Demonstrated expertise in foundational programming concepts is essential.
Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts, cloud technologies, data modelling, data governance.
Relevant experience using SQL, dbt, Python, Spark, Databricks, AWS stack or any other cloud technologies or similar tech stack.
Ability to take end-to-end responsibility of designing and developing data products starting from requirement scoping to delivery having a keen eye for automation.
Experience in building efficient data pipelines, ability to navigate through complex scripts and work on performance tuning.
Experience with agile ways of working
Focused on quality at all stages of the software lifecycle
Ability to troubleshoot, research, and work through complex problems
Excellent written and verbal communication skills




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different underrepresented backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. For all candidates, if you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.
Show more

Title: Junior Platform Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who are we?




We are Penneo, and we are on a mission to scale!

At Penneo, we want to build a world where you can trust the way businesses do business.

Penneo combines digital signing and Know Your Customer (KYC) workflows into a single platform that streamlines critical business processes for anti-money-laundering regulated B2B companies.

Founded in Copenhagen and operating throughout Europe, Penneo is fast becoming the go-to platform for companies looking to save time on administrative tasks while ensuring complete regulatory compliance and peace of mind for themselves and their clients.

Following our listing on Nasdaq Copenhagen Main Market in April 2022, we are now more than ever in a position to execute our European expansion strategy and scale our operations to maximize value to our existing and future customers.




Who are we looking for?

At Penneo, we are always looking to forge new long-term relationships with people who resonate with our culture and values and are passionate about getting Penneo to the next level.




Do you want to be part of it?

We are now hiring a Junior Platform Engineer who will work with the rest of the team to facilitate the building and operations of the Platform; you will be mentored directly on the tools and techniques used in this GitOps centric team. As you grow in your skill set you will be expected to pick up your own projects and grow towards becoming a Senior Platform Engineer.

You will report to our Director of Platform and have our awesome Engineering Teams as your closest collaborators.

This is a full-time position at our Penneo HQ in Copenhagen, Denmark.




About the team

Previously called “Infrastructure Team”, The Platform Team was rebranded to better fit our ambitions to build a platform that can be used across products to enable our engineers to be more independent.

To fit the growth of our Engineering department, we want to scale the Platform team to meet the demands of the other product teams. The good news is that joining a growing team will give you the opportunity to shape how this team evolves, which best practices to follow, and establish ways of working. The Platform team is growing and is currently formed by the Director of Platform and two Senior Platform Engineers. The Engineering team consists of 20+ people, and zooming out, Penneo as a whole, recently became a 100+ people company.




What would be your responsibilities?

A big part of your role will be developing, deploying, and maintaining DevOps tooling and Infrastructure to make the software delivery system run smoothly. This also involves building reusable components, creating new and maintaining existing environments.

Supporting the development teams in getting code into production and providing them with the needed self service tooling to accelerate their daily work.

You will be expected to learn to design, plan and implement secure and reliable infrastructure and then maintain it through its lifecycles.




You will also be expected to

Help design well-architected solutions, based on proven design patterns or paradigms.
Facilitate initiatives to improve any aspect of the Platform like reliability, performance, security, costs, etc.
Approach challenges in a creative and innovative manner, always trying to find the optimal solution for each requirement.
Collaborate closely with others, specially but not limited to product teams, developers, and senior management.
Keep up to speed with emerging technologies, learn new skills (how to make use of them too!).




What makes you a great match?

Even though we appreciate your experience with other technologies and tools, we are currently specifically looking for someone that has experience with the following

Cloud Providers : Amazon Web Services
Infrastructure as Code : Ansible, Terraform.
CI/CD Platforms : GitHub Actions
Kubernetes : Service Meshes, CNIs, Runtime Security, CRDs, Operators, Sidecars.
Logging : Loki
Metrics : Prometheus and CloudWatch
Tracing : Jaeger, OpenTelemetry (experience with Grafana Tempo is a plus)
Cloud Networking : Experience with L3/L4 Firewalls, Routing, and IPSec VPNs (BGP, AWS Transit Gateway, and DirectConnect are a plus). Knowledge of Juniper Routing/Switching is nice to have.
Software Engineering : Experience with Python.
PKI : Experience with OpenSSL, certificate lifecycle are a plus.




Every engineer has a unique mix of skills and experience, we will definitely take into consideration any relevant experience outside the ones mentioned above. The list above aims to showcase what kind of talent we are looking for. If you want deeper insights into our stack, check https://stackshare.io/penneo/platform




How will this role progress?

It is important to us to be as transparent as possible and to allow you to level expectations for the role. Therefore, we share our impact description in advance and would love your thoughts about it in your cover letter.




During the 1st month, you will:

Meet your new colleagues and understand who is doing what
Get comfortable with the day-to-day operations of the Platform Engineering Team
Understand the problems Penneo solves for customers
Fulfill onboarding requirements, obtain credentials and required accesses
Get acquainted with the Platform Engineering team’s Roadmap
Improve or add missing documentation while going through the setup and onboarding process
Make your first contribution to the platform codebase




Within 3 months, you will:

Contribute individually to changes
Familiarize yourself with the architectures of all products
Identify opportunities to automate processes throughout the software development lifecycle




Within 6 months, you will:

Feel comfortable working with most of the products and engineering teams
Be able to propose, plan and execute improvements from the platform roadmap
Understand how to troubleshoot bugs and handle incidents in production environments




Within 12 months, you will:

Have contributed individually to our products and the platform




At this point, we want to support you in expressing your ambitious growth aspirations, and we're eager to learn on the journey with you. It all depends on your capabilities for continuous learning and, equally important - your dreams for the future.

By now, we hope you're sitting with a smile on your face, ready to apply and contribute to the Penneo adventure.




Best of success with your application!




We are screening and interviewing on an ongoing basis. If you are interested in any of our roles, please do not hesitate to submit your application.




Penneo is an equal-opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, hiring, and promotion are based on merit and business needs. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, or expression.

Please be aware that if hired, as part of our Background check, we require a copy of your criminal record. We do that to ensure that we remain a trusted service provider and partner as well as to comply with relevant compliance requirements such as ISO27001.

Title: Front-End Developer Internship at Trendbook
Place: Frederiksberg Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Location: Office at Frederiksberg - Remote/Hybrid (Flexible)

Type: Unpaid Internship (Part-time/Full-time)

Duration: 3-6 months with the possibility of extension or hire.

Language Preference: Danish is preferred, but English is also great - don’t hold back if you’re the right fit!

Cover: Have you ever imagined what it’s like to work at an innovative AI startup? As a Trendbook intern, you’ll dive into a dynamic environment where you’ll explore everything from crafting intuitive user interfaces to experimenting with cutting-edge machine learning technologies. Unlike many large corporate companies, here you’ll get real, hands-on experience with our platform, and the work you do will go directly into production, making a tangible impact. The most important qualities we’re looking for are a passion for learning and a knack for coming up with creative solutions to tackle our ever-evolving challenges. You’ll work closely with our CTO, Hans, gaining hands-on experience and contributing to meaningful projects that make an impact.

About Trendbook

Trendbook is an innovative AI-driven fashion app/platform that transforms fashion inspo into instant shopping. Think of us as your tech-savvy, fashion-forward best friend who turns “Ooh, I love that outfit!” into “Here’s where you can buy it - right now.” As a fast-growing startup, we’re building something exciting and need your help to make it look and feel as awesome as it sounds.

Currently, we have a selection of 1.3 million commissionable products from over 5,000 top brands - and we're just getting started!

What You’ll Do

As a Front-End Developer Intern, you will:


Collaborate with Our Tech Founder: Work closely with our tech-savvy co-founder and CTO, Hans - to learn the ropes, tackle real challenges, and make meaningful contributions to the development of our app and platform.
Craft Seamless User Experiences: Turn designs into reality by creating beautiful, intuitive interfaces for our AI-powered app and web platform.
Build Features That Shine: Develop and implement front-end features that make Trendbook the go-to destination for fashion lovers.
Test, Tweak, and Perfect: Optimize performance, fix bugs, and ensure everything runs smoothly across all devices and browsers.
Learn and Grow: Gain hands-on experience and insights into the world of startups, AI, and fashion-tech.
Contribute to a Big Vision: Your work will have a tangible impact, helping us take Trendbook from promising startup to global game-changer.


You’ll Be a Great Fit If…

You’re familiar with—or excited to dive into—any of the following technologies:


Flutter
Next.js
Tailwind CSS
TypeScript
Python
Supabase
Node.js
Figma


Whether you’re already a pro or just eager to roll up your sleeves and learn, we’re excited to have you on board!

What We Offer


Real-World Experience: Your work won’t just sit in a folder - it will go live for thousands to see.
Mentorship: Get guidance from our CTO, Hans.
Office at Frederiksberg: An office at Frederiksberg with free coffee.
Flexible Working Hours: Night owl or early bird, we’ll make it work.
Remote Options: Work from anywhere.
Join Our Events: Every 3-4 months, we host exclusive events that bring together influencers, partners, and the trendsetters shaping the future of fashion.
Startup Vibes: Creative, dynamic, and just a little bit quirky. Everyday will be different with lots of exciting projects.


How To Apply

Think you’ve got what it takes? Send us:


Your resume.
A short message that tells us why you’re a great fit.
(Optional): Links to your portfolio, GitHub, or links to your work so we can see your brilliance in action. Whether it’s live sites, passion projects, or that quirky thing you coded at 2 a.m., we’re all ears (and eyes).


No runway experience required (but if you’ve got it, we’re intrigued).

Let’s build something incredible together 🚀

Cover: Have you ever imagined what it’s like to work at an innovative AI startup? As a Trendbook intern, you’ll dive into a dynamic environment where you’ll explore everything from crafting intuitive user interfaces to experimenting with cutting-edge machine learning technologies. Unlike many large corporate companies, here you’ll get real, hands-on experience with our platform, and the work you do will go directly into production, making a tangible impact. The most important qualities we’re looking for are a passion for learning and a knack for coming up with creative solutions to tackle our ever-evolving challenges. You’ll work closely with our CTO, Hans, gaining hands-on experience and contributing to meaningful projects that make an impact.

About Trendbook

Trendbook is an innovative AI-driven fashion app/platform that transforms fashion inspo into instant shopping. Think of us as your tech-savvy, fashion-forward best friend who turns “Ooh, I love that outfit!” into “Here’s where you can buy it - right now.” As a fast-growing startup, we’re building something exciting and need your help to make it look and feel as awesome as it sounds.

Currently, we have a selection of 1.3 million commissionable products from over 5,000 top brands - and we're just getting started!

What You’ll Do

As a Front-End Developer Intern, you will:

  • Collaborate with Our Tech Founder: Work closely with our tech-savvy co-founder and CTO, Hans - to learn the ropes, tackle real challenges, and make meaningful contributions to the development of our app and platform.
  • Craft Seamless User Experiences: Turn designs into reality by creating beautiful, intuitive interfaces for our AI-powered app and web platform.
  • Build Features That Shine: Develop and implement front-end features that make Trendbook the go-to destination for fashion lovers.
  • Test, Tweak, and Perfect: Optimize performance, fix bugs, and ensure everything runs smoothly across all devices and browsers.
  • Learn and Grow: Gain hands-on experience and insights into the world of startups, AI, and fashion-tech.
  • Contribute to a Big Vision: Your work will have a tangible impact, helping us take Trendbook from promising startup to global game-changer.

You’ll Be a Great Fit If…

You’re familiar with—or excited to dive into—any of the following technologies:

  • Flutter
  • Next.js
  • Tailwind CSS
  • TypeScript
  • Python
  • Supabase
  • Node.js
  • Figma

Whether you’re already a pro or just eager to roll up your sleeves and learn, we’re excited to have you on board!

What We Offer

  • Real-World Experience: Your work won’t just sit in a folder - it will go live for thousands to see.
  • Mentorship: Get guidance from our CTO, Hans.
  • Office at Frederiksberg: An office at Frederiksberg with free coffee.
  • Flexible Working Hours: Night owl or early bird, we’ll make it work.
  • Remote Options: Work from anywhere.
  • Join Our Events: Every 3-4 months, we host exclusive events that bring together influencers, partners, and the trendsetters shaping the future of fashion.
  • Startup Vibes: Creative, dynamic, and just a little bit quirky. Everyday will be different with lots of exciting projects.

How To Apply

Think you’ve got what it takes? Send us:

  • Your resume.
  • A short message that tells us why you’re a great fit.
  • (Optional): Links to your portfolio, GitHub, or links to your work so we can see your brilliance in action. Whether it’s live sites, passion projects, or that quirky thing you coded at 2 a.m., we’re all ears (and eyes).

No runway experience required (but if you’ve got it, we’re intrigued).

Let’s build something incredible together 🚀

Title: Full-Stack Developer (Python/JavaScript) in a fast growing start-up
Description:
Are you a full-stack web developer with solid Python experience looking for your next big challenge in a start-up? Then keep on reading and please reach out!




Supplios is a fast growing startup in Copenhagen, developing a software platform that helps global manufacturing companies work more efficiently with their suppliers and manage their supply-chain. You can read more about Supplios here www.supplios.com. We have strong and growing market traction in both North America and Europe, and we pride ourselves on being the smaller, faster, more modern alternative to large legacy players in the market. Our team is lean, we have a flat organizational structure, and an very ambitious product roadmap. This means there is a lot of opportunity for you to learn and grow with the company!




Ideal skills and experience




Python & JavaScript / TypeScript full-stack experience:

Strong understanding of Python (for backend web development) and JavaScript / TypeScript, and their related ecosystems.
Experience working with Python and/or Javascript web frameworks, with an understanding of the pros/cons and tradeoffs associated with such frameworks.
Demonstrated ability to write clean, maintainable, well-structured, and efficient code.
Django & Vue experience is a strong plus, but not required.  




Complex Enterprise application experience:

Experience working on large stateful enterprise SaaS applications, demonstrating scalability and maintainability for managing complexity.
Experience with development of multi-tenant applications, cloud-native architecture, and modern development, test, and deployment practices.
Experience with DDD, CQRS, event-driven design, finite state machines, or other architectural patterns is a plus.




Startup mindset:

A strong personal preference for working in a small team and "startup environment" where everyone wears many hats, iterates quickly, welcomes customer input (which sometimes changes), and thrives without rigid structures.
A practical mindset, knowing what is "good enough" considering limited time/people/and customer feedback.




Customer oriented:

We work very closely with many of our customers, both during new customer implementations and to gather real user input as we are developing new parts of the platform. The ideal candidate should be comfortable with customer interaction.




Why should you apply?

This is a great opportunity for someone eager to learn and grow, who may not have many years of experience, but still wants the opportunity to make an outsized impact building and shipping a complete product (quickly) to real customers. You will not just be a “cog in the machine” at Supplios.




We have a great office in Copenhagen (Pilestræde) with coffee, daily lunch at a local restaurant in a shared office with other start-ups, where our team meets everyday build Supplios. Flexible hours and remote working days are fully supported as well, as needed.

Show more

Title: Slack App Developer
Description:
Experience: 8 - 20 Years

Location: Anywhere in the World Permanent Remote

Contract Duration: 6 - 12 Months

Opportunity- Full time Contract(8hrs in total) - 5 hours (PST overlap)

Total years of exp: 8-12 years

Mandatory Skills: 3+ Yrs - SaaS and Slack, Python and AWS - 3yrs, Slack Admin, Slack Workflows, Slack Forms, Slack APPs and APIs

Job Requirements


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
Minimum of 3+ years of relevant experience with SaaS and Slack
Knowledge of digital workplace tools, specifically Slack Admin, Slack Workflows, Slack Forms, Slack APPs, and APIs
Strong grasp of Python and AWS
Expertise in configuration and integration using tools like PowerShell, JavaScript, Postman, etc.
Proficiency with web services/RESTful APIs
Strongholds in databases, including knowledge of SQL and NoSQL models


Job Responsibilities


Build and customize Slack and other collaboration workspaces
Identify the gaps between current and desired end-states of Slack and plan solutions
Improve collaboration and SaaS integrations to ensure consistent performance of the app
Support and escalate points for technical issues and resolve Slack escalation queues
Assist with delivery management processes and enforcement
Offer trainings of all Slack, custom Slack apps, workflow, and other digital workplace tools


Preferred Skills


Familiarity with networking and internet protocols, including TCP/IP, DNS, SMTP, HTTP, and distributed networks
Understanding of cloud security models and API security models
Practical knowledge of SDLC, ITIL, and Agile Frameworks
Experience working in an Agile environment
Good interpersonal and communication skills


Skills: apps,cloud security,slack apps,aws,app,powershell,slack forms,saas,apis,slack,nosql,slack admin,sql,api security,slack workflows,web services,sdlc,javascript,postman,python,restful apis,itil,agile

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Er du passioneret omkring data og machine learning? Vil du være med til at designe og implementere end-to-end data science løsninger? Har du erfaring med at træne og optimere machine learning modeller samt sætte dem i produktion? Så er du måske vores nye kollega!

Om stillingen

I Sund & Bælt søger vi en senior data scientist med solid erfaring indenfor machine learning og idriftsættelse af datadrevne løsninger heriblandt opsætning af data flows og pipelines. Du vil få mulighed for at arbejde med teknologier som NLP, generativ AI, billedgenkendelse og meget mere, samt mulighed for at være med til at præge og drive Sund & Bælts AI tiltag.

Arbejdsopgaver

En del af opgaver kan være:


Hjælpe de forskellige afdelinger med at omsætte deres problemstillinger til konkrete analyse- eller machine learning projekter.
Udvikle machine learning modeller.
Analysere og bearbejde struktureret og ustruktureret data fra mange forskellige datakilder, der spænder fra tekstdata og sensordata til geografisk data og billeddata.
Vedligeholde og gentræne modeller.
Udvikle services til udstilling af modeller og analyser via enten webapp eller API’er.
Idriftsætte færdige løsninger via Infrastructure as Code på Azure platformen.
Være med til at sætte rammerne for AI udvikling hos Sund & Bælt, samt forme og vedligeholde standarder.


Hvem er du

Vi forestiller os at du:


Er Flydende indenfor Python og har kendskab til SQL.
Har en relevant videregående uddannelse indenfor software udvikling, data science eller anden teknisk uddannelse.
Har min. 5 års relevant erhververfaring
Har bredt kendskab til supervised og unsupervised machine learning algoritmer.
Har hands-on erfaring med dataanalyse, statistik og machine learning.
Har kendskab til og erfaring med git.
Kan formidle og visualisere teknisk arbejde.
Kender til Docker eller lignende containerization teknologier.
Erfaring med at idriftsætte løsninger i cloud, gerne Azure.
Er god til og kan lide at kommunikere.
Kan arbejde selvstændigt på projekter.
Er god til at tilegne dig ny viden.
Kan lide at indgå i samarbejde med både tekniske- og forretningsorienterede kollegaer.


Din kommende arbejdsplads

Du bliver en del af afdelingen Applied Knowledge & AI i divisionen Digital. Afdelingen er nystartet, så det er vigtigt at du trives i en kontekst hvor du sammen med dine kollegaerer med til at sætte rammerne for hvordan vi arbejder med AI

Teamet består af data scientists, data engineers og forretningsudviklingsprofiler, som arbejder tæt sammen for at udvikle og implementere dataløsninger, der kan hjælpe forretningen med at optimere udviklingen, driften og vedligeholdelsen af vores infrastrukturanlæg.

Du får en arbejdsplads med god energi, god omgangstone, og fleksibel arbejdstid, da det er vigtigt for os, at privatliv og arbejdsliv fungerer godt – der er ligeledes gode muligheder for faglig og personlig udvikling.

Dit primære arbejdssted vil være i Vester Søgade i hjertet af København. Der vil være begrænset rejseaktivitet til vores kontorer i Halsskov og Rødby.

Lyder det som noget for dig?

Så vil vi meget gerne høre fra dig også hvis du ikke kan genkende dig selv i alle de ønskede faglige kvalifikationer.

Ansættelsesprocessen består af en første samtale, og for de kandidater som går videre vil der til anden samtale også være en kodetest

Skulle du have spørgsmål

omkring stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Mie Hvas på tlf. 21 80 59 52.

Send din ansøgning og cv, så vi har den senest den 12. januar 2025
Show more

Title: Development Engineer
Place: Kolding, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Development Engineer for Sensing & Control

About Us

Every day, we get opportunities to make a positive impact – on our colleagues, partners, customers and society. Together, we’re pioneering the solutions of the future and unlocking the full potential of precious resources. Trusted to act on initiative, we challenge conventional thinking to develop world-leading technologies that inspire progress in vital areas, including energy, food, water and shipping.

As we push forward, the innovative, open spirit that fuels our 140-year-old start-up culture and rapid growth also drives our personal growth. So, as we shape a more resourceful, less wasteful world, we build our careers too.

About The Job

Are you our new colleague who will further strengthen our department and take our market leading products to the next level? To support our ambitions around digitalization and connectivity, we are looking for a proactive Mechatronic Engineer to drive the continued development of our current portfolio of Sensing & Control products.

Sensing & Control is a part of the R&D department within the business unit Hygienic Fluid Handling, where we develop our strong portfolio of fluid handling products like valves, pumps, cleaning and mixing. In the Sensing & Control team we are responsible for developing and maintaining mechatronic products and we have an ambition to expand our portfolio in the future. You will have a high degree of freedom in your daily work and experienced colleagues to support you. Reporting to Global Development Manager, the main purpose of this position is to maintain and development of our current portfolio of Sensing & Control products.

Your Responsibility Is To


Keep the products competitive in the market by continuous product enhancements and upgrades based on customer feedback.
Interaction with stakeholders across the full value chain, both internally and externally.
Improving the products from idea to implementation in design and manufacturing.
Test and validation in our “state of the art” test facilities.


The position is based in Kolding, Denmark. Up to 10-20 international travel days a year must be expected.

We offer an opportunity to be part of a strong international company with high and realistic growth ambitions. You will get a chance to use your experience within electronics, mechanics, pneumatics, plastic, assembly methods and product development. Furthermore, you will be able to be hands-on with new product development, use your creativity to solve tasks as well as interact with a wide range of colleagues and suppliers across the world. We offer state of the art test facilities on site and the opportunity to have close customer interactions in terms of client visits.

Who are you?

As a person you are result oriented, have an analytical as well as a focused approach to your work and is energized by working agile. You proactively seek solutions in a professional manner and characterize yourself as cooperative and communicative.

What you know?

You have a strong technical background within the fields of electrical and mechanic engineering. You have experience with product development, your background could be Mechatronic Engineer, Mechanical Engineer, or other relevant background.

If you have experience with mechatronic, automation, pneumatic, plastic parts and assembly it will be a benefit. You know how to find and solve problems in a structured manner using tools like Lean DMAIC. You are used to cooperation with sub-suppliers when it comes to technical demands and problem solving.

Our products are used within the food/pharma industry thus knowledge about equipment for these industries would be an advantage.

Due to the scope of the position, you are fluent in Danish and English both written and verbally.

For Questions Please Contact

For further information please contact Global development Manager Keld Bak at +45 28 95 57 72.

Please send your application and CV in one single document and in English, through the link below no later than 15th of January 2025. We are conducting a continuous review of received applications. We do not accept applications via email, due to General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

We care about diversity, inclusion and equity in our recruitment processes. We also believe behavioral traits can provide important insights into a candidate's fit to a role. To help us achieve this we apply Pymetrics assessments, and upon application you will be invited to play the assessment games.

As part of our commitment to maintaining a safe and secure workplace, we conduct background checks on final candidates for this role.

To help us achieve this we apply Pymetrics assessments, and upon application you will be invited to play the assessment games.

As part of our commitment to maintaining a safe and secure workplace, we conduct background checks on final candidates for this role.

Title: Coders - AI Training [Remote]
Description:
* Swift, Python, Java, Go, Verilog, Javascript, C++, or C# coding experience required




This is a great opportunity to supplement your income while looking for longer or more full-time work, all while contributing to the development of new AI models using your domain expertise!

Our client has hired over 1,000 Braintrust talent and intends to hire hundreds more!

Many Braintrust coders earn over $12,000 per month!




You’ll have the flexibility to work as much or as little as you choose - 20hrs/week is suggested, but not a limit. Start working in as little as 48 hours. Your final hourly rate will be chosen by Outlier AI and determined by your location.




What to expect: If qualified, you’ll be invited to complete a brief questionnaire that takes 3-5 minutes. If you successfully pass the questionnaire, you’ll be approved and able to begin work ASAP.




Required qualifications:

Proficiency working one of the following languages: Swift, Python, Java, Go, Verilog, Javascript, C++, or C#

Complete fluency in the English language is required. You should be able to describe code and abstract information in a clear way.




Preferred qualifications:

Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent. Students are welcome.




Note: Outlier AI is partnering with Remotasks for this opportunity

What to expect: If qualified, you’ll be invited to complete a brief questionnaire that takes 3-5 minutes. If you successfully pass the questionnaire, you’ll be approved and able to begin work ASAP.


Required qualifications:

Proficiency working one of the following languages: Swift, Python, Java, Go, Verilog, Javascript, C++, or C#

Complete fluency in the English language is required. You should be able to describe code and abstract information in a clear way.


Preferred qualifications:

Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent. Students are welcome.


Note: Outlier AI is partnering with Remotasks for this opportunity

Title: Software Developer (Copenhagen based)
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
🥞 About ‘All Gravy’

The next generation of employees are used to apps like Instagram, TikTok and Spotify in their personal life - but when they go to work at a restaurant chain or retail store, they’re met with software created before they were born.

We are modernising the tools for frontline employees and transforming the experience into one that is engaging and motivating; making their lives easier - from getting paid to developing their careers.

We’re innovating on the whole employee journey: from being recruited, onboarded, growing skills, knowing when to work, and connecting with co-workers.

We've grown incredibly over the last year and are looking to accelerate further. We already work with some of the most exciting brands in the Nordics and the UK (Pizza Pilgrims, Honest Burgers, Ottolenghi, Q8, 7-Eleven, Best Western) and we're now expanding even more into the United Kingdom and the Netherlands.

We're backed by some of Europe’s leading investors (Moonfire, Upfin, Founders, Nordic Web Ventures) and Angels (Bradley Horowitz (GP, Wisdom Ventures), Terese Hougaard (Partner, Atomico), Phil Chambers (CEO, Peakon).

Who are we?

We are passionate, have an ambitious mission, and our users love us! ♥️

And this is just the beginning. The best is yet to come, and we hope to bring you on board to achieve this mission together. We are a fun and hard-working team that is looking for passionate professionals to join our mission. Join us to shape the future for shift & gig workers 🚀

🤩 The role: Software Developer

We are looking for a software developer who is ambitious and ready to take on a high-responsibility role in a venture-funded startup.

The ideal candidate is able to work the full stack of applications at All Gravy, but especially experienced in React js / React Native. We have chosen to have a full-fledged TypeScript-based tech stack in All Gravy which means our current developer team seamlessly switches between development tasks.

We expect the person taking on the position to be able to take on full responsibility for projects end-to-end.

😎 The Job And Responsibilities


Developing features in our React/React Native applications
Improving the GraphQL APIs serving our applications
Monitor app usage & performance, identify and solve bugs
Code reviews, architecture, continuously help improving our team & processes


All Gravy is undergoing high growth; hence the job and responsibilities will develop over time, and there will be plenty of opportunities for you to learn and grow.

Who are you?

You have great energy, a good sense of humour & have a disciplined problem solver mindset. You should enjoy working in the dynamic startup environment, like to initiate new projects - but also get them over the line.

We look for employees who like being part of a team, are real team players, and have a mindset of learning & growing.

We expect you to:


Speak and write English fluently
Have 2+ years of experience in your field
Thrive in a very fast-paced environment.
Be passionate, organized and self-driven.
Be able to work full time at our office in Copenhagen (though we operate with a hybrid model, so you are free to choose to work remotely as well)
Have a good sense of humour - be willing to contribute to this being a fun place to work
Be excited about building a big company from a small starting point, and want to grow personally on the way there
Experience in developing user-facing AI applications is a plus


The ideal candidate has experience in:


Typescript
React Native
ReactJS
GraphQL


An advantage if you have experience in:


NestJS
MongoDB
ChatGPT API


We are in the midst of building an awesome company and can't wait to onboard you - therefore we will hire the right candidate as soon as we find him/her.

💡 Even if you do not tick every box on this page, you might be the perfect fit for the job! We treasure our learning culture and encourage all humble people to apply.

💎 What We Offer

We are a motivated, young and dynamic team working closely together on our mission – at the moment we are 26 people and cannot wait to welcome the next person to the team!

We have fun together while collaborating to create a product people love and aspire to be the best place to work.

Our office is in central Copenhagen and has all the perks you’d expect from a startup - lunches, lots of social events (padel tournaments, dinners, wine-tastings, strategy offsites, you name it!), fussball table, a stocked fridge with snacks & drinks, and a regular Friday bar!
Show more

Title: Software Engineer - Observability Platform
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Join us in building an outstanding observability platform and help us continue to encourage and develop the builders of tomorrow.

We seek an innovative software engineer to join our outstanding Observability Platform (OP) team of highly skilled engineers – Brave engineers with a mission to improve developer efficiency in our digital organization, so we can reach even more kids with a digital experience – and have an upbeat experience ourselves along the path!


Core Responsibilities

We are looking for an experienced and motivated DevOps Engineer to join our new Observability Platform team. Who will be instrumental in developing and maintaining a unified observability platform that integrates technologies like Prometheus, OpenTelemetry, Grafana, the ELK stack, Zabbix, and PagerDuty.

This role will collaborate with product teams to understand their observability needs and provide solutions that improve system visibility and performance. Also, develop and maintain monitoring, logging, tracing and alerting systems to ensure the health and performance of our infrastructure and applications.





Automate observability processes to improve efficiency and reduce manual intervention.
Fix and resolve issues related to observability tools and systems.
Know the latest with industry trends and new technologies in observability and recommend improvements to our platform.
Contribute to the development of standard processes and guidelines for observability across the organization.




Play your part in our team succeeding

The position is part of the larger Developer Experience and Cloud Foundation area, providing product teams in the LEGO Group with foundational capabilities for developing, deploying, and operating IT solutions. As an engineer in OP, you will be part of a team that builds the next generation of our "Developer experience and Productivity platform".

In OP we strive to find the balance between reducing cognitive load with architecture guidelines and platforms and on the other side empowering developers to be in control of their code and architectures.

The team is based in the new LEGO® Digital Office in Copenhagen, offering an exciting, inspiring, and flexible work environment – and a little fun play as well!

Do you have what it takes?

Preferably applicants for this role have some years of experience in crafting and running observability platforms using Prometheus, OpenTelemetry, Grafana, ELK, Zabbix, PagerDuty or similar technologies. Preferred candidates hold a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or have equivalent working experience.





Proficient understanding of monitoring, logging, tracing, and alerting standard methodologies.
Good understanding of SRE (Site Reliability Engineering) standard methodologies.
Proficiency in scripting and automation (e.g., Python, Bash, or similar languages).
Understanding of platform security is a plus.
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud) and container orchestration (e.g., Kubernetes) is a plus.




Superb communication skills in written and spoken English, as well as ability to work closely and effectively in a team-oriented environment.

Please note If you require any reasonable accommodations or adjustments throughout the application process, please let us know. We will work with you to meet your needs.

Relocation support is not offered for this role.

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different underrepresented backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. If you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.


Show more

Title: Senior Python Developer - Landmark
Place: Ringkøbing-Skjern Municipality, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
We are seeking an experienced and highly skilled Senior Software Developer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have over a decade of experience in software development, with specialized knowledge in Python and Kubernetes.

This role requires a deep understanding of modern development practices, excellent problem-solving abilities, and the capability to lead and mentor junior developers.

We are looking for a person who can make a big difference and contribute to achieving our goals.

Our values are the foundation for everything we do. If you can identify with our values: Safety, Trust, Collaboration, Integrity and Respect you can be the one we are looking for.

We Offer

Great career and development opportunities

Highly skilled colleagues in a diverse environment

Company health insurance

Competitive pension- and insurance scheme

Beneficial employee stock-purchase plan

Social club with several arrangements throughout the year

Free parking and company bus arrangements

Qualifications


Design, develop, and maintain robust software solutions using Python and Kubernetes.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.
Lead and participate in architectural discussions and decisions.
Ensure code quality and maintainability through code reviews, automated testing, and best practices.
Optimize applications for performance and scalability.
Mentor and guide junior developers, fostering a collaborative and innovative team environment.
Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies, integrating them into the development process where appropriate.
Troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues.


Personal Qualifications


Deep understanding of software development life cycle (SDLC) and agile methodologies. Strong knowledge of database management systems, both SQL and NoSQL.
Problem Solving: Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to diagnose and resolve complex issues quickly and effectively.
Collaboration and Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work well in a team environment and collaborate with various stakeholders.
Strong mentoring and leadership abilities, with experience guiding junior team members.


Language

The candidate should have good communication and collaboration skills.

Location:

Wergelandsveien 1, 0167 OSLO, Norway

Product Service Line

Landmark

Full time

Contact Persons

Hiring Manager: Owen Fraser-Green (+47) 930 56 135 email: owen.frasergreen@halliburton.com

Recruiter: Synnøve Gysland Sunde (+47) 51 83 72 30

Deadline

10th January 2025

Title: Software Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Software Engineer og Azure udvikler




Har du evnen og interessen for at prøve kræfter med udvikling af komplekse Azure cloud-løsninger? cVation søger erfarne software udviklere til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og udviklerglæde er i højsæde.




cVation er et dansk udviklings- og konsulenthus, som bygger avancerede cloud-løsninger på Azure med afsæt i markedets hurtigste og mest agile metoder. cVation blev stiftet i 2014, har modtaget tre Børsen Gazeller og vundet Microsofts Partner Award for App Innovation tre år i træk. Vi arbejder dedikeret med agile arbejdsmetoder, DevOps og Test Driven Development, og er på forkant med mange af de nye teknologier, herunder IoT. Vi sætter desuden en ære i at levere software af den højeste kvalitet.

Hvilken rolle får du?




Du vil blive en del af et team, der designer og udvikler avancerede cloud-løsninger på MS Azure. Din rolle bliver bl.a. at rådgive om valg af Azure services, implementere og vedligeholde værktøjer, der sikrer continuous integration og continuous delivery og understøtter applikationsudviklingen. Vi har en meget høj release-frekvens i vores projekter, da brugen af vores egenudviklede tool CADD resulterer i ekstremt agile IT-projekter.




Udviklerne i cVation er samlet i teams på 5-8 udviklere. Du vil have fuldt fokus på et projekt/team af gangen. Ud over de hyppige releases til produktion har vi en ekstrem høj grad af automatisering af alt fra unit tests til integrationstests og UI-tests. Det betyder, at de repetitive processer er fjernet, så der er luft til at tænke innovativt, hvilket kommer vores kunder til gode. Kort sagt får de hurtigere udviklede løsninger af højere kvalitet og med en større forretningsmæssig værdi – og du får mulighed for faglig fordybelse og udvikle dig indenfor de nyeste teknologier.




Vi har også etableret et CCoE (Cloud Center of Excellence), som løbende vurderer nye cloud services og opdaterer værktøjskassen med relevante opdateringer. CCoE arbejder tæt sammen med de enkelte udviklingsteams, som har fingeren på pulsen ude på kundeprojekterne.

Hvad forventer vi af dig?




Erfaring med cloud udvikling og særligt PaaS services fra MS Azure, vil være en klar fordel.

Kandidat i softwareudvikling
Du er erfaren i C#, og at du går op i kodekvalitet og at skrive testbar kode
Du vil gerne arbejde med de nyeste teknologier i Azure med hovedfokus på PaaS
Du har erfaring med at arbejde med automatisering af byg og test af applikationer
Du har erfaring med softwareudvikling og gerne webudvikling
Du vil gerne indgå i et agilt setup, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan ændres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i højsædet
Du har arbejdet med automatisering af test, build og release pipelines samt Infrastructure as code
Du er vant til at arbejde med versionskontrol, gerne Git
Du taler/skriver flydende dansk, og taler/skriver engelsk på et medium/højt niveau.

Som person er du ansvarsbevidst, initiativrig, eksekverende og resultatorienteret. Du gør dig umage med dine opgaver og trives med at løfte i flok som del af et team. Hvis du også er engageret, nysgerrig, drevet af at lære nyt og sætter en ære i at dygtiggøre dig passer du perfekt ind hos os. Du må også gerne gå op i at forbedre både kode, værktøjer samt processer.

Hvad tilbyder vi?




Du kommer til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og arbejdsglæde er i højsæde. Det høje faglige niveau blandt dine kollegaer giver en unik mulighed for at arbejde med de bedste, og vi tager din faglige udvikling alvorligt. Vi har en flad organisation med et minimum af administration, hvor ledelsens døre altid er åbne, og der er god plads til både bordfodbold, fredagsbar, frokost på kajen og et aktivt liv udenfor arbejdstid. Flere gange om året afholder vi hackathons, hvor vi i teams dykker ned i præcis de emner, som udviklerne finder interessante. En del af vores kultur er også, at vi gerne ser alle komme med input til hvordan vi kan optimere, forbedre og udvikle cVation.

Hvorfor vælge os som din nye arbejdsplads?




Vores fundament er løsninger bygget på Microsoft Azure Cloud. Alle vores medarbejdere mestrer cloud-native udvikling og DevOps. Vi arbejder i projekter og engagerer os hands-on i fælles teams med vores kunder for at sikre kvalitet og effektiv videndeling.




Vi er passionerede omkring at hjælpe vores kunder med at få det maksimale ud af cloudteknologien. For os er cloud ikke blot infrastruktur eller et nyt datacenter i skyen. Teknologien giver virksomheder mulighed for at skabe væsentligt mere værdi og arbejde med agilitet og innovation på en helt ny måde.




Vi har været med fra starten, da cloud blev udviklet og tilgængeligt. Vi tilbyder således vores årelange erfaring og dybe cloud ekspertise samt en værktøjskasse med alle vores best practices i form af accelerationsplatformen CADD. Den dækker over gennemprøvede værktøjer, rammeværk, effektive udviklingsmetoder og færdige automatiseringskomponenter. Alt dette for at sikre, at projekter kommer hurtigt og sikkert fra start.




Du vil få kollegaer, der er interesseret i at lære og har ønske om at blive de bedste til det, de gør. Vi tilbyder derfor gode muligheder for at udvikle dig. Du vil blive en del af en virksomhed, som tror på, at alle har betydning, og at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde hver dag.

Interesseret?




Klik på Easy Apply knappen, hvis du vil arbejde med de nyeste teknologier. Vi behandler din ansøgning fortroligt og arrangerer løbende interviews.




Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, eller vil du høre mere om cVation, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte:




Maiken Pelby, Head of People & Culture, T/ 42612828, map@cvation.com




Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

Show more
HTML:
Software Engineer og Azure udvikler


Har du evnen og interessen for at prøve kræfter med udvikling af komplekse Azure cloud-løsninger? cVation søger erfarne software udviklere til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og udviklerglæde er i højsæde.


cVation er et dansk udviklings- og konsulenthus, som bygger avancerede cloud-løsninger på Azure med afsæt i markedets hurtigste og mest agile metoder. cVation blev stiftet i 2014, har modtaget tre Børsen Gazeller og vundet Microsofts Partner Award for App Innovation tre år i træk. Vi arbejder dedikeret med agile arbejdsmetoder, DevOps og Test Driven Development, og er på forkant med mange af de nye teknologier, herunder IoT. Vi sætter desuden en ære i at levere software af den højeste kvalitet.

Hvilken rolle får du?


Du vil blive en del af et team, der designer og udvikler avancerede cloud-løsninger på MS Azure. Din rolle bliver bl.a. at rådgive om valg af Azure services, implementere og vedligeholde værktøjer, der sikrer continuous integration og continuous delivery og understøtter applikationsudviklingen. Vi har en meget høj release-frekvens i vores projekter, da brugen af vores egenudviklede tool CADD resulterer i ekstremt agile IT-projekter.


Udviklerne i cVation er samlet i teams på 5-8 udviklere. Du vil have fuldt fokus på et projekt/team af gangen. Ud over de hyppige releases til produktion har vi en ekstrem høj grad af automatisering af alt fra unit tests til integrationstests og UI-tests. Det betyder, at de repetitive processer er fjernet, så der er luft til at tænke innovativt, hvilket kommer vores kunder til gode. Kort sagt får de hurtigere udviklede løsninger af højere kvalitet og med en større forretningsmæssig værdi – og du får mulighed for faglig fordybelse og udvikle dig indenfor de nyeste teknologier.


Vi har også etableret et CCoE (Cloud Center of Excellence), som løbende vurderer nye cloud services og opdaterer værktøjskassen med relevante opdateringer. CCoE arbejder tæt sammen med de enkelte udviklingsteams, som har fingeren på pulsen ude på kundeprojekterne.

Hvad forventer vi af dig?


Erfaring med cloud udvikling og særligt PaaS services fra MS Azure, vil være en klar fordel.

  • Kandidat i softwareudvikling
  • Du er erfaren i C#, og at du går op i kodekvalitet og at skrive testbar kode
  • Du vil gerne arbejde med de nyeste teknologier i Azure med hovedfokus på PaaS
  • Du har erfaring med at arbejde med automatisering af byg og test af applikationer
  • Du har erfaring med softwareudvikling og gerne webudvikling
  • Du vil gerne indgå i et agilt setup, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan ændres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i højsædet
  • Du har arbejdet med automatisering af test, build og release pipelines samt Infrastructure as code
  • Du er vant til at arbejde med versionskontrol, gerne Git
  • Du taler/skriver flydende dansk, og taler/skriver engelsk på et medium/højt niveau.

Som person er du ansvarsbevidst, initiativrig, eksekverende og resultatorienteret. Du gør dig umage med dine opgaver og trives med at løfte i flok som del af et team. Hvis du også er engageret, nysgerrig, drevet af at lære nyt og sætter en ære i at dygtiggøre dig passer du perfekt ind hos os. Du må også gerne gå op i at forbedre både kode, værktøjer samt processer.

Hvad tilbyder vi?


Du kommer til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og arbejdsglæde er i højsæde. Det høje faglige niveau blandt dine kollegaer giver en unik mulighed for at arbejde med de bedste, og vi tager din faglige udvikling alvorligt. Vi har en flad organisation med et minimum af administration, hvor ledelsens døre altid er åbne, og der er god plads til både bordfodbold, fredagsbar, frokost på kajen og et aktivt liv udenfor arbejdstid. Flere gange om året afholder vi hackathons, hvor vi i teams dykker ned i præcis de emner, som udviklerne finder interessante. En del af vores kultur er også, at vi gerne ser alle komme med input til hvordan vi kan optimere, forbedre og udvikle cVation.

Hvorfor vælge os som din nye arbejdsplads?


Vores fundament er løsninger bygget på Microsoft Azure Cloud. Alle vores medarbejdere mestrer cloud-native udvikling og DevOps. Vi arbejder i projekter og engagerer os hands-on i fælles teams med vores kunder for at sikre kvalitet og effektiv videndeling.


Vi er passionerede omkring at hjælpe vores kunder med at få det maksimale ud af cloudteknologien. For os er cloud ikke blot infrastruktur eller et nyt datacenter i skyen. Teknologien giver virksomheder mulighed for at skabe væsentligt mere værdi og arbejde med agilitet og innovation på en helt ny måde.


Vi har været med fra starten, da cloud blev udviklet og tilgængeligt. Vi tilbyder således vores årelange erfaring og dybe cloud ekspertise samt en værktøjskasse med alle vores best practices i form af accelerationsplatformen CADD. Den dækker over gennemprøvede værktøjer, rammeværk, effektive udviklingsmetoder og færdige automatiseringskomponenter. Alt dette for at sikre, at projekter kommer hurtigt og sikkert fra start.


Du vil få kollegaer, der er interesseret i at lære og har ønske om at blive de bedste til det, de gør. Vi tilbyder derfor gode muligheder for at udvikle dig. Du vil blive en del af en virksomhed, som tror på, at alle har betydning, og at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde hver dag.

Interesseret?


Klik på Easy Apply knappen, hvis du vil arbejde med de nyeste teknologier. Vi behandler din ansøgning fortroligt og arrangerer løbende interviews.


Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, eller vil du høre mere om cVation, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte:


Maiken Pelby, Head of People & Culture, T/ 42612828, map@cvation.com


Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

Title: R/D Assistant
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Us

REDUCED is committed to producing high-quality, upcycled savory taste solutions, and is looking for a dedicated Intern to carry out and support fermentation trials and execute chemical and sensory analysis. The focus of the role will be to carry out different fermentation trials and perform chemical and microbiological analysis of the products obtained from these trials. Moreover, you will also help to execute sensory analysis and analyse data deriving from them.

Position Overview

You’ll be pivotal in executing and organizing fermentation trials in a BSL-2 microbiological laboratory, and microbiological and chemical analysis (HPLC and GC-MS). You will also need to design and execute sensory evaluation tests of new and existing products. The role requires that you have in-depth microbiological knowledge, knowledge of good microbiological practices, and experience in sample preparation and/or derivatization for HPLC analysis of amino acids, nucleotides, organic acids and sugars. You also need to be experienced in GC-MS sample preparation and data analysis. Knowledge in sensory methods is an advantage.

Key Responsibilities


Plan, design, and execute fermentation trials. You need to be able to carry out these tasks autonomously making sure to have a correct set-up and correct controls. You need to be organised, plan well and in advance. You need to work neatly and be tidy, and avoid any contamination.
Design, plan, and execute sensory evaluation test of food products. You will need to perform preliminary tastings and design consumer and sensory trials, preparing smaples, collecting data and analyzing the results.
Carry out chemicals and microbiological analysis. You need to prepare samples for HPLC and GC-MS analysis. This can involve sample preparation such as correct dilution, filtration, manual derivatisation, preparation of mobile phases and chemicals needed for these analysis. You need to be able to prepare microbiological media, and work in a BSL-2 lab


Who We’re Looking For

You are structured with a sharp eye for detail, you are analytical, and operate in an organised manner. You ensure your safety and safety of the samples you produce. You work tidly, keep good track of the protocols, samples, and data deriving from various trials and analysis you execute. You are a fast learner and enjoy working in the lab.

The Ideal Candidate Has The Following Qualifications


Minimum a Bachelor’s degree in Food Science, Microbiology, Sensory Science, or related discipline.
Strong knowledge of food microbiology.
Experience with sensory methods (flash profiling, descriptive analysis, consumer studies).
Experience with HPLC and GC-MS analysis and data analysis.
Knowledge of statistical analysis (e.g., Excel, Rstudio, MatLab, Pyton).
Fluent in English.


Personal Attributes


Strong drive and adaptability suited for a dynamic R&D workplace.
Enjoys practical work as well as data analysis.
Good at planning and working in a structured manner.
Independent and proactive attitude.
Excited to learn new things.


Reports To: Fermentation Scientist and Flavour Scientist

Apply Now!

If you’re ready to take on this challenge at REDUCED and work in a cool and dynamic setting, we’d love to hear from you!
Show more

Title: Solutions Engineer - North Europe
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Company Description

About CyberArk:

CyberArk (NASDAQ: CYBR), is the global leader in Identity Security. Centered on privileged access management, CyberArk provides the most comprehensive security offering for any identity – human or machine – across business applications, distributed workforces, hybrid cloud workloads and throughout the DevOps lifecycle. The world’s leading organizations trust CyberArk to help secure their most critical assets. To learn more about CyberArk, visit our CyberArk blogs or follow us on Twitter, LinkedIn or Facebook.

Job Description

CyberArk, is looking for a Solutions Engineer for Presales, covering the North Europe

In this role, you will combine technical knowledge with sales skills and are ultimately responsible for the technical win during the sales cycle. You are responsible for actively driving and managing the technology evaluation stage of the sales process which will require you to work with multiple stakeholders. You will match the customers/prospects business requirements to how the CyberArk Identity Security Platform can assist from a technical perspective. Therefore, you must be able to articulate technology and product positioning to both business and technical users. You must be able to identify all technical issues to assure complete customer satisfaction through all stages of the sales process.

Above all, we are looking for someone that can communicate the CyberArk value and be able to design an optimal solution for complex customer infrastructure and datacenter environments on a global scale.

To be successful, you must be comfortable in a dynamic atmosphere of a technical organization with a rapidly expanding customer base, possess strong communication and interpersonal skills as you will be required to build relationships across multiple levels of the organizations. Being organized, analytical & having the ability to eliminate sales obstacles through creative and adaptive approaches is also essential.

Responsibilities:



Provide technical pre-sales hands-on support.
Collaborate with Account Executives throughout the entire sales process.
Effectively present CyberArk’s technical value proposition to customers and partners.
Ensure the success of customer proof-of-concepts (POCs).
Respond to the functional and technical aspects of RFIs/RFPs.
Proactively seek new sales opportunities by developing technical relationships with prospective accounts.
Document client feature requests and issues in CyberArk internal systems.
Support CyberArk seminars and industry trade shows in the region.
Communicate customer requirements to Product Management teams.
Develop technical knowledge and skills of CyberArk solutions and related technologies.
Travel within the region (25%-50%). 



Qualifications



3+ years of experience as a Solutions Engineer and/or Professional Services Engineer, or equivalent experience.
High-level understanding of security concepts and the development of security roles within organizations that meet functional, technical, and regulatory requirements.
Strong hands-on technical abilities.
Hands-on experience with Windows Administration, Active Directory and Linux operating systems.
Knowledge in the leading cloud service providers: AWS, Azure, and GCP.
Understand complex customer environments and design optimal architectural solutions for them.
Fluent Danish and English language skills essential
What could set you apart as a top candidate:
Prior experience with CyberArk Identity Security solutions.
Experience in Privilege Access Management (PAM), Identity and Access Management (IAM), or Identity Management (IDM) solutions.
Knowledge and understanding of containerized environments and CI/CD toolchains.

Title: Software Test Engineer - start your career here
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Software Test Engineer – start your career here
Would you like to play a role in testing high-quality software that help improve the daily lives of our customers within the defence sector? Here is your opportunity to become part of an international work environment filled with talented colleagues!

The position
Being our new colleague, you will help ensuring the continuous high level of test and quality assurance throughout our entire feature development process, emphasizing early test involvement. In addition to that, you will make a difference by…

Being a vital part of the development process by asking all the critical questions, understanding the assignment, ensuring close cooperation with all stakeholders like developers, product owners, designers, and project managers.
Creating and executing tests, ensure new features have a testable design, create test documentation, ensure verification of training content and software installations.
Ensuring the quality assurance and quality control processes and standards are followed in the most efficient way to create qualitative software.
Participating in all test activities like System Test, Bug Hunt and Field test etc.



If you are not sure what all of the above is yet, experienced colleagues will ensure to teach you and support you on your path to specialise in software testing.

A new team in Copenhagen
Located in our brand-new office space in the city center of Copenhagen, a short walk from the metro at Marmorkirken, you will become a part of a larger group of 50 Engineers, Architects and Testers - all working to ensure that our AI platform is the best of its kind in relation to data collection- and management.

You will become a part of our on-the-way-to-be established Insights team in Copenhagen. Our aim is to establish a scrum team of around eight skilled colleagues – where you will be one. Besides the Insight development team, you will become a part of the overall Test Team in our Defence business unit, which consists of 46 Testers, Test Managers, Test Interns and student workers across multiple locations.

SitaWare Insight is a modern microservice-based solution made up of primarily Angular and Java Spring Boot services. A variety of cloud-native components are used for supporting the environment, as it must be deployable to on-prem, private and public clouds.

Your Qualifications
Looking for a new colleague, we are hoping to find someone who holds a Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or something similar. Furthermore, we are looking for someone who knows about or have tried hands with software testing, maybe through their studies or with a few years of experience in a similar role. If you have a background within Defence, that would be an advantage but it is not a requirement.

At SitaWare Insight, you can expect to work with the following technologies and tools, so experience herein is beneficial:


Machine Learning / AI
Linux CLI
Docker and Kubernetes
Cypress
JIRA, Xray and R4J



In this role, you might experience a small amount of travel. Expect a maximum of 5-10 days a year.

Please note that you must be able to present a clean criminal record and have lived in a NATO and/or an EU country for the past seven years as we work with security-classified projects. Read more here.

Never stop developing
Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish and uniquely people-centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. It is not just a place to work but a place to belong.

You can look forward to joining our Employees Club offering almost 100 events of both social and professional character a year – plenty to choose from. Our colleagues also highlight our canteen, which serves a variety of delicious and healthy dishes each day. In addition, we offer several employee benefits such as paid Home Internet, health insurance and a company pension scheme. Finally, we are always up for a friendly game of padel at our new padel court in Aarhus!

Start your development here
We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis as we wish to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so click Apply Now and send us your CV today. If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Rebecca Johannsen, Senior Test Project Manager.

Get in touch

Julie Lysbjerg Christensen

Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant


Show more
