Title: Software Engineer (with a passion for data)
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
APPLY HERE: Software Engineer (with a passion for data)




Job Description




Are you a software engineer with a passion for data? or, a data engineer with an interest in creating software solutions?




Either way, this role is what you've been waiting for if you're passionate about data and software!

The partner area develops innovative IT solutions to help our partners optimize their selling processes, achieve seamless content integrations, and effectively capture sales data.




Responsibilities

Work closely with product managers, designers, data specialists, and fellow engineers to:
Gather and interpret requirements
Transform requirements into effective technical solutions
Adopt DevOps principles
Design, code, deploy, and maintain backend services and data pipelines
Prioritize the success of the group with a strong team-first mentality
Actively support colleagues in achieving shared goals




Requirements

Demonstrated expertise in foundational programming concepts is essential.
Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts, cloud technologies, data modelling, data governance.
Relevant experience using SQL, dbt, Python, Spark, Databricks, AWS stack or any other cloud technologies or similar tech stack.
Ability to take end-to-end responsibility of designing and developing data products starting from requirement scoping to delivery having a keen eye for automation.
Experience in building efficient data pipelines, ability to navigate through complex scripts and work on performance tuning.
Experience with agile ways of working
Focused on quality at all stages of the software lifecycle
Ability to troubleshoot, research, and work through complex problems
Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.




What’s in it for you?




Here is what you can expect:




Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different underrepresented backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. If you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.




Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.




We are proud supporters of Women in Data®. Connect, engage and belong to the largest free female data community in the UK – visit: www.womenindata.co.uk to join our community.

“Stay connected! Follow us on LinkedIn for updates on career opportunities and more.”

Show more
HTML:
APPLY HERE: Software Engineer (with a passion for data)


Job Description


Are you a software engineer with a passion for data? or, a data engineer with an interest in creating software solutions?


Either way, this role is what you've been waiting for if you're passionate about data and software!

The partner area develops innovative IT solutions to help our partners optimize their selling processes, achieve seamless content integrations, and effectively capture sales data.


Responsibilities

  • Work closely with product managers, designers, data specialists, and fellow engineers to:
  • Gather and interpret requirements
  • Transform requirements into effective technical solutions
  • Adopt DevOps principles
  • Design, code, deploy, and maintain backend services and data pipelines
  • Prioritize the success of the group with a strong team-first mentality
  • Actively support colleagues in achieving shared goals


Requirements

  • Demonstrated expertise in foundational programming concepts is essential.
  • Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts, cloud technologies, data modelling, data governance.
  • Relevant experience using SQL, dbt, Python, Spark, Databricks, AWS stack or any other cloud technologies or similar tech stack.
  • Ability to take end-to-end responsibility of designing and developing data products starting from requirement scoping to delivery having a keen eye for automation.
  • Experience in building efficient data pipelines, ability to navigate through complex scripts and work on performance tuning.
  • Experience with agile ways of working
  • Focused on quality at all stages of the software lifecycle
  • Ability to troubleshoot, research, and work through complex problems
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.


What’s in it for you?


Here is what you can expect:


Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different underrepresented backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. If you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.


Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.


We are proud supporters of Women in Data®. Connect, engage and belong to the largest free female data community in the UK – visit: www.womenindata.co.uk to join our community.

“Stay connected! Follow us on LinkedIn for updates on career opportunities and more.”

Title: Software Developer
Place: Odense, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Front-end Software Developer for robotic applications

Are you passionate about front-end software development and looking to exploit your skills in a meaningful position? Do you want to help make robots more accessible and easier to use? We invite you to become a part of an agile company at the forefront of developing new innovative robotic software.




Smooth Robotics is looking for a software developer who can help create excellent robotic welding applications.

At Smooth Robotics we aim to build a bridge between the complicated world of robot programming and welders. We aim to turn robots into simple tools accessible for everyone by focusing on simplicity, user experience and intuitive design.




We offer

An exciting position where you will become an essential part of our agile development team, whose members share knowledge, feedback and thereby grow together.

At Smooth Robotics, we have a short decision-making process, which enhances the company’s agility and responsiveness to the market. To accommodate this, we offer our developers varying tasks which makes work exciting.

Most of the features we develop are requested by customers, which makes software development more meaningful. The usage of the software is visible, and the results are tangible.




Key responsibilities

In the role as Front-end Software Developer at Smooth Robotics, you will be responsible for:

·       Develop and implement user-friendly interfaces for our robotic welding software.

·       In collaboration with team members specialized in back-end development, define and implement APIs to bridge the front-end and back-end.

·       Contribute to the conceptual development of solutions for new features.

·       Optimize application performance and responsiveness.




Your competences and profile

The ideal candidate is an enthusiastic software developer who enjoys creating well-crafted user interfaces, primarily as web applications using Angular or similar JavaScript framework. You are also familiar with one or more CSS Frameworks like Tailwind and most importantly, you are open to learning and growing your skill set.




Moreover, you may be familiar with one or more of these fields:

·       UI/UX design tools like Figma or similar

·       Front-end development in Java using framework

·       Operating robots

·       Welding processes




About us

Smooth Robotics is a scale-up company based on the idea that robots can be much easier to handle for the end-users that need flexibility. Today the changeover of a robot requires a specialist – especially if precision is required. We work with welding applications and have a product that is being sold globally.

Title: Application Engineer
Place: Nordborg, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description
Are you ready to take your engineering skills to the next level and work on innovative solutions that shape the future of energy efficiency? Are you looking for a role that offers technical challenges, hands-on innovation, and real-world impact? This is the perfect opportunity for you!

As an Application Engineer at Danfoss Climate Solutions in our Application Development Center (ADC), you will work with cutting-edge technologies, focusing on areas such as heat pumps, chillers, controllers, and CO₂ supermarket simulations.

You will join a team of six skilled colleagues in Nordborg and take on real-world challenges. As part of your role, you will also work in our Smart Store - a fully operational supermarket integrated into the energy grid. This unique facility allows you to test and refine solutions in a live environment, with the opportunity to engage with a wide range of customers and guests who come to experience the innovations firsthand.

By collaborating with OEM customers and internal R&D teams, you will gain valuable insights into global collaboration and deepen your technical expertise, all while helping us deliver on our commitment to decarbonize with our customers and contribute to a greener future.

Job Responsibilities
As our new Application Engineer, you will combine simulation and hands-on testing to develop and optimize refrigeration applications.

In This Role You Can Look Forward To

Collaborate with R&D, Engineering, and Sales teams to create and refine testing methods for refrigeration applications.
Conduct application tests on units and prototypes, ensuring compliance with international standards.
Analyze, diagnose, and adjust systems to support both R&D and Sales initiatives, driving continuous improvement.
Manage test schedules and maintain thorough documentation while
Ensuring clear communication with project teams to align objectives and performance.


Background & Skills
If you are ready to excel in this role, your background likely includes a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree with expertise in air conditioning and refrigeration systems.

You bring hands-on experience in CO₂ applications and simulation for test setups and prototype units, and your solid English communication skills—both written and verbal—enable you to work effectively in an international environment.

You will feel confident in this position if you are familiar with:


Testing processes and methodologies
Simulation and calculation of refrigerant systems
Advanced measurement techniques, metrology, and data acquisition
Certification standards for heat pumps and chillers
Data processing and analysis


Personally, you thrive in a team-oriented environment with your positive and open mindset. Your structured and disciplined approach ensures you consistently deliver results, while your networking and communication skills help you navigate cross-cultural collaboration with ease.

Apply now and join Danfoss where we are engineering solutions that allow the world to use resources in smarter ways – driving the sustainable transformation of tomorrow.

For further information about the position , please contact our ADC team Manager, Nordborg, Thorsten Stöben, +45 5171 8579. For information about recruitment process, please contact Recruiter, Karin K P Jensen, +45 7488 3058.

Please apply at your earliest convenience. We do not have an application deadline but accept applications as long as the job is posted.

Employee Benefits
We are excited to offer you the following benefits with your employment:


Bonus system
Paid vacation
Flexible working hours
Possibility to work remotely
Pension plan
Personal insurance
Communication package
Opportunity to join Employee Resource Groups
State of the art virtual work environment


This list does not promise or guarantee any particular benefit or specific action. They may depend on country or contract specifics and are subject to change at any time without prior notice.

Danfoss – Engineering Tomorrow
At Danfoss, we are engineering solutions that allow the world to use resources in smarter ways - driving the sustainable transformation of tomorrow. No transformation has ever been started without a group of passionate, dedicated and empowered people. We believe that innovation and great results are driven by the right mix of people with diverse backgrounds, personalities, skills, and perspectives, reflecting the world in which we do business. To make sure the mix of people works, we strive to create an inclusive work environment where people of all backgrounds are treated equally, respected, and valued for who they are. It is a strong priority within Danfoss to improve the health, working environment and safety of our employees.

Following our founder’s mindset “action speaks louder than words”, we set ourselves ambitious targets to protect the environment by embarking on a plan to become CO2 neutral latest by 2030.

Danfoss is an EO employer and VEVRAA Federal Contractor. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or other protected category.

Title: Senior Data Scientist for Performance Management and Analytics
Description:
As a Data Scientist, you will enhance predictive analytics, build automation and drive impactful improvements across the organisation.

Data Scientist specialising in process performance
As a Data Scientist specialising in process performance, you will enhance and automate predictive performance models. You will unlock new potential through AI and machine learning to predict outcomes while ensuring the consistent use of standardised data, methods and measures across the organisation. Additionally, you will support and validate critical KPIs.

Systematic is rated at CMMI Maturity Level 5, a distinction held by only a few companies worldwide. Your work will help maintain this high maturity level through clear and impactful process performance reporting combined with effective measurement of our improvement initiatives.

This is a newly established role, created as part of our ambition to elevate our performance management capability to the next level!

In this role, you will collaborate with teams across the organisation to turn data into actionable insights, ensuring that our processes are optimised and consistent and aligned with business goals. Your key responsibilities include:


Developing and validating process-performance models:
Gathering and validating data to build reliable models that reflect business needs.
Automating and improving reporting:
Enhancing quarterly process-performance baseline reporting and contributing to the Wall of Fame initiative.
Supporting master data quality.
Analysing data to provide the insights needed for precise and quantitative decisions.
Automating and improving prediction through the use of statistical techniques, machine learning and/or AI.
Participating in CMMI Appraisals.



The team
You will be part of a small, dedicated team of highly skilled specialists. Organised within the Finance department, the team collaborates closely with our internal Business Intelligence team and our Business Process Management team. Most importantly, it works across the organisation to support our programme managers in achieving process performance objectives. The team’s mission is to ensure, maintain and enhance a high level of maturity throughout Systematic.

Driven by automation and predictive analysis
We are looking for an experienced and driven candidate with a relevant bachelor’s or master’s degree who is passionate about automation and predictive analysis.

You thrive on working with data, statistics and numbers, and your structured approach ensures high-quality results.
At the same time, you have the curiosity and creativity to think outside the box and find innovative solutions.
We expect you to have several years of experience with R, VBA, robotics or similar, and the ability to leverage these technologies to drive automations.
You are proactive, motivated to push things forward and you enjoy working at the intersection of data, technology and business optimisation.



Please note that you must be able to present a clean criminal record and have lived in a NATO/EU country for the past seven years as we work with security-classified projects. Read more here.

Never stop developing
Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish and uniquely people centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. Systematic is not just a place to work but a place to belong.

You can look forward to joining our Employees Club, which organises almost 100 social/professional events a year – plenty to choose from. Our colleagues also highlight our canteen, which serves a variety of delicious and healthy dishes each day. Finally, we are always up for a friendly game of padel at our padel court in Aarhus!

Start your development here
We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis as we wish to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so click Apply Now and send us your CV today. If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Bettina Damm, Senior Specialist.

Get in touch

Sofie Heiner Emborg

Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant

Title: Software Engineer to ALTEN Denmark
Description:
Are you a talented Software Engineer seeking your next opportunity? Join our Engineering team in Denmark, where exciting challenges await!




Your role as Software Engineer:

As a Software Engineer at ALTEN, you will play a key role in strengthening the section for integration of software and hardware. You will be a part of a talented team where you develop state of the art technology together with electronics engineers, firmware and software developers.




Who are you?

To be a good match for the role we we believe that you have a great experience in C++, it could be both close to the hardware or object oriented. Experience in C is also of interest. You are a driven and engaged colleague with a problem-solving mind and a team player. We also see that you have a B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Mechanical Engineering, Electronic Engineering, or other equivalent education and at least 5+ years of experience within a relevant area.




We also think our new colleague have experience from:

Python or Java
SQL
Machine learning (TensorFloe, Scikit-learn)
Cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google cloud)




It is meritorious if you also have:

experience of UX design
experience working with control algorithms
experience of version control systems




Location: Aarhus, Denmark.




Please note: Due to holidays, there will be no selection until 09.01.25. Merry Christmas and Happy New Year!




As part of our team, you can expect the following:

Full-time employment at ALTEN Denmark

Opportunities for international mobility

Access to internal education, certifications, and professional development programs offered by ALTEN Academy

Diverse range of assignments with different clients and industries

Career coaching and guidance with the support of our dedicated Business Managers




About ALTEN:

ALTEN is a leading provider of outsourced Engineering and Technology Services, operating in over 35 countries with a workforce of more than 57,000 employees. In Denmark, ALTEN has been on a successful growth trajectory since 2019, delivering innovative solutions within Engineering and Life Science. Our team of skilled engineers undertakes complex and technically demanding projects across various industries, collaborating with renowned companies throughout the value chain and are presented in various locations in Denmark!

Title: Data Scientist Specialist - Be a key player for the success of our cutting-edge product SitaWare
Description:
Data Scientist Specialist – Be a key player for the success of our cutting-edge product SitaWare Insight

Unlock the power of data and shape the future of defence decision support with SitaWare Insight! As a Data Scientist, you will be at the forefront of developing cutting-edge machine learning models, ensuring seamless integration with our advanced decision support tool. Join us and become part of a dynamic team that simplifies critical decision-making for commanders worldwide.

A data professional
Join the SitaWare Insight team in Denmark, a forward-thinking product organisation dedicated to driving innovation in defence technology. With a high focus on simplifying decision-making processes, the team comprises a cohesive group of skilled professionals, including a Project Manager, Product Manager, Architect, Developers and a System Tester. Collaborate in an environment committed to growth, improvement and maintaining excellence in our product – a responsibility that is pivotal to meeting the increasing demand from our global customers.

Drive data excellence
Shape the future of defence decision support in this hands-on Data Scientist role. Work on a broad spectrum of tasks, including data analyses, model development, collaboration with MLOps, deployment and performance monitoring in production. As a key player in advancing SitaWare Insight, you will contribute to new releases every half-year, introducing novel capabilities, bug fixes and overall product enhancements.

In short, you can look forward to:


Developing high-quality machine learning models to enhance decision support
Collaborating with MLOps for the seamless integration of models
Monitoring model performance in a dynamic production environment
Contributing to the growth, improvement and maintenance of SitaWare Insight



Proficient data expert
You are passionate about transforming data into actionable insights, and bring the following to the role:


Proven experience as a Data Scientist
Minimum of a Master’s or PhD in a relevant field (e.g. computer science, data science, cognitive science and statistics)
Demonstrated expertise in developing and implementing machine learning models
Strong programming skills in Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch
Proficiency in data preprocessing and feature engineering
Database knowledge for effective data management
Computer science skills supporting the overall development of the data science service like Docker and CI/CD pipelines
Solid understanding of model evaluation, documentation, visualisation of data-driven solutions and development best-practices
Appreciate teamwork and sparring with colleagues
Great communication skills
Proficient in English



Please note that you must be able to present a clean criminal record and have lived in a NATO/EU country for the past seven years as we work with security-classified projects. Read more here.

Never stop developing
Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish and uniquely people-centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. It is not just a place to work but a place to belong. You can look forward to joining our Employees Club offering almost 100 social/professional events a year – plenty to choose from. Our colleagues also highlight our canteen, which serves a variety of delicious and healthy dishes each day. In addition, we offer several employee benefits such as paid Home Internet, health insurance and a company pension scheme. Finally, we are always up for a friendly game of padel at our new padel court in Aarhus!

Start your development here
We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis as we wish to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so click Apply Now and send us your CV today. If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Preben Schmidt Nielsen, Senior Project Manager.

Get in touch

Mette Mørch Rasmussen

Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant

Unlock the power of data and shape the future of defence decision support with SitaWare Insight! As a Data Scientist, you will be at the forefront of developing cutting-edge machine learning models, ensuring seamless integration with our advanced decision support tool. Join us and become part of a dynamic team that simplifies critical decision-making for commanders worldwide.

A data professional
Join the SitaWare Insight team in Denmark, a forward-thinking product organisation dedicated to driving innovation in defence technology. With a high focus on simplifying decision-making processes, the team comprises a cohesive group of skilled professionals, including a Project Manager, Product Manager, Architect, Developers and a System Tester. Collaborate in an environment committed to growth, improvement and maintaining excellence in our product – a responsibility that is pivotal to meeting the increasing demand from our global customers.

Drive data excellence
Shape the future of defence decision support in this hands-on Data Scientist role. Work on a broad spectrum of tasks, including data analyses, model development, collaboration with MLOps, deployment and performance monitoring in production. As a key player in advancing SitaWare Insight, you will contribute to new releases every half-year, introducing novel capabilities, bug fixes and overall product enhancements.

In short, you can look forward to:

  • Developing high-quality machine learning models to enhance decision support
  • Collaborating with MLOps for the seamless integration of models
  • Monitoring model performance in a dynamic production environment
  • Contributing to the growth, improvement and maintenance of SitaWare Insight


Proficient data expert
You are passionate about transforming data into actionable insights, and bring the following to the role:

  • Proven experience as a Data Scientist
  • Minimum of a Master’s or PhD in a relevant field (e.g. computer science, data science, cognitive science and statistics)
  • Demonstrated expertise in developing and implementing machine learning models
  • Strong programming skills in Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch
  • Proficiency in data preprocessing and feature engineering
  • Database knowledge for effective data management
  • Computer science skills supporting the overall development of the data science service like Docker and CI/CD pipelines
  • Solid understanding of model evaluation, documentation, visualisation of data-driven solutions and development best-practices
  • Appreciate teamwork and sparring with colleagues
  • Great communication skills
  • Proficient in English


Please note that you must be able to present a clean criminal record and have lived in a NATO/EU country for the past seven years as we work with security-classified projects. Read more here.

Never stop developing
Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish and uniquely people-centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. It is not just a place to work but a place to belong. You can look forward to joining our Employees Club offering almost 100 social/professional events a year – plenty to choose from. Our colleagues also highlight our canteen, which serves a variety of delicious and healthy dishes each day. In addition, we offer several employee benefits such as paid Home Internet, health insurance and a company pension scheme. Finally, we are always up for a friendly game of padel at our new padel court in Aarhus!

Start your development here
We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis as we wish to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so click Apply Now and send us your CV today. If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Preben Schmidt Nielsen, Senior Project Manager.

Get in touch

Mette Mørch Rasmussen

Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant

Title: AI Solutions Engineer (Netherlands based)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Us

Axelera AI is not your regular deep-tech startup. We are creating the next-generation AI platform to support anyone who wants to help advancing humanity and improve the world around us.

In just three years, we have raised a total of $120 million and have built a world-class team of 180+ employees (including 55+ PhDs with more than 40,000 citations), both remotely from 11 different countries and with offices in Belgium, Switzerland, Italy, the UK, headquartered at the High Tech Campus in Eindhoven, Netherlands.

We have also launched our Metis™ AI Platform, which achieves a 3-5x increase in efficiency and performance, and have visibility into a strong business pipeline exceeding $100 million.

Our unwavering commitment to innovation has firmly established us as a global industry pioneer.

Are you up for the challenge?

Position Overview:

We are seeking a talented and experienced AI Solutions Engineer to be based in Eindhoven or Amsterdam, with expertise in machine learning and computer vision to join our dynamic team. As a Solutions Engineer at Axelera AI, you will play a critical role in designing and implementing AI-driven solutions tailored to our clients' specific needs. You will work closely with clients, sales teams, and technical stakeholders to understand requirements, develop solution designs, and oversee the implementation of scalable and robust machine learning systems.

Responsibilities:


Work closely with clients to understand objectives, then design AI-driven machine learning and computer vision solutions to address their needs.
Develop and optimize computer vision architectures with a focus on GStreamer-based pipelines for enhanced video and data processing efficiency.
Collaborate with the sales team to craft proposals and effectively present solution designs and technical benefits to clients.
Oversee the implementation process, guiding cross-functional teams to ensure alignment with solution designs and project goals.
Work alongside data scientists and engineers to prototype, develop, and deploy machine learning models, with a focus on efficient GStreamer integration.
Conduct performance optimizations, troubleshoot solutions, and assess scalability for reliable solution delivery.
Stay current with industry advancements to drive innovation within the team.
Mentor junior team members, fostering knowledge-sharing and a collaborative work culture.


Requirements:


5+ years of experience in designing and implementing computer vision solutions, with specific expertise in GStreamer for pipeline optimization.
Strong knowledge of machine learning concepts, experience in developing, training, and deploying models.
Proficient in Python, C/C++, and machine learning libraries (e.g., PyTorch, OpenCV, TensorFlow) and highly experienced with GStreamer, CUDA, and TensorRT.
Skilled in integrating various hardware platforms, including cameras, LiDAR, and other sensors, with GStreamer.
Familiar with Linux (Ubuntu) and other operating systems.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to translate business needs into technical solutions.
Effective communication skills for engaging with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Familiarity with agile practices, DevOps, and CI/CD pipelines is advantageous.
Relevant certifications in machine learning, cloud computing, or architecture are a plus, along with a commitment to ongoing learning and innovation.


Location

We support relocation to Amsterdam or Eindhoven for talent based abroad and interested in this role. Please note that this position requires presence in the Eindhoven office approximately 3-5 times per month / as required by business & cannot be done remotely.

What We Offer

This is your chance to shape and be part of a dynamic, fast-growing, international organization. We offer an attractive compensation package, including a pension plan, extensive employee insurances and the option to get company shares.

An open culture that supports creativity and continual innovation is awaiting you. Collaborative ownership and freedom with responsibility is characteristic for the way we act and work as a team.

At Axelera AI, we wholeheartedly embrace equal opportunity and hold diversity in the highest regard. Our steadfast commitment is to cultivate a warm and inclusive environment that empowers and celebrates every member of our team. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds to join us in shaping the future of AI.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Moderation
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
APPLY HERE: Senior Data Scientist, Moderation




Job Description

Can you drive measurable value through the applied use of data science? Are you passionate about helping us create an online environment that is safe for kids?




Core Responsibilities:

The utilization of Data Science and AI is rapidly growing within the LEGO Group. We use the methodologies to discover deeper insights, make predictions, or generate recommendations to continue delivering world class learning-through play experiences to children.

You will be joining the Data Science & AI organisation, which is the home of 50 data scientists and engineering colleagues, distributed across our Denmark and UK offices.

You will be part of the moderation product team, working alongside Software and Data/MLOps Engineers, which has the purpose moderating the LEGO Group’s online channels to ensure that we have a safe digital experience for kids and adults. Additionally, you will get to work on Data Science opportunities in adjacent product teams in the Consumer Technology area as the need arises.




Your tasks will include:

Advise on the direction for the AI/ML systems for moderating online channels.
Ensure continuous high performance of the deployed moderation services and algorithms, defining and measuring key performances indicators, and conducting experiments.
Develop and implement customized moderation models.
Collaborating with stakeholders to ensure that data science work is delivering real value.
Provide actionable insights to stakeholders based on data analysis.
Staying up to date with AI & machine learning developments across the industry.
Work on adjacent Data Science opportunities and consulting on adjacent product team when required.
Contribute to our ways of working and help establish best practices.




Do you have what it takes?

We are looking for a candidate with emphasis on one or more of the following: data science, computer science, engineering, mathematics, or an equivalent quantitative subject area.

You have previous experience creating working ML and AI solutions in a large organization and are used to working in an agile cross functional setup and with a broad range of stakeholders.

Strong analytical skills with the ability to communicate complex data relationships effectively
Proficiency with Python (or similar languages) and its libraries for machine learning such as PySpark, scikit-learn, pandas and pytorch.
Practical experience in data science, spanning both analytics to derive the right solutions and implementation of Machine Learning models.
Collaborative spirit and a playful can-do attitude.
Persistent with a well-rounded view on creating solutions.
Experience with tools and platforms such as Databricks and MLflow for ML training and experimenting is highly desirable.
Experience in consumer engagement or content moderation domain will be considered a bonus.




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.







We are proud supporters of Women in Data®. Connect, engage and belong to the largest free female data community in the UK – visit: www.womenindata.co.uk to join our community.




“Stay connected! Follow us on LinkedIn for updates on career opportunities and more.”

Show more

Title: Experienced Process Engineers & Scientists Pipeline - Greater Copenhagen Area & Hillerød
Description:
Calling all experienced Process Engineers and Scientists! Are you an experienced Process Engineer or Scientist looking for a new challenge? Do you want to work for a fast-growing pharmaceutical company that is dedicated to improving the lives of millions of patients worldwide? If so, we want to hear from you!

If you are interested in bringing your skills and experience to a team that aims to improve lives of millions of patients worldwide, and you already have experience working with data analysis, process systems, descriptive and prescriptive analytics, then you might be the next Experienced Process Engineer or Scientist to join one of our many production sites in the Greater Copenhagen Area or Hillerød, Denmark! Read on and apply today!

The Position
We are looking for Experienced Process Engineers & Scientists who have an interest in understanding pharmaceutical processes, developing monitoring tools and analyzing data for recommendations and improvements. Furthermore, you have an interest in business impact and understanding how interconnected decisions play a crucial role when manufacturing pharmaceuticals.

Specifically, you have several years of professional experience in:



Analyzing large amounts of data for extracting correlation and causation for process understanding.
Working and understanding data from Quality Control (QC) and Quality Assurance (QA).
Developing, maintaining, and recommending statistical process control charts for process monitoring.
Utilizing a science, data-based approach for quantifying process deviations.
Operating in a team-based approach for recommending process improvements and optimizations.
Handling deviations when processes do not operate as intended.
Writing and executing change requests to implement improvements including validation when required.
Developing maintenance strategies to optimize running time.
Coordinating with other process owners in the department to ensure optimal production capacity at all times.
Taking part in cross-functional meetings to align and further develop processes across the production site.




In this role, you will have the opportunity to develop and enhance your professional and personal skills while shaping the future of manufacturing across our organization, in close collaboration with other colleagues in Novo Nordisk.

Qualifications

Experienced Process Engineers & Scientists candidates should have the following qualifications:



Bachelor’s or master’s degree in chemistry, natural science, mechanical engineering, production engineering or a related field.
Solid experience in manufacturing, with GMP experience being an advantage.
Understanding of scientific principles required for manufacturing pharmaceutical substances related to the interaction of chemistry and equipment.
Ability to monitor data and extract information independently.
Curiosity for connecting the understanding of process science to product quality.
Appetite for solving complex problems applying a systematic approach to manage complexity and reach feasible applicable solutions.
Professional proficiency in verbal and written English. Knowledge of Danish or other languages is considered a plus.




For Experienced Process Engineers & Scientists, it is key that you understand how to convey complex information to varying audiences, so we get everyone on board. In this role you will collaborate with different departments and have a broad landscape of stakeholders.

Apply and be matched with multiple job opportunities
When you apply to our pipeline, you will be considered for all Experienced and Senior Process Engineer & Scientist positions across Product Supply & Quality (PSQ) in the locations where you have shown interest in. If you prefer a specific production or business area, please indicate it in your CV, and we will do our best to find the right fit for you.

We continuously match your profile with all suitable positions to ensure that you don't miss out on any life-changing career opportunities. This means that you will automatically be considered for all openings in the area across our factories. Don't wait any longer to take the next step in your career - apply now and let us help you find the perfect match!

We review applications continuously and if we identify a match, you will be invited for an interview. When an opportunity arises, we will reach out, tell you about the position and invite you for an interview with the Hiring Manager. You will only be contacted if we find a relevant position that matches your profile, and we have a Hiring Manager who is interested in your profile.

We will keep your application for up to six months ensuring the best opportunities to provide a strong match for open positions, unless you inform us that you wish to withdraw.

Ready to elevate your career? Our talent pipelines offer diverse opportunities tailored to various skill sets and goals. If you still feel unsure, we cordially invite you to investigate which pathway aligns with your strengths and aspirations. Embrace the future and unlock your potential by ex-ploring our talent pipelines: Novo Nordisk Talent Pipelines.

Checklist when applying


Please answer the questions asked when you apply. We use your answers to identify possible match between you and our open positions.
Unlock your profile, which you create when applying. This will allow us to match your profile with our open positions. The correct setting states ‘Profile visibility: Novo Nordisk Recruiter Worldwide’.




About The Greater Copenhagen Area

We have many different sites in the Greater Copenhagen Area: in Bagsværd, Gentofte, Kirke Værløse, Køge, Lyngby and Måløv, so remember to clearly state which locations you are interested in applying to.

About Site Hillerød

Site Hillerød is an innovative and fast-growing production site. With over 4,000 talented employees, we work together to drive change for people living with serious chronic diseases. The site is in beautiful natural surroundings, and we offer a diverse array of career paths at all educational levels. Join our vibrant community at Site Hillerød and ramp up your career while we ramp up our production! Get to know us better - visit our Site Hillerød career page.

Novo Nordisk Hillerød

Contact
If you have any questions, feel free to contact us on the following email: processengineeringdk@novonordisk.com.

Deadline
Apply before 31 March 2025.

Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, and you are encouraged to apply as soon as possible. You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV.

To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your CV.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.
Show more

Title: Software Engineer (with a passion for data)
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you a software engineer with a passion for data? or, a data engineer with an interest in creating software solutions?

Either way, this role is what you've been waiting for if you're passionate about data and software!

The partner area develops innovative IT solutions to help our partners optimize their selling processes, achieve seamless content integrations, and effectively capture sales data.

Responsibilities





Work closely with product managers, designers, data specialists, and fellow engineers to
Gather and interpret requirements
Transform requirements into effective technical solutions
Adopt DevOps principles
Design, code, deploy, and maintain backend services and data pipelines
Prioritize the success of the group with a strong team-first mentality
Actively support colleagues in achieving shared goals




Requirements





Demonstrated expertise in foundational programming concepts is essential.
Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts, cloud technologies, data modelling, data governance.
Relevant experience using SQL, dbt, Python, Spark, Databricks, AWS stack or any other cloud technologies or similar tech stack.
Ability to take end-to-end responsibility of designing and developing data products starting from requirement scoping to delivery having a keen eye for automation.
Experience in building efficient data pipelines, ability to navigate through complex scripts and work on performance tuning.
Experience with agile ways of working
Focused on quality at all stages of the software lifecycle
Ability to troubleshoot, research, and work through complex problems
Excellent written and verbal communication skills




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different underrepresented backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. For all candidates, if you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

HTML:
Job Description

Are you a software engineer with a passion for data? or, a data engineer with an interest in creating software solutions?

Either way, this role is what you've been waiting for if you're passionate about data and software!

The partner area develops innovative IT solutions to help our partners optimize their selling processes, achieve seamless content integrations, and effectively capture sales data.

Responsibilities



  • Work closely with product managers, designers, data specialists, and fellow engineers to
  • Gather and interpret requirements
  • Transform requirements into effective technical solutions
  • Adopt DevOps principles
  • Design, code, deploy, and maintain backend services and data pipelines
  • Prioritize the success of the group with a strong team-first mentality
  • Actively support colleagues in achieving shared goals



Requirements



  • Demonstrated expertise in foundational programming concepts is essential.
  • Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts, cloud technologies, data modelling, data governance.
  • Relevant experience using SQL, dbt, Python, Spark, Databricks, AWS stack or any other cloud technologies or similar tech stack.
  • Ability to take end-to-end responsibility of designing and developing data products starting from requirement scoping to delivery having a keen eye for automation.
  • Experience in building efficient data pipelines, ability to navigate through complex scripts and work on performance tuning.
  • Experience with agile ways of working
  • Focused on quality at all stages of the software lifecycle
  • Ability to troubleshoot, research, and work through complex problems
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills



Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different underrepresented backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. For all candidates, if you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.

Title: Software Developer (Remote)
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
🥞 About ‘All Gravy’

The next generation of employees are used to apps like Instagram, TikTok and Spotify in their personal life - but when they go to work at a restaurant chain or retail store, they’re met with software created before they were born.

We are modernising the tools for frontline employees and transforming the experience into one that is engaging and motivating; making their lives easier - from getting paid to developing their careers.

We’re innovating on the whole employee journey: from being recruited, onboarded, growing skills, knowing when to work, and connecting with co-workers.

We've grown incredibly over the last year and are looking to accelerate further. We already work with some of the most exciting brands in the Nordics and the UK (Pizza Pilgrims, Honest Burgers, Ottolenghi, Q8, 7-Eleven, Best Western) and we're now expanding even more into the United Kingdom and the Netherlands.

We're backed by some of Europe’s leading investors (Moonfire, Upfin, Founders, Nordic Web Ventures) and Angels (Bradley Horowitz (GP, Wisdom Ventures), Terese Hougaard (Partner, Atomico), Phil Chambers (CEO, Peakon).

Who are we?

We are passionate, have an ambitious mission, and our users love us! ♥️

And this is just the beginning. The best is yet to come, and we hope to bring you on board to achieve this mission together. We are a fun and hard-working team that is looking for passionate professionals to join our mission. Join us to shape the future for shift & gig workers 🚀

🤩 The role: Software Developer

We are looking for a software developer who is ambitious and ready to take on a high-responsibility role in a venture-funded startup.

The ideal candidate is able to work the full stack of applications at All Gravy, but especially experienced in React js / React Native. We have chosen to have a full-fledged TypeScript-based tech stack in All Gravy which means our current developer team seamlessly switches between development tasks.

We expect the person taking on the position to be able to take on full responsibility for projects end-to-end.

😎 The Job And Responsibilities


Developing features in our React/React Native applications
Improving the GraphQL APIs serving our applications
Monitor app usage & performance, identify and solve bugs
Code reviews, architecture, continuously help improving our team & processes


All Gravy is undergoing high growth; hence the job and responsibilities will develop over time, and there will be plenty of opportunities for you to learn and grow.

Who are you?

You have great energy, a good sense of humour & have a disciplined problem solver mindset. You should enjoy working in the dynamic startup environment, like to initiate new projects - but also get them over the line.

We look for employees who like being part of a team, are real team players, and have a mindset of learning & growing.

We expect you to:


Speak and write English fluently
Have 2+ years of experience in your field
Thrive in a very fast-paced environment.
Be passionate, organized and self-driven.
Be in a timezone within +- 2 hours of CET (fully remote work allowed)
Have a good sense of humour - be willing to contribute to this being a fun place to work
Be excited about building a big company from a small starting point, and want to grow personally on the way there
Experience in developing user-facing AI applications is a plus


The ideal candidate has experience in:


Typescript
React Native
ReactJS
GraphQL


An advantage if you have experience in:


NestJS
MongoDB
ChatGPT API


We are in the midst of building an awesome company and can't wait to onboard you - therefore we will hire the right candidate as soon as we find him/her.

💡 Even if you do not tick every box on this page, you might be the perfect fit for the job! We treasure our learning culture and encourage all humble people to apply.

💎 What We Offer

We are a motivated, young and dynamic team working closely together on our mission – at the moment we are 26 people and cannot wait to welcome the next person to the team!

We have fun together while collaborating to create a product people love and aspire to be the best place to work.

Our office is in central Copenhagen and has all the perks you’d expect from a startup - lunches, lots of social events (padel tournaments, dinners, wine-tastings, strategy offsites, you name it!), fussball table, a stocked fridge with snacks & drinks, and a regular Friday bar!

Title: Senior manager, Data scientist in Corporate Finance
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

This role is a strong opportunity to elevate digitalization in financial planning in the LEGO Group and to gain E2E knowledge on the LEGO Group's financial processes and grow a strong network across the organization!

As part of the Corporate reporting and planning team, you will play a key role in using data and drive innovation and continuous improvement in the financial planning processes and build on your already excellent finance data scientist career!

No relocation assistance is offered for this position


Core Responsibilities





Drive the aspiration on business analysis and push the data focus in defining the new financial planning processes
Leverage data driven forecasting in financial planning e.g. via driver-based planning, predictive planning and sensible machine learning to drive automation and reduced cycle time with less effort
Engage with partners across Finance to drive the implementation and support the change journey
Be one of the subject matter experts training and supporting colleagues building confidence in the data driven approach
Co-drive validation and recommendation on the model selection in a new forecast engine in collaboration with the technical developers
Prepare the reporting supporting transparency in the models and building a storyline on the development




Play your part in our team succeeding

Do you have what it takes?

We expect our preferred candidate to hold a Master's degree in Data science/Data engineering/ Economics / Finance or similar





5-8 years of experience with data science or data engineering, preferably with a focus on finance
Strong analytical skills and experience with predictive planning/ machine learning /Python/R or similar
Superb communication and collaboration skills
Location in Billund or Copenhagen office




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different underrepresented backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. If you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.

Title: R/D Assistant
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Us

REDUCED is committed to producing high-quality, upcycled savory taste solutions, and is looking for a dedicated Intern to carry out and support fermentation trials and execute chemical and sensory analysis. The focus of the role will be to carry out different fermentation trials and perform chemical and microbiological analysis of the products obtained from these trials. Moreover, you will also help to execute sensory analysis and analyse data deriving from them.

Position Overview

You’ll be pivotal in executing and organizing fermentation trials in a BSL-2 microbiological laboratory, and microbiological and chemical analysis (HPLC and GC-MS). You will also need to design and execute sensory evaluation tests of new and existing products. The role requires that you have in-depth microbiological knowledge, knowledge of good microbiological practices, and experience in sample preparation and/or derivatization for HPLC analysis of amino acids, nucleotides, organic acids and sugars. You also need to be experienced in GC-MS sample preparation and data analysis. Knowledge in sensory methods is an advantage.

Key Responsibilities


Plan, design, and execute fermentation trials. You need to be able to carry out these tasks autonomously making sure to have a correct set-up and correct controls. You need to be organised, plan well and in advance. You need to work neatly and be tidy, and avoid any contamination.
Design, plan, and execute sensory evaluation test of food products. You will need to perform preliminary tastings and design consumer and sensory trials, preparing smaples, collecting data and analyzing the results.
Carry out chemicals and microbiological analysis. You need to prepare samples for HPLC and GC-MS analysis. This can involve sample preparation such as correct dilution, filtration, manual derivatisation, preparation of mobile phases and chemicals needed for these analysis. You need to be able to prepare microbiological media, and work in a BSL-2 lab


Who We’re Looking For

You are structured with a sharp eye for detail, you are analytical, and operate in an organised manner. You ensure your safety and safety of the samples you produce. You work tidly, keep good track of the protocols, samples, and data deriving from various trials and analysis you execute. You are a fast learner and enjoy working in the lab.

The Ideal Candidate Has The Following Qualifications


Minimum a Bachelor’s degree in Food Science, Microbiology, Sensory Science, or related discipline.
Strong knowledge of food microbiology.
Experience with sensory methods (flash profiling, descriptive analysis, consumer studies).
Experience with HPLC and GC-MS analysis and data analysis.
Knowledge of statistical analysis (e.g., Excel, Rstudio, MatLab, Pyton).
Fluent in English.


Personal Attributes


Strong drive and adaptability suited for a dynamic R&D workplace.
Enjoys practical work as well as data analysis.
Good at planning and working in a structured manner.
Independent and proactive attitude.
Excited to learn new things.


Reports To: Fermentation Scientist and Flavour Scientist

Apply Now!

If you’re ready to take on this challenge at REDUCED and work in a cool and dynamic setting, we’d love to hear from you!

Title: Solutions Engineer - North Europe
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Company Description

About CyberArk:

CyberArk (NASDAQ: CYBR), is the global leader in Identity Security. Centered on privileged access management, CyberArk provides the most comprehensive security offering for any identity – human or machine – across business applications, distributed workforces, hybrid cloud workloads and throughout the DevOps lifecycle. The world’s leading organizations trust CyberArk to help secure their most critical assets. To learn more about CyberArk, visit our CyberArk blogs or follow us on Twitter, LinkedIn or Facebook.

Job Description

CyberArk, is looking for a Solutions Engineer for Presales, covering the North Europe

In this role, you will combine technical knowledge with sales skills and are ultimately responsible for the technical win during the sales cycle. You are responsible for actively driving and managing the technology evaluation stage of the sales process which will require you to work with multiple stakeholders. You will match the customers/prospects business requirements to how the CyberArk Identity Security Platform can assist from a technical perspective. Therefore, you must be able to articulate technology and product positioning to both business and technical users. You must be able to identify all technical issues to assure complete customer satisfaction through all stages of the sales process.

Above all, we are looking for someone that can communicate the CyberArk value and be able to design an optimal solution for complex customer infrastructure and datacenter environments on a global scale.

To be successful, you must be comfortable in a dynamic atmosphere of a technical organization with a rapidly expanding customer base, possess strong communication and interpersonal skills as you will be required to build relationships across multiple levels of the organizations. Being organized, analytical & having the ability to eliminate sales obstacles through creative and adaptive approaches is also essential.

Responsibilities:



Provide technical pre-sales hands-on support.
Collaborate with Account Executives throughout the entire sales process.
Effectively present CyberArk’s technical value proposition to customers and partners.
Ensure the success of customer proof-of-concepts (POCs).
Respond to the functional and technical aspects of RFIs/RFPs.
Proactively seek new sales opportunities by developing technical relationships with prospective accounts.
Document client feature requests and issues in CyberArk internal systems.
Support CyberArk seminars and industry trade shows in the region.
Communicate customer requirements to Product Management teams.
Develop technical knowledge and skills of CyberArk solutions and related technologies.
Travel within the region (25%-50%). 



Qualifications



3+ years of experience as a Solutions Engineer and/or Professional Services Engineer, or equivalent experience.
High-level understanding of security concepts and the development of security roles within organizations that meet functional, technical, and regulatory requirements.
Strong hands-on technical abilities.
Hands-on experience with Windows Administration, Active Directory and Linux operating systems.
Knowledge in the leading cloud service providers: AWS, Azure, and GCP.
Understand complex customer environments and design optimal architectural solutions for them.
Fluent Danish and English language skills essential
What could set you apart as a top candidate:
Prior experience with CyberArk Identity Security solutions.
Experience in Privilege Access Management (PAM), Identity and Access Management (IAM), or Identity Management (IDM) solutions.
Knowledge and understanding of containerized environments and CI/CD toolchains.

Title: Software Test Engineer - start your career here
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Software Test Engineer – start your career here
Would you like to play a role in testing high-quality software that help improve the daily lives of our customers within the defence sector? Here is your opportunity to become part of an international work environment filled with talented colleagues!

The position
Being our new colleague, you will help ensuring the continuous high level of test and quality assurance throughout our entire feature development process, emphasizing early test involvement. In addition to that, you will make a difference by…

Being a vital part of the development process by asking all the critical questions, understanding the assignment, ensuring close cooperation with all stakeholders like developers, product owners, designers, and project managers.
Creating and executing tests, ensure new features have a testable design, create test documentation, ensure verification of training content and software installations.
Ensuring the quality assurance and quality control processes and standards are followed in the most efficient way to create qualitative software.
Participating in all test activities like System Test, Bug Hunt and Field test etc.



If you are not sure what all of the above is yet, experienced colleagues will ensure to teach you and support you on your path to specialise in software testing.

A new team in Copenhagen
Located in our brand-new office space in the city center of Copenhagen, a short walk from the metro at Marmorkirken, you will become a part of a larger group of 50 Engineers, Architects and Testers - all working to ensure that our AI platform is the best of its kind in relation to data collection- and management.

You will become a part of our on-the-way-to-be established Insights team in Copenhagen. Our aim is to establish a scrum team of around eight skilled colleagues – where you will be one. Besides the Insight development team, you will become a part of the overall Test Team in our Defence business unit, which consists of 46 Testers, Test Managers, Test Interns and student workers across multiple locations.

SitaWare Insight is a modern microservice-based solution made up of primarily Angular and Java Spring Boot services. A variety of cloud-native components are used for supporting the environment, as it must be deployable to on-prem, private and public clouds.

Your Qualifications
Looking for a new colleague, we are hoping to find someone who holds a Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or something similar. Furthermore, we are looking for someone who knows about or have tried hands with software testing, maybe through their studies or with a few years of experience in a similar role. If you have a background within Defence, that would be an advantage but it is not a requirement.

At SitaWare Insight, you can expect to work with the following technologies and tools, so experience herein is beneficial:


Machine Learning / AI
Linux CLI
Docker and Kubernetes
Cypress
JIRA, Xray and R4J



In this role, you might experience a small amount of travel. Expect a maximum of 5-10 days a year.

Please note that you must be able to present a clean criminal record and have lived in a NATO and/or an EU country for the past seven years as we work with security-classified projects. Read more here.

Never stop developing
Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish and uniquely people-centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. It is not just a place to work but a place to belong.

You can look forward to joining our Employees Club offering almost 100 events of both social and professional character a year – plenty to choose from. Our colleagues also highlight our canteen, which serves a variety of delicious and healthy dishes each day. In addition, we offer several employee benefits such as paid Home Internet, health insurance and a company pension scheme. Finally, we are always up for a friendly game of padel at our new padel court in Aarhus!

Start your development here
We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis as we wish to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so click Apply Now and send us your CV today. If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Rebecca Johannsen, Senior Test Project Manager.

Get in touch

Julie Lysbjerg Christensen

Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant


Show more
